**Luke Skywalker** , a [Force-sensitive](/wiki/Force-sensitive "Force-
sensitive") [human](/wiki/Human "Human") [male](/wiki/Gender "Gender"), was a
legendary [Jedi Master](/wiki/Jedi_Master "Jedi Master") who fought in the
[Galactic Civil War](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War "Galactic Civil War") during the
[reign](/wiki/Imperial_Era "Imperial Era") of the [Galactic
Empire](/wiki/Galactic_Empire "Galactic Empire"). Along with his

, a [Force-sensitive](/wiki/Force-sensitive "Force-
sensitive") [human](/wiki/Human "Human") [male](/wiki/Gender "Gender"), was a
legendary [Jedi Master](/wiki/Jedi_Master "Jedi Master") who fought in the
[Galactic Civil War](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War "Galactic Civil War") during the
[reign](/wiki/Imperial_Era "Imperial Era") of the [Galactic
Empire](/wiki/Galactic_Empire "Galactic Empire"). Along with his companions,
[Princess](/wiki/Prince "Prince") [Leia
Organa](/wiki/Leia_Skywalker_Organa_Solo "Leia Skywalker Organa Solo") and
[General](/wiki/General "General") [Han Solo](/wiki/Han_Solo "Han Solo"),
Skywalker served as a revolutionary on the side of the [Alliance to Restore
the Republic](/wiki/Alliance_to_Restore_the_Republic "Alliance to Restore the
Republic")--an organization committed to the downfall of the
[Galactic](/wiki/The_galaxy "The galaxy") [Empire](/wiki/Politics#Empire
"Politics") and the restoration of [democracy](/wiki/Democracy "Democracy").
Following the war, Skywalker became a living legend, and was remembered as one
of the greatest [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") in [galactic
history](/wiki/Timeline_of_galactic_history "Timeline of galactic history").

BBY](/wiki/19_BBY "19 BBY"). As a result of Amidala's [death](/wiki/Death

"Padmé Amidala"), Luke Skywalker was [born](/wiki/Reproduction "Reproduction")
along with his [twin](/wiki/Twin "Twin") sister, Leia, in [19
BBY](/wiki/19_BBY "19 BBY"). As a result of Amidala's [death](/wiki/Death
"Death") and Anakin's fall to the [dark side of the
Force](/wiki/Dark_side_of_the_Force "Dark side of the Force"), the Skywalker
[children](/wiki/Youngling "Youngling") were separated and sent into hiding,
with Leia adopted by the [royal family](/wiki/House_of_Organa "House of
Organa") of [Alderaan](/wiki/Alderaan "Alderaan") while Luke was raised by his
[relatives](/wiki/Lars_family "Lars family") on [Tatooine](/wiki/Tatooine
"Tatooine"). Longing for a life of adventure and purpose, Skywalker joined the
Rebellion and began learning the ways of [the Force](/wiki/The_Force "The
Force") under the guidance of Jedi Master [Obi-Wan Kenobi](/wiki/Obi-
Wan_Kenobi "Obi-Wan Kenobi"), whose first [apprentice](/wiki/Padawan
"Padawan") was Luke's own [father](/wiki/Parent "Parent"). During the [Battle
of Yavin](/wiki/Battle_of_Yavin "Battle of Yavin") in [0 BBY](/wiki/0_BBY "0
BBY"), Skywalker saved the Alliance from annihilation by destroying the
Empire's [planet](/wiki/Planet "Planet")-killing
[superweapon](/wiki/Superweapon "Superweapon"), the [Death
Star](/wiki/DS-1_Death_Star_Mobile_Battle_Station "DS-1 Death Star Mobile
Battle Station"). He continued his [training](/wiki/Jedi_training "Jedi
training") in the [years](/wiki/Standard_year "Standard year") that followed,
determined to become a Jedi Knight like his father

determined to become a Jedi Knight like his father before him, and found a new

"Yoda"). After his master's death, Skywalker participated in the [Battle of
Endor](/wiki/Battle_of_Endor "Battle of Endor") in [4 ABY](/wiki/4_ABY "4
ABY"), during which he confronted the [Sith Lord](/wiki/Sith_Lord "Sith Lord")
[Darth](/wiki/Darth "Darth") Vader, whom he [learned](/wiki/Duel_on_Cloud_City
"Duel on Cloud City") was in fact his father, Anakin Skywalker. With Luke's
help, Anakin returned to the [light side of the
Force](/wiki/Light_side_of_the_Force "Light side of the Force") by killing the
[Emperor](/wiki/Galactic_Emperor "Galactic Emperor") and [Dark Lord of the
Sith](/wiki/Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith "Dark Lord of the Sith") [Darth
Sidious](/wiki/Darth_Sidious "Darth Sidious") at the cost of his own life,
fulfilling his destiny as the [Chosen One](/wiki/Chosen_One "Chosen One").
Following the Battle of Endor, Skywalker trained his sister as a first Jedi
apprentice on [Ajan Kloss](/wiki/Ajan_Kloss "Ajan Kloss"), but Leia ended her
training after the birth of her son and seeing his death as a result of
finishing her knighthood.

With the [Sith](/wiki/Sith "Sith")'s destruction and the subsequent
[capitulation](/wiki/Galactic_Concordance "Galactic Concordance") of the
Empire, Skywalker traveled across the [galaxy](/wiki/Galaxy "Galaxy") during
[New Republic](/wiki/New_Republic "New Republic") [Era](/wiki/New_Republic_Era
"New Republic Era"), searching for knowledge that would aid him in rebuilding
the [Jedi Order](/wiki/Jedi_Order "Jedi Order"). In [9 ABY](/wiki/9_ABY "9
ABY"), Skywalker [rescued](/wiki/Second_rescue_of_Grogu "Second rescue of
Grogu") [Grogu](/wiki/Din_Grogu "Din Grogu"), a
[Mandalorian](/wiki/Mandalorian "Mandalorian") Force-sensitive child that
belonged to the same [species](/wiki/Yoda%27s_species "Yoda's species") as
Yoda, from [Moff](/wiki/Moff "Moff") [Gideon](/wiki/Gideon "Gideon")'s
[forces](/wiki/Gideon%27s_Imperial_remnant "Gideon's Imperial remnant"), and
after temporarily taking the child as an apprentice on [Ossus](/wiki/Ossus
"Ossus"). During the training, Skywalker was visited by Anakin's former
padawan, [Ahsoka Tano](/wiki/Ahsoka_Tano "Ahsoka Tano"), where they discussed
Grogu and how Skywalker sensed that the child's heart was not in relearning
the Jedi path. After Grogu's caregiver, [Din Djarin](/wiki/Din_Djarin "Din
Djarin"), visited the planet bearing a [gift](/wiki/Din_Grogu%27s_armor

Grogu and how Skywalker sensed that the child's heart was not in relearning
the Jedi path. After Grogu's caregiver, [Din Djarin](/wiki/Din_Djarin "Din
Djarin"), visited the planet bearing a [gift](/wiki/Din_Grogu%27s_armor "Din
Grogu's armor") for Grogu, Skywalker offered him with a choice, accept the
gift and return to the Djarin, or taking [Yoda's
lightsaber](/wiki/Yoda%27s_second_lightsaber "Yoda's second lightsaber") and
continue with his Jedi training. Grogu chose to return to Djarin, while
Skywalker bid Tano farewell as she departed for ways unknown.

Skywalker later took his sister's son, [Ben Solo](/wiki/Ben_Solo "Ben Solo"),
by [15 ABY](/wiki/15_ABY "15 ABY") who inherited the
[bloodline](/wiki/Skywalker_family "Skywalker family") in the Force and had
the potential for limitless power, as an apprentice. Both
[traveled](/wiki/Mission_to_Elphrona "Mission to Elphrona") to
[Elphrona](/wiki/Elphrona "Elphrona") to study lost Jedi lore, where the trio
encountered the [Knights of Ren](/wiki/Knights_of_Ren "Knights of Ren"), while
Solo began to be groomed by [Snoke](/wiki/Snoke "Snoke"), a
[humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") being powerful in the Force. In [21
ABY](/wiki/21_ABY "21 ABY"), Skywalker started feeling an increasing darkness
in the Force and having dark visions that frequently came to him in meditation
and undertook a [quest to find](/wiki/Quest_for_Exegol "Quest for Exegol") the
hidden world of [Exegol](/wiki/Exegol "Exegol"). Skywalker journeyed

ABY](/wiki/21_ABY "21 ABY"), Skywalker started feeling an increasing darkness
in the Force and having dark visions that frequently came to him in meditation
and undertook a [quest to find](/wiki/Quest_for_Exegol "Quest for Exegol") the
hidden world of [Exegol](/wiki/Exegol "Exegol"). Skywalker journeyed to
[Tython](/wiki/Tython "Tython") where upon meditating, he saw a vision of
Exegol and faced nine wraiths when the force ghost of Anakin Skywalker
appeared next to him. Following this, Skywalker was able to defeat
[Kiza](/wiki/Kiza "Kiza") and the spirit of [Exim
Panshard](/wiki/Exim_Panshard "Exim Panshard") but was ultimately unable to
locate Exegol after failing to [track down](/wiki/Mission_to_Pasaana "Mission
to Pasaana") an [assassin](/wiki/Assassin "Assassin") called [Ochi](/wiki/Ochi
"Ochi").

In [28 ABY](/wiki/28_ABY "28 ABY"), Skywalker, glimpsing the darkness in Solo,
briefly contemplated killing him, causing Solo to fall to the dark side. With
[destruction](/wiki/Destruction_of_the_Jedi_Temple "Destruction of the Jedi
Temple") of his [temple](/wiki/Jedi_Temple_of_Luke_Skywalker "Jedi Temple of
Luke Skywalker") and the deaths of all his students convinced a haunted and
regretful Skywalker that the [time](/wiki/Time "Time") had come for the Jedi
to end. Skywalker therefore sought [exile](/wiki/Exile_\(punishment\) "Exile
\(punishment\)") on the [distant](/wiki/Unknown_Regions "Unknown Regions")
world of [Ahch-To](/wiki/Ahch-To "Ahch-To"), having elected to live out his
remaining [days](/wiki/Standard_day "Standard day") as a [hermit](/wiki/Hermit
"Hermit")

his students convinced a haunted and
regretful Skywalker that the [time](/wiki/Time "Time") had come for the Jedi
to end. Skywalker therefore sought [exile](/wiki/Exile_\(punishment\) "Exile
\(punishment\)") on the [distant](/wiki/Unknown_Regions "Unknown Regions")
world of [Ahch-To](/wiki/Ahch-To "Ahch-To"), having elected to live out his
remaining [days](/wiki/Standard_day "Standard day") as a [hermit](/wiki/Hermit
"Hermit") despite the galaxy's pleas for help during the [rise](/wiki/Cold_War
"Cold War") of the [First Order](/wiki/First_Order "First Order"). His
solitude was interrupted in [34 ABY](/wiki/34_ABY "34 ABY"), shortly after the
[fall](/wiki/Hosnian_Cataclysm "Hosnian Cataclysm") of the New Republic,
resulting in a chain of events that led Skywalker to play [one last, momentous
role](/wiki/Battle_of_Crait "Battle of Crait") in the conflict between light
and darkness. Although he [passed away into the Force](/wiki/Force_spirit
"Force spirit"), his legend would spread throughout the galaxy, rekindling a
spark of hope in the enemies of the First Order. Before his death, Skywalker
declared that the Jedi Order would not die with him, having trained a final
apprentice: the [Jakku](/wiki/Jakku "Jakku") [scavenger](/wiki/Scavenger
"Scavenger") known as [Rey](/wiki/Rey_Skywalker "Rey Skywalker").

A [year later](/wiki/35_ABY "35 ABY"), Skywalker's spirit communed with Rey
during the final days of the [war](/wiki/First_Order-Resistance_War "First
Order-Resistance War"). The Jedi apprentice had exiled herself to Ahch-To,
following in Skywalker's example. However, he urged Rey to
[confront](/wiki/Battle_of_Exegol "Battle of Exegol") her
[grandfather](/wiki/Palpatine_family "Palpatine family"), the
[resurrected](/wiki/Cloning

Skywalker").

A [year later](/wiki/35_ABY "35 ABY"), Skywalker's spirit communed with Rey
during the final days of the [war](/wiki/First_Order-Resistance_War "First
Order-Resistance War"). The Jedi apprentice had exiled herself to Ahch-To,
following in Skywalker's example. However, he urged Rey to
[confront](/wiki/Battle_of_Exegol "Battle of Exegol") her
[grandfather](/wiki/Palpatine_family "Palpatine family"), the
[resurrected](/wiki/Cloning "Cloning") Darth Sidious. Believing he had been
wrong, Skywalker told Rey that a Jedi's destiny was to confront fear.
Following the Emperor's destruction, the spirits of Skywalker and his sister
watched over Rey as she buried their lightsabers in Skywalker's [childhood
home](/wiki/Lars_Homestead "Lars Homestead") on Tatooine and adopted the
Skywalker name as her own to honor their legacy.

During Yoda's training, the Force Priestesses prophesied the coming of another
Skywalker.

During the [Clone Wars](/wiki/Clone_Wars "Clone Wars"), [Jedi
Master](/wiki/Jedi_Master "Jedi Master") [Yoda](/wiki/Yoda "Yoda") set out on
a journey to discover the secrets of [immortality](/wiki/Force_spirit "Force
spirit"). His journey took him to [Moraband](/wiki/Moraband "Moraband"), the
ancient [Sith](/wiki/Sith "Sith") homeworld, where he faced
[visions](/wiki/Force_vision "Force vision") of the future. At the end of his
journey, the [Force Priestess](/wiki/Force_Priestesses "Force Priestesses"),
[Serenity](/wiki/Serenity "Serenity"), who guided his journey told him

discover the secrets of [immortality](/wiki/Force_spirit "Force
spirit"). His journey took him to [Moraband](/wiki/Moraband "Moraband"), the
ancient [Sith](/wiki/Sith "Sith") homeworld, where he faced
[visions](/wiki/Force_vision "Force vision") of the future. At the end of his
journey, the [Force Priestess](/wiki/Force_Priestesses "Force Priestesses"),
[Serenity](/wiki/Serenity "Serenity"), who guided his journey told him that
there was another Skywalker, and Yoda heard his voice from the future say so
as well.[20] These events alluded to the birth and destiny of Luke Skywalker,
as well as his [twin](/wiki/Twin "Twin") sister
[Leia](/wiki/Leia_Skywalker_Organa_Solo "Leia Skywalker Organa Solo").[10]

The son of Anakin Skywalker and Padmé Amidala, Luke Skywalker was born mere
days after the formation of the Galactic Empire.

Luke Skywalker was [born](/wiki/Reproduction "Reproduction") in [19
BBY](/wiki/19_BBY "19 BBY")[3] on the [asteroid](/wiki/Asteroid "Asteroid")
field of [Polis Massa](/wiki/Polis_Massa "Polis Massa")[11] two
[days](/wiki/Standard_day "Standard day") after the
[proclamation](/wiki/Proclamation_of_the_New_Order "Proclamation of the New
Order") of the [Galactic Empire](/wiki/Galactic_Empire "Galactic Empire").[2]
He[1] and his twin sister, Leia, who was born minutes after him, are the
children of [Galactic Republic](/wiki/Galactic_Republic "Galactic Republic")
[Senator](/wiki/Senator "Senator") [Padmé

"Polis Massa")[11] two
[days](/wiki/Standard_day "Standard day") after the
[proclamation](/wiki/Proclamation_of_the_New_Order "Proclamation of the New
Order") of the [Galactic Empire](/wiki/Galactic_Empire "Galactic Empire").[2]
He[1] and his twin sister, Leia, who was born minutes after him, are the
children of [Galactic Republic](/wiki/Galactic_Republic "Galactic Republic")
[Senator](/wiki/Senator "Senator") [Padmé Amidala](/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala
"Padmé Amidala"), who [died](/wiki/Death "Death") shortly after the births,
and [Jedi Knight](/wiki/Jedi_Knight "Jedi Knight") [Anakin
Skywalker](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker"), who had recently fallen
to the [dark side of the Force](/wiki/Dark_side_of_the_Force "Dark side of the
Force"). To protect the children from the Empire and their father, the
now-[Sith Lord](/wiki/Sith_Lord "Sith Lord") Darth Vader, [Obi-Wan
Kenobi](/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi "Obi-Wan Kenobi") personally sent the infant Luke
to be raised by Anakin's stepbrother, [Owen Lars](/wiki/Owen_Lars "Owen Lars")
and his [wife](/wiki/Marriage "Marriage"), [Beru](/wiki/Beru_Whitesun_Lars
"Beru Whitesun Lars") on the [planet](/wiki/Planet "Planet")
[Tatooine](/wiki/Tatooine "Tatooine"), while Senator [Bail
Organa](/wiki/Bail_Prestor_Organa "Bail Prestor Organa") agreed to adopt Leia
together with his wife, the [queen of Alderaan](/wiki/Breha_Organa "Breha
Organa").[11] Kenobi carried Luke Skywalker aboard the late General
[Grievous](/wiki/Grievous "Grievous")'s starfighter, the _[Soulless
One](/wiki/Soulless_One "Soulless One")_

"Tatooine"), while Senator [Bail
Organa](/wiki/Bail_Prestor_Organa "Bail Prestor Organa") agreed to adopt Leia
together with his wife, the [queen of Alderaan](/wiki/Breha_Organa "Breha
Organa").[11] Kenobi carried Luke Skywalker aboard the late General
[Grievous](/wiki/Grievous "Grievous")'s starfighter, the _[Soulless
One](/wiki/Soulless_One "Soulless One")_ , and flew to [Nar
Shaddaa](/wiki/Nar_Shaddaa "Nar Shaddaa"), where he sold it for transportation
to Tatooine.[21]

Luke Skywalker spent his youth on the [Lars](/wiki/Lars_family "Lars family")'
[moisture farm](/wiki/Lars_Homestead "Lars Homestead"), where his uncle
unsuccessfully tried to discourage his adventurous tendencies, telling him
that his father had been "a [navigator](/wiki/Navigator "Navigator") on a
[spice](/wiki/Spice "Spice")

was sent away to live with his relatives on Tatooine.

Luke Skywalker spent his youth on the [Lars](/wiki/Lars_family "Lars family")'
[moisture farm](/wiki/Lars_Homestead "Lars Homestead"), where his uncle
unsuccessfully tried to discourage his adventurous tendencies, telling him
that his father had been "a [navigator](/wiki/Navigator "Navigator") on a
[spice](/wiki/Spice "Spice") [freighter](/wiki/Freighter "Freighter")" during
the Clone Wars.[1] His aunt, Beru, would read him storybooks; one day, when
his uncle had business in [Mos Eisley](/wiki/Mos_Eisley "Mos Eisley"), she
took Skywalker to [Anchorhead](/wiki/Anchorhead "Anchorhead") to use the
[HoloNet](/wiki/HoloNet "HoloNet") connections there and show him images of
forests, rivers, and oceans.[6]

By the age of three in [16 BBY](/wiki/16_BBY "16 BBY"), Skywalker had found
pleasure playing with a model spaceship built especially for him. He did not
know that Kenobi had actually built it and that Kenobi had been leaving
several of them at his grandmother, [Shmi's](/wiki/Shmi_Skywalker_Lars "Shmi
Skywalker Lars") sandblasted tombstone for his aunt to find. One morning, as
Skywalker played with his toy, a group of marauders attacked the
[farm](/wiki/Farm "Farm"). Obi-Wan Kenobi, who had been watching him from
afar, sprang into action, cutting down several Gamorreans before coming to the
realization that he was badly outnumbered. Just as he was about to be dealt a
possibly killing blow by one of the gang, Skywalker threw the toy starfighter
he had been playing with, managing to distract the Gammorean long enough for
Kenobi to separate his feet from his ankles. The battle then raged further,
slowly turning in the favor of the defenders which included Owen Lars, who
managed to gun down several of the invaders with a blaster. Luke cried out
after noticing that one of the marauders, a

into action, cutting down several Gamorreans before coming to the
realization that he was badly outnumbered. Just as he was about to be dealt a
possibly killing blow by one of the gang, Skywalker threw the toy starfighter
he had been playing with, managing to distract the Gammorean long enough for
Kenobi to separate his feet from his ankles. The battle then raged further,
slowly turning in the favor of the defenders which included Owen Lars, who
managed to gun down several of the invaders with a blaster. Luke cried out
after noticing that one of the marauders, a [Devaronian](/wiki/Devaronian
"Devaronian"), had snuck up behind Lars, ready to knock him out. Kenobi then
threw his lightsaber cutting the last marauder in half. As Skywalker cheered,
Lars threw a punch which knocked Kenobi to the ground. Lars then ushered
Skywalker back before chastising Kenobi for his involvement, pointing out the
fact that Skywalker's brief show of bravery had potential ramifications for
the boy's future.[22]

#### Vader's vision

Shortly after the [Battle of Fortress Vader](/wiki/Battle_of_Fortress_Vader
"Battle of Fortress Vader"), Darth Vader accessed a [portal](/wiki/Portal
"Portal") to the dark side created by [Darth Momin](/wiki/Darth_Momin "Darth
Momin") in an attempt to revive Padmé Amidala. He eventually found an
apparition of Amidala standing on a balcony, who rejected his pleas and threw
itself off the ledge and was incinerated by lightning. Just after this, Vader
saw a blue light in the distance, out of which emerged an apparition of an
adult Luke Skywalker, who blasted him back to reality.[23]

Around [9 BBY](/wiki/9_BBY "9 BBY"),[25] Kenobi looked in on Skywalker via
[macrobinoculars](/wiki/Macrobinoculars "Macrobinoculars") around the same
time that the Empire's [Inquisitors](/wiki/Inquisitorius "Inquisitorius")
[came](/wiki/Search_for_Nari "Search for Nari") to Tatooine looking for the
Jedi [Nari](/wiki/Nari "Nari"). Skywalker was tasked with a chore by Lars but
instead disappeared causing Lars and Beru to wonder where he went. In reality,
he had gone to the roof of one of the homestead wearing a mask and pretending
he was piloting a space

"Macrobinoculars") around the same
time that the Empire's [Inquisitors](/wiki/Inquisitorius "Inquisitorius")
[came](/wiki/Search_for_Nari "Search for Nari") to Tatooine looking for the
Jedi [Nari](/wiki/Nari "Nari"). Skywalker was tasked with a chore by Lars but
instead disappeared causing Lars and Beru to wonder where he went. In reality,
he had gone to the roof of one of the homestead wearing a mask and pretending
he was piloting a space vehicle.[24]

The next evening, Kenobi visited the Lars homestead and left a [toy
model](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker%27s_T-16_skyhopper_model "Luke Skywalker's T-16
skyhopper model") of a T-16 skyhopper for Skywalker. Lars found the toy and
returned it to Kenobi the next day telling him to stay away from Skywalker and
that they would not accept gifts from Kenobi. Kenobi tried to explain to Lars
that there was more to life than just his farm and that there was a whole
galaxy out there for Skywalker to explore. Despite being concerned for
Skywalker, Lars accused Kenobi of only caring about his well-being only if he
was showing signs of force-sensitivity. Lars refused once again to let Kenobi
train Skywalker.[24]

While Kenobi was off-world, having been sent by Bail Organa to protect Leia,
Kenobi received a transmission from Bail, who was worried that Kenobi had not
communicated with him. Bail informed him that if Vader had learned of
Skywalker and Leia's existence, or if he did not hear back from Kenobi, he
would go to Tatooine to help Lars with Skywalker. After an Imperial
[attack](/wiki/Jabiim_incident "Jabiim incident") on [Jabiim](/wiki/Jabiim
"Jabiim"), while Skywalker was sleeping at the Lars homestead, the

message was found by former Inquisitor [Reva Sevander](/wiki/Reva_Sevander
"Reva Sevander") who learned from it that Vader's son was on Tatooine in the
care of someone named Owen,[26] who she had

care of someone named Owen,[26] who she had met.[24] As she started to pursue
Skywalker, Kenobi sensed something was wrong in the Force.[26]

Luke did some work on Owen's speeder and accidentally broke it, so he was
marched into a repair shop with Owen to have it fixed. However, the former
Inquisitor [Reva Sevander](/wiki/Reva_Sevander "Reva Sevander"), blinded by
rage and focusing that anger on the boy, traveled to Tatooine on the hope that
killing Luke would bring her justice.[27]

A [year](/wiki/Standard_year "Standard year") after the Great Drought, life
carried on for Skywalker on Tatooine. Alongside [Biggs
Darklighter](/wiki/Biggs_Darklighter "Biggs Darklighter") and his other
friends, Skywalker flew his [T-16 skyhopper](/wiki/T-16_skyhopper "T-16
skyhopper") for a joyride through [Beggar's Canyon](/wiki/Beggar%27s_Canyon
"Beggar's Canyon"). Despite some daring moves, Skywalker ended up crashing the
vehicle, leading to his uncle Owen grounding him. Skywalker offered to pay for
the damage by flying in a race at nearby Anchorhead, but Lars stood his
ground. Unbeknownst to both of them, Obi-Wan Kenobi used [Jawas](/wiki/Jawa
"Jawa") to leave Skywalker some skyhopper parts. An angry Owen returned the
parts to Kenobi and told him to leave the family alone.[30]

Some [time](/wiki/Time "Time") after grounding Skywalker from flying his
skyhopper, Lars attempted to rebuild his relationship with his nephew by
looking to help him fix it. However, before he could, he was captured by the
Wookiee bounty hunter [Krrsantan](/wiki/Krrsantan "Krrsantan") and tortured.
Meanwhile, Skywalker was running away from home for not the first time.
However, he sensed something was wrong and rushed to his homestead. When he
arrived, he found many droids destroyed and his aunt Beru rattled, telling him
of the attack. She ordered her nephew to lock himself in the homestead's
maintenance bay, where he found his disabled skyhopper. He proceeded to fix it
and make his way to Krrsantan and Owen. As he flew there, the Wookiee was
engaged by Obi-Wan Kenobi. During this battle, Owen was thrown off a cliff.
Before he could hit the bottom, Skywalker, in his skyhopper, managed to catch
him and escape. Meanwhile, Kenobi defeated Krrsantan. Afterwards, Skywalker
was allowed to fly his skyhopper once

#### Other adventures

    " _Who …who are you?_"  
" _Ben Kenobi. You can call me Ben. I am an old friend of your father._ "

Eventually, Skywalker became an adventure-seeking youth who demonstrated his
father's natural [piloting](/wiki/Pilot "Pilot") skills, as well as a strong
desire to leave Tatooine.[1] At one point in his boyhood, Skywalker was
climbing in a canyon, but, when he grabbed the top, the rock broke off.
Skywalker fell into a cave, where he was seen by a group of [womp
rats](/wiki/Womp_rat "Womp rat") and a [krayt dragon](/wiki/Krayt_dragon
"Krayt dragon"), although he managed to escape the creatures.[32] When
Skywalker was 12 years old in [7 BBY](/wiki/7_BBY "7 BBY"),[33] he and his
friend, [Windy](/wiki/Windy "Windy") went off on their own through the
Tatooine desert and wandered away from the [moisture
farms](/wiki/Moisture_farm "Moisture farm") riding a [dewback](/wiki/Dewback
"Dewback"). The two encountered a [sandstorm](/wiki/Sandstorm "Sandstorm")
during their time outside and both lost consciousness. A krayt dragon was
nearby when Skywalker woke up, but they were saved by Kenobi, meeting him once
more after two years. Skywalker asked him who he was, and Kenobi revealed

went off on their own through the
Tatooine desert and wandered away from the [moisture

Heading to Tosche Station, Skywalker swapped stories with his friends, among
them a visiting and recently-graduated Darklighter,[40] who was reluctant to
believe Skywalker's claims about a battle upon looking up with Skywalker's
macrobinoculars and merely seeing the two craft sitting still in space.[41]
Nonetheless, Skywalker was then eager to tell his friend of his recent
exploits aboard his skyhopper in Beggar's Canyon, which Darklighter was amused
by. After warning his friend not to crash the ship,[42] he leaned close to
Skywalker to tell his old friend a great secret: he intended to defect from
the Empire to join the [Rebel Alliance Starfighter
Corps](/wiki/Rebel_Alliance_Starfighter_Corps "Rebel Alliance Starfighter
Corps").[43]

father was not a spice freighter navigator like his uncle had always told him,
but a Jedi Knight struck down by Darth Vader. Skywalker was also given his
father's [lightsaber](/wiki/Skywalker_lightsaber "Skywalker lightsaber") by
Kenobi,[1] allowing the blade to be ignited for the first time in years.[33]

to show him the ways of the Force. Skywalker initially refused to get
involved, as he believed his duties at home were more important, but he
offered to take Kenobi to Anchorhead.[1]

On their way to Anchorhead, Skywalker and Kenobi came upon a group of
slaughtered Jawas—the same ones who sold the droids to his uncle. Skywalker
deduced from learning that Imperial [stormtroopers](/wiki/Stormtrooper
"Stormtrooper") were responsible that they might have looked into the sales
records of the droids, and rushed home in the hopes of saving his step-aunt
and step-uncle. Upon returning home, Skywalker discovered that he was too
late: his step-aunt and step-uncle had been murdered by the Empire. With the
people who raised him dead, he decided to accompany Kenobi to
[Alderaan](/wiki/Alderaan "Alderaan") to deliver the plans back to the
Alliance and learn the ways of the Jedi.[1]

The two were eventually able to find a pilot that could take them to Alderaan
in the form of [Han Solo](/wiki/Han_Solo "Han Solo"), a
[Corellian](/wiki/Corellian "Corellian") [smuggler](/wiki/Smuggler
"Smuggler"), and his co-pilot [Chewbacca](/wiki/Chewbacca "Chewbacca"). Solo's
initial rate was ten thousand [credits](/wiki/Credit "Credit") all paid in
advance, which Skywalker thought was too expensive. Ultimately, they were able
to compromise when Kenobi offered to pay two thousand credits up front and an
additional fifteen thousand when they got to Alderaan, for a total of
seventeen thousand credits, which convinced Solo to take them, with Skywalker
selling his [speeder](/wiki/Landspeeder "Landspeeder") to
[Wioslea](/wiki/Wioslea "Wioslea") to pay for the two thousand up front.[1] As
they left the cantina, they were also cornered by a
[stormtrooper](/wiki/Unidentified_stormtrooper_\(Mos_Eisley\) "Unidentified
stormtrooper \(Mos Eisley\)"), but Kenobi took out the trooper with the Force
by throwing large pieces of metal. With it clear that stormtroopers were

by throwing large pieces of metal. With it clear that stormtroopers were all
around the city, the two moved to quickly depart Mos Eisley.[31]

After escaping stormtroopers on Solo's ship, the _[Millennium
Falcon](/wiki/Millennium_Falcon "Millennium Falcon")_ , Kenobi began
Skywalker's instruction in the ways of the Force, using a [training
remote](/wiki/Marksman-H_training_remote "Marksman-H training remote") to
instruct him in basic [lightsaber combat](/wiki/Lightsaber_combat "Lightsaber
combat"), much to the derision of Solo, who dismissed it as a "hokey
religion."[1][45] Wearing a [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet") that completely
covered his [eyes](/wiki/Eye "Eye") for part of the lesson, Kenobi encouraged
him to reach out with the Force to combat the remote. Despite his vision being
totally impaired, Skywalker was able to successfully deflect a pair of
[blaster bolts](/wiki/Laser "Laser") from the remote, claiming that he could
"almost see" the remote through the Force.[1]

Once on board, Luke and Han knocked two stormtroopers out and stole their

R2-D2 discovered that Leia Organa was being held captive on the station,
Skywalker insisted on [rescuing](/wiki/Rescue_of_Princess_Leia "Rescue of
Princess Leia") her. Though Solo was reluctant to go marching into the
[detention block](/wiki/Detention_Level "Detention Level"), Skywalker
convinced him to go along with the rescue by claiming that he would get a
significant reward for doing so.

Still using their stormtrooper guises, Skywalker and Solo convinced Chewbacca
to pose as a prisoner and escorted him to [Detention Block
AA-23](/wiki/Detention_Block_AA-23 "Detention Block AA-23") (where Organa was
being held.) They were able to rescue Organa, but their cover was blown and
they had to jump into the [garbage compactor](/wiki/Garbage_compactor "Garbage
compactor") in order to escape the pursuing Imperial forces. After Luke
thrashed and struggled against the hold of the [dianoga](/wiki/Dianoga
"Dianoga") [Omi](/wiki/Omi "Omi"), the group escaped the compactor and headed
back to the _Millennium Falcon_ , but not before avoiding more troopers.
Though Skywalker and Organa were separated from Solo and Chewbacca, they were
able to reunite with their companions, and the droids, in the hangar bay.[1]

of the [dianoga](/wiki/Dianoga

Skywalker fought

fought for the Rebel Alliance as an X-wing starfighter pilot during
the Battle of Yavin.

Upon their arrival at the Yavin base, they met with
[Commander](/wiki/Commander "Commander") [Willard](/wiki/Vanden_Willard
"Vanden Willard")[1] and Organa introduced him to Skywalker so that he could
join the Rebel Alliance as a [pilot](/wiki/Rebel_pilot "Rebel pilot").
Skywalker then separated and met [Wedge Antilles](/wiki/Wedge_Antilles "Wedge
Antilles"), who oversaw his flight simulation test. Lasting no more than 30
[seconds](/wiki/Second "Second"), the more experienced pilot advised Skywalker
to listen to his explanations, and encouraged him not to give up. In his
second try, Skywalker used what he had learned from Antilles, and managed to
surpass the highest score, that of Antilles's, prompting Willard to accept him
without objection.[6] He joined [Red
Group](/wiki/Red_Squadron_\(Rebel_Alliance\) "Red Squadron \(Rebel
Alliance\)") with the designation of [Red Five](/wiki/Red_Five "Red Five"),[1]
which had previously belonged to a [cadet](/wiki/Cadet "Cadet") named [Pedrin
Gaul](/wiki/Pedrin_Gaul "Pedrin Gaul"),[46] who had perished during the
[Battle of Scarif](/wiki/Battle_of_Scarif "Battle of Scarif") several days
earlier.[47]

After the briefing for their plan of attack against the incoming Death Star,
Skywalker prepared himself for the attack, when he saw Solo loading his
payment onto the _Falcon_ for rescuing Organa and prepared to leave the group.
Skywalker attempted to persuade him to stay and help them against the Empire,
but Solo refused, claiming that the attack on the Death Star was suicide
rather than bravery, deeply disappointing him. After bidding farewell to
Organa as well, Skywalker was about to board [his](/wiki/Red_Five_\(T-65B_X-
wing_starfighter\) "Red Five \(T-65B X-wing starfighter\)") [T-65B X-wing
starfighter](/wiki/T-65B_X-wing_starfighter "T-65B X-wing

for rescuing Organa and prepared to leave the group.

Luke that the two would catch up on each other's stories when they got back.
Skywalker was also approached by [Garven Dreis](/wiki/Garven_Dreis "Garven
Dreis"), the commander of Red Squadron, who asked him if he was sure he could
handle the X-wing, to which Darklighter vouched for his friend, calling him
the "best bush pilot in the Outer Rim Territories."[1] Skywalker was assigned
command of [fourth flight](/wiki/Fourth_flight "Fourth flight") for the
battle.[48]

As the [Battle of Yavin](/wiki/Battle_of_Yavin "Battle of Yavin") got underway
and Skywalker and his fellow squadmates launched into space, Skywalker was
guided by the spirit of Obi-Wan Kenobi. He participated in Red Squadron's
initial assault on the Death Star's outer defenses, primarily focusing on
disabling the station's numerous [turbolaser
batteries](/wiki/XX-9_heavy_turbolaser_battery "XX-9 heavy turbolaser
battery") and fighting off TIE fighters when they were deployed against the
Rebel fighters. He also helped to provide cover for [Gold
Squadron](/wiki/Gold_Squadron_\(Rebel_Alliance\) "Gold Squadron \(Rebel
Alliance\)") when they made the first attack run on the [meridian
trench](/wiki/Meridian_trench "Meridian trench"), as well as Commander Dreis
when he made his attack run. Eventually, Darth Vader himself joined the fray
in a

"XX-9 heavy turbolaser
battery") and fighting off TIE fighters when they were deployed against the
Rebel fighters. He also helped to provide cover for [Gold

Alliance\)") when they made the first attack run on the [meridian
trench](/wiki/Meridian_trench "Meridian trench"), as well as Commander Dreis
when he made his attack run. Eventually, Darth Vader himself joined the fray
in a [TIE Advanced x1](/wiki/TIE_Advanced_x1 "TIE Advanced x1") and succeeded
in thwarting the first two attack runs. Just before he was shot down by the
Sith Lord, Commander Dreis instructed Skywalker to lead a third and final run
on the trench with Darklighter and Antilles.[1]

Skywalker took charge of the last attempt on the [thermal exhaust
port](/wiki/Thermal_exhaust_port "Thermal exhaust port") as instructed, but
Vader and his two escort fighters soon caught up to them. Antilles was forced
to withdraw after his starfighter suffered damage, and Darklighter was
eventually shot down as well. Unable to grieve for his fallen friend,
Skywalker tried to focus on his target. He was once again contacted by the
spirit to Kenobi, who urged him to let the Force guide him. This prompted
Skywalker to disable his starfighter's [targeting
computer](/wiki/Targeting_computer "Targeting computer"), much to the
confusion of the Rebel leaders continuing to monitor the battle from the
surface of Yavin 4.[1]

Just as Skywalker reached the end of the trench, it appeared as though Vader
would shoot him down like he had the other pilots, but before he could, Han
Solo and Chewbacca showed up in the _Millennium Falcon_ , destroying Vader's
two escorts and causing Vader's TIE Advanced to spiral out of control away
from the trench. At Solo's urging, Skywalker took a single shot and fired two

guide them to their target, which resulted in the destruction of the Death
Star. For this action he, Chewbacca, and Han Solo were awarded the

Solo and Chewbacca showed up in the _Millennium Falcon_ , destroying Vader's
two escorts and causing Vader's TIE Advanced to spiral out of control away

After destroying the Death Star, Skywalker became a fully committed soldier in
the Rebellion.

Just as the [ceremony](/wiki/Royal_Award_Ceremony "Royal Award Ceremony")

of her family and homeworld. Afterwards, [General](/wiki/General "General")
[Jan Dodonna](/wiki/Jan_Dodonna "Jan Dodonna") sent him and Antilles, the only

got._ "  
" _You_ don't _got me! I'm not part of the Rebellion!_ "

    ―Skywalker and Solo[52]

Despite his assistance in the fight, Solo largely divested himself from the
Alliance after the Battle of Yavin. When Skywalker heard that Solo had camped
out on [Balnab](/wiki/Balnab "Balnab"), he and some members of the Rebellion
briefly went there to meet him. Skywalker approached Solo and Chewbacca on the
_Millenium Falcon_ , the latter roughing him up when he insulted the ship.
Despite Solo's prodding and boasting of getting his reward money, Skywalker
insisted that he was not running away from Rebel life and had just come to see
him. He asked Solo for a favor to deliver a few crates to the Rebellion's
surveillance outpost on [Calumdarian](/wiki/Calumdarian "Calumdarian"). Solo
insisted that he was not a part of the Rebellion and did not want to do it,
saying he had already done a mission for Organa and saved Skywalker's life at
Yavin. Skywalker insisted that it was serious and that lives were at stake as
Rebel pilots started to bring the crates aboard the ship. Skywalker pointed
out that Solo was the best smugger they had. While Solo tried to insist that
they did not have him because he was not a part of the Rebellion, Skywalker
thanked the pilots for bringing the crates on board as he left. Solo ended up
successfully completing the mission.[52]

Organa to negotiate supplies from the planet [Rion](/wiki/Rion "Rion"). Organa
put Skywalker in charge, which surprised and peeved Solo. Once arrived on the
planet, Solo noticed that a big price could have been won by winning a [swoop
race](/wiki/Swoop_racing "Swoop racing"). Skywalker, however, thought that it
was better to fulfill the mission without being distracted and risking to
loose

put Skywalker in charge, which surprised and peeved Solo. Once arrived on the
planet, Solo noticed that a big price could have been won by winning a [swoop

Solo takes part to the race

Solo decided to participate anyway and, unbeknownst to his friend, took some
money with which they should have bought supplies and bought a
[swoop](/wiki/Swoop "Swoop"). He signed up to the [race](/wiki/Rion_Swoop
"Rion Swoop") and started bragging about his skills to other pilots. Two
pilots, however, understood that Solo had a big bounty on his head and decided
to sabotage the race and hand over the rebel soldier to the Empire. In the
meanwhile, Skywalker ended the negotiations with [Razian](/wiki/Razian
"Razian"), an alien that should have provided the supplies to the Rebel
Alliance, but noticed that half the credits were missing. He understood that
Solo took part to

He signed up to the [race](/wiki/Rion_Swoop
"Rion Swoop") and started bragging about his skills to other pilots. Two
pilots, however, understood that Solo had a big bounty on his head and decided
to sabotage the race and hand over the rebel soldier to the Empire. In the
meanwhile, Skywalker ended the negotiations with [Razian](/wiki/Razian
"Razian"), an alien that should have provided the supplies to the Rebel
Alliance, but noticed that half the credits were missing. He understood that
Solo took part to the race, and went to the stadium in which Solo was racing.
In the stands he heard two criminals talking about how they would knock Solo
out: Skywalker and Chewbacca put the two criminals out of action, and
Skywalker went to help Solo who was being targeted by his opponents who agreed
to eliminate him. Solo, helped by his friend, was able to win the race, and
they could eventually pay Razian for the supplies.[53]

In an errand for Admiral [Gial Ackbar](/wiki/Gial_Ackbar "Gial Ackbar"),
Skywalker was dispatched to the planet [Rodia](/wiki/Rodia "Rodia") in order
to open a secret weapon supply line for the Alliance. He was accompanied by
Artoo and a pilot named [Nakari Kelen](/wiki/Nakari_Kelen "Nakari Kelen"), and
they flew her ship, the _[Desert Jewel](/wiki/Desert_Jewel "Desert Jewel")_.
During their mission together, they [helped](/wiki/Skirmish_over_Llanic
"Skirmish over Llanic") a [Kupohan](/wiki/Kupohan "Kupohan") ship--which,
unknown to them at the time, carried vital intelligence on a
[Givin](/wiki/Givin "Givin") cryptographer named [Drusil
Bephorin](/wiki/Drusil_Bephorin "Drusil Bephorin")--near [Llanic](/wiki/Llanic
"Llanic"). They then continued their journey to Rodia. Skywalker was greeted
by [Laneet Chekkoo](/wiki/Laneet_Chekkoo "Laneet Chekkoo"), who guided him to
[Toopil](/wiki/Toopil "Toopil"). During business with [Taneetch
Soonta](/wiki/Taneetch_Soonta "Taneetch Soonta"), the [Rodian](/wiki/Rodian
"Rodian") told Skywalker about the Jedi, including a story about Anakin during
the Clone Wars. From her, Skywalker received [her uncle's](/wiki/Huulik
"Huulik") [lightsaber](/wiki/Huulik%27s_lightsaber "Huulik's lightsaber").[51]

Eedit.

Planning to ransack the Temple to pay his debts, Plank then challenged him to
a duel, during which he used a [grenade](/wiki/Grenade "Grenade") to blind
him, seeing that Skywalker would not be defeated so easily. Prepared to
administer the coup de grace, Farnay interrupted him, for which Plank put
[binders](/wiki/Binder "Binder") on her; however, it gave Skywalker time to
stand up and slash Plank's control box, casting him and his electrostaff into
a pit leading to the temple's underlevels. Skywalker then passed out and
Farnay tended his wounds, to whom he swore he would become a Jedi and rebuild
the [Order](/wiki/Jedi_Order "Jedi Order"), and return to Eedit one day. With
the droids, they left the Temple as Imperial reinforcements arrived
afterwards. Skywalker eventually kept his promise to Farnay and returned to
Devaron accompanied by C-3PO and R2-D2. While there Luke also visited the
Temple of Eedit once more.[45]

Back in Tikaroo, Skywalker reclaimed his now-repaired starfighter from Kivas,
and before departing Devaron, he dropped several bombs at the base of the
spire to cut off the paths into the jungle, meaning to stop the
[pikhron](/wiki/Pikhron "Pikhron") hunt.[45]

[credit chip](/wiki/Credit_chip "Credit chip") from an individual who had been

because he and a bad feeling. The individual mocked him and Rebels for always
having bad feelings and assured him that the funds on

Skywalker, along with R2-D2, went on a
mission on the planet [Hradreek](/wiki/Hradreek "Hradreek") to collect a
[credit chip](/wiki/Credit_chip "Credit chip") from an individual who had been
collecting a percentage for the Rebellion from a place where people gambled
there. However, Skywalker felt meeting the way they did with so many Imperial
agents around was a huge risk, and he suggested he should leave quickly
because he and a bad feeling. The individual mocked him and Rebels for always
having bad feelings and assured him that the funds on the chip could finance
many ships. He offered for Skywalker to bet the money to get more, but he
declined, saying he could not face Organa if he lost it. After thanking them
and leaving, Skywalker walked into an area where he felt a [disturbance in the
Force](/wiki/Disturbance_in_the_Force "Disturbance in the Force"). Despite,
R2's warnings, he entered in a room in which many dead corpses lay, noticing
that in the middle of it there was a very old [crossguard
lightsaber](/wiki/Crossguard_lightsaber "Crossguard lightsaber"). Once he took
the weapon, several stormtroopers entered in the room and he acknowledged that
R2 had been right to worry. Skywalker ignited the
[lightsaber](/wiki/Darth_Atrius%27_lightsabers "Darth Atrius' lightsabers"),
which unbeknownst to him was one of [Darth Atrius](/wiki/Darth_Atrius "Darth
Atrius")'s, and slaughtered all the Imperial troopers. After killing the last
one, Skywalker was surprised by the unnatural anger that he had felt and told
to R2-D2 that, during the battle, it was like he was watching without being
able to stop himself, but that now he was fine.[55]

Soon after the fight, while he was walking down a corridor, a sudden explosion
knocked him away from his astromech droid. As he stood up he tried to contact
R2, but another stormtrooper squad found him and started shooting at him, so
Skywalker urged R2 to get to the X-wing. While trying to run away, he came out
into an arena in which a

unnatural anger that he had felt and told
to R2-D2 that, during the battle, it was like he was watching without being
able to stop himself, but that now he was fine.[55]

Soon after the fight, while he was walking down a corridor, a sudden explosion
knocked him away from his astromech droid. As he stood up he tried to contact
R2, but another stormtrooper squad found him and started shooting at him, so
Skywalker urged R2 to get to the X-wing. While trying to run away, he came out
into an arena in which a [podracing](/wiki/Podracing "Podracing") race was
about to start. He warned R2 he was going to do something stupid, Skywalker
stole a helmet from an [Er'Kit](/wiki/Er%27Kit "Er'Kit") pilot and then stole
the Er'Kit's [podracer](/wiki/Podracer "Podracer") by threatening them with
the red lightsaber, though he apologized. Hoping piloting a podracer was as
easy as a landspeeder, Skywalker took part in the race trying to escape from
the troopers. When he found it harder than he thought, he asked R2 for a
pickup. Without Skywalker's knowledge, Darth Vader watched a holoprojection of
Skywalker in the race, a flight that the commentator said no one had "ever
seen anything like it", Vader calling it "most impressive." Vader watched as
one of the engines blew up and left Skywalker stuck traveling on foot. He
ignited the red-bladed lightsaber he had found, but was able to control his
anger and, to avoid it to overwhelm him again, destroyed it with his blue-
bladed lightsaber. He was then rescued by an X-Wing piloted by R2-D2, where
Vader had walked outside and watched the fighter leave.[55]

Skywalker on the grassy planet of Bogano.

At some point, Luke was given a mission to analyze different worlds in search
of which could host a rebel base. However, as he did so, Skywalker felt the
Force drawing him to [Bogano](/wiki/Bogano "Bogano"), a grassy planet in the
[Outer Rim Territories](/wiki/Outer_Rim_Territories "Outer Rim Territories").
As Skywalker meditated on the planet, he began to hear the voice of her friend
and companion rebel Leia Organa. Luke thought the Force allowed the two to
communicate across the galaxy, but Leia was behind him. Leia asked what Luke
was doing there since Bogano was one of the worlds she had to check out, and
Luke told the Force had taken him there. The two were

drawing him to [Bogano](/wiki/Bogano "Bogano"), a grassy planet in the
[Outer Rim Territories](/wiki/Outer_Rim_Territories "Outer Rim Territories").
As Skywalker meditated on the planet, he began to hear the voice of her friend
and companion rebel Leia Organa. Luke thought the Force allowed the two to
communicate across the galaxy, but Leia was behind him. Leia asked what Luke
was doing there since Bogano was one of the worlds she had to check out, and
Luke told the Force had taken him there. The two were taken to the [Bogano
Vault](/wiki/Bogano_Vault "Bogano Vault") by a small animal. Skywalker sensed
the Force was strong in the place, and while Leia thought the world might be a
good base, Luke disagreed. Skywalker was apparently right, as the small animal
led them to a group of stormtroopers who were dealing with animals of the same
species, making it clear that the Empire knew the world.[57] Along with Leia,
Luke defeated the stormtroopers, who intended to sell the animals on the black
market, and then left the planet to continue his mission to verify the planets
assigned to him.[56]

##### Kudo

    " _That was good thinking, sending the droids out with a cover story._ "
    ―Skywalker, to Solo[59]

Around this the rebellion eventually temporarily settled on the planet
[Kudo](/wiki/Kudo "Kudo"). During the holiday [Life Day](/wiki/Life_Day "Life
Day"), Skywalker helped with a mission to stop the ISB from discovering them.
After C-3PO and R2-D2 brought the [ISB
agent](/wiki/Unidentified_Imperial_Security_Bureau_agent_\(Kudo\)
"Unidentified Imperial Security Bureau agent \(Kudo\)") into a dark room,
Skywalker held a blaster to him and Chewbacca knocked him down. Afterward,
Skywalker commended Solo for coming up with the plan to use the droids as a
trap, but Solo gave the credit to Chewbacca. Skywalker then watched a light
display created by a [Life Day Orb](/wiki/Life_Day_Orb "Life Day Orb") and the
Rebellion planned to leave the planet.[59]

#### Cymoon 1

    " _You, boy, are_ no _Jedi. Who are you?_ "

Alongside Organa, Solo, Chewbacca, R2-D2, and C-3PO, Skywalker took part of a
[mission](/wiki/Assault_on_Cymoon "Assault on Cymoon") to infiltrate [Cymoon
1](/wiki/Cymoon_1 "Cymoon 1"). To do so, the rebel team hijacked the ship of
an emissary sent by Jabba the Hutt to negotiate a weapons deal at [Weapons
Factory Alpha](/wiki/Weapons_Factory_Alpha "Weapons Factory Alpha"), with Solo
as its replacement and Organa and Skywalker disguised as his bodyguards.[12]

Luke Skywalker frees a group of captive Imperial slaves held on the grounds of

Once inside the facility, they revealed themselves as rebels to
[Overseer](/wiki/Overseer "Overseer") [Aggadeen](/wiki/Aggadeen "Aggadeen"),
took their escorts down and made their way to the central power station. While
Organa, Solo, and R2-D2 rigged the place to destroy it, Skywalker watched for
additional Imperial troops, using what little he knew of the Force to reach
out and sense any nearby presence. However, he was drawn to caged
[slaves](/wiki/Slavery "Slavery"), whom he proceeded to free, and guided them
to a rendezvous with Solo and Organa, when they were alerted of Vader's
arrival by Chewbacca.[12]

Determined to fight Vader for killing his father and Kenobi, he heard his
mentor's voice speak to him from beyond, telling him to run, just as he faced
the [Dark Lord](/wiki/Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith "Dark Lord of the Sith").[12]
However, he was no match for Vader, who quickly seized Skywalker's lightsaber
and was about to kill him, until he realized that Skywalker's lightsaber had
been once his own. Solo then intervened with an [AT-
AT](/wiki/All_Terrain_Armored_Transport "All Terrain Armored Transport"),
crashing the [walker](/wiki/Walker "Walker") through the factory's walls,
giving Skywalker and the slaves an opening to escape from the facility.[60]

Luke Skywalker is dispatched by Darth Vader following a brief confrontation on

Seeing so many of the freed slaves die by Imperial fire, Skywalker regretted
his decision, but continued fighting after stealing a [speeder
bike](/wiki/Speeder_bike "Speeder bike"). After the Rebels' walker opened fire
against Vader,[60] Skywalker picked his lightsaber up from the rubble, rushed
to assist his team—whose walker had fallen down due to Vader—, and provided
some cover fire. Determined to destroy the factory, Skywalker disobeyed
Organa's orders and used his stolen speeder bike to destroy the power core
despite Vader's threat. Afterwards, he managed to board the _Millennium
Falcon_ , reunite with his team and escape Cymoon 1, yet with his morale at
rock bottom.[61]

#### Return to Tatooine

    " _"There's nothing here for me now." That's what I said when I left this place. Let's hope I was_ wrong _._ "
    ―Luke Skywalker[37]

Once they returned to the [Alliance Fleet](/wiki/Rebel_Alliance_Navy "Rebel
Alliance Navy"), Skywalker continued working on his lightsaber techniques
until Organa came to see him. Skywalker told her that he lacked interest in
undertaking any more missions, as he did not consider himself a Jedi but a
danger, and that until he could figure out who he was, he could not be around
the Alliance; he asked Organa to let him go. Much to her and Solo's dismay,
Skywalker (along with R2-D2) took off in an X-wing and set off on a course for
Tatooine. Hoping to find some guidance in Kenobi's hut, Skywalker and R2 made
their way across the [desert](/wiki/Desert "Desert") to the abandoned
residence, where they found it being pillaged by Tusken raiders, who fled in
fear upon seeing his activated lightsaber.[62]

Skywalker duels Boba Fett after being ambushed in Obi-Wan Kenobi's former home

Inside the hut, Skywalker had R2 scan the ransacked place for anything of
value, and the small android came across a box addressed to Skywalker.
However, before they could find out its contents, one of [Boba
Fett](/wiki/Boba_Fett "Boba Fett")'s [flash grenades](/wiki/Flash_grenade
"Flash grenade") incapacitated R2-D2 and blinded Skywalker.[37] Fett proceeded
to aim a [rifle](/wiki/Blaster_rifle "Blaster rifle") to his head, but
Skywalker [fought back](/wiki/Duel_in_Ben_Kenobi%27s_home "Duel in Ben
Kenobi's home") with his lightsaber despite his temporary blindness. Despite
his disadvantage and multiple wounds done by Fett, Skywalker managed to
deflect the bounty hunter's shot at point-blank and Fett tackled him in
anger.[63]

Close to death by his own lightsaber as he struggled against Fett, R2-D2 saved
him by hurling Kenobi's box and knocking the hunter out. Still blinded and
carrying the box, Skywalker had R2-D2 lead him to his X-Wing.[63] On his way
to an unknown location, he read some of Kenobi's passages on his
[journals](/wiki/The_Journals_of_Ben_Kenobi "The Journals of Ben Kenobi"),
including one set during the Great Drought involving him.[28]

#### Showdown on Nar Shaddaa

    " _You want to finally be a Jedi Knight, kid? Here's your chance. Go die like one._ "
    ―Kreel to Luke Skywalker[64]

Though Kenobi's journals contained a number of stories, Skywalker became
frustrated as he continued to read them as he did not understand what lessons
were to be learned about using a lightsaber or wielding the Force. Though
Artoo suggested returning to the fleet, Skywalker had no intention of
returning until he found the answers he was seeking. Artoo's suggestion did,
however, give the young Jedi an idea: to venture into the

" _You want to finally be a Jedi Knight, kid? Here's your chance. Go die like one._ "
    ―Kreel to Luke Skywalker[64]

Though Kenobi's journals contained a number of stories, Skywalker became
frustrated as he continued to read them as he did not understand what lessons
were to be learned about using a lightsaber or wielding the Force. Though
Artoo suggested returning to the fleet, Skywalker had no intention of
returning until he found the answers he was seeking. Artoo's suggestion did,
however, give the young Jedi an idea: to venture into the [Jedi
Temple](/wiki/Imperial_Palace "Imperial Palace") on
[Coruscant](/wiki/Coruscant "Coruscant"), the former home of the Jedi Order.
Before he could travel to Coruscant, however, Skywalker set a course to [Nar
Shaddaa](/wiki/Nar_Shaddaa "Nar Shaddaa"), a world of pirates and outlaws
known as the "Smuggler's Moon." Upon landing, Skywalker set off looking for
someone who could help him get to the [Jedi Temple](/wiki/Jedi_temple "Jedi
temple"). He entered a cantina, where he was immediately attacked by criminals
looking to rob and kill him. Skywalker brandished his lightsaber and demanded
that they cease their attack, while the bartender asked where he acquired a
Jedi's lightsaber. He did not answer, instead saying that he was simply on Nar
Shaddaa to conduct business and had already stated his purpose for entering
the establishment. The bartender guessed that Skywalker was seeking entry into
the Jedi Temple, meaning he would need to hire someone who could sneak him
onto the capital world of the Empire. The bartender told him that he could do
that for the boy, but the price would be the lightsaber--a price that
Skywalker rejected, so the bartender resorted to his previous plan of killing
and robbing the boy.[65]

Skywalker fought the Hutt's [MagnaGuard](/wiki/IG-100_MagnaGuard "IG-100
MagnaGuard"), while at the same time overhearing the thief telling Grakkus
that Skywalker said his father was a Jedi and that he was seeking access to
the Jedi Temple. Having his own plans for the boy, Grakkus knocked Skywalker
out with a punch to the face.[66]

Skywalker later awoke to find himself in Grakkus'
[palace](/wiki/Palace_of_Grakkus_the_Hutt "Palace of Grakkus the Hutt"), which
contained untold numbers of relics from the Jedi Order. Grakkus held out a
Jedi [holocron](/wiki/Holocron "Holocron"), though Skywalker did not know what
it was. Grakkus, who explained that he was a collector of [Jedi
artifacts](/wiki/Jedi_artifact "Jedi artifact") in addition to being a crime
lord, told him that the item was a holocron and that only an individual who
was strong with the Force could open it. Though Skywalker had no experience
with holocrons, the Hutt gave him five seconds to open the holocron or be
killed. Under threat of death, the boy reached out with the Force and was able
to open the holocron, as well as the many others that were in the

Grakkus, who explained that he was a collector of [Jedi
artifacts](/wiki/Jedi_artifact "Jedi artifact") in addition to being a crime
lord, told him that the item was a holocron and that only an individual who
was strong with the Force could open it. Though Skywalker had no experience
with holocrons, the Hutt gave him five seconds to open the holocron or be
killed. Under threat of death, the boy reached out with the Force and was able
to open the holocron, as well as the many others that were in the collection.
They revealed themselves as containing historical records about the Jedi and
the Sith, including the revelation that there was a [Jedi
Temple](/wiki/Jedi_Temple_\(Vrogas_Vas\) "Jedi Temple \(Vrogas Vas\)") on
[Vrogas Vas](/wiki/Vrogas_Vas "Vrogas Vas"). With Skywalker having proved
himself, Grakkus believed he would make a fine addition to his collection as
the last living Jedi. Grakkus planned to put Skywalker into an arena fight
that he would bill as the death of the last Jedi, so the Hutt ordered him
taken to the arena's gamemaster to be prepared. Artoo, knowing that Skywalker
had been captured, send a distress call to the Alliance Fleet, where it was
intercepted by the High Command. Though Chancellor Mothma was unwilling to
send a team of Rebels on a suicide mission despite Skywalker's importance to
the Rebellion, Chewbacca and Threepio--who remained with the fleet while Solo
and Organa were on their own mission--volunteered to rescue their captured
friend.[66]

The gamemaster--secretly an Imperial stormtrooper named
[Sergeant](/wiki/Sergeant "Sergeant") [Kreel](/wiki/Kreel
"Kreel")[67]--introduced himself to Skywalker once the Jedi was led to the
arena, and he stated that it was his job to make sure Skywalker was prepared
to put on a good show before ultimately dying in the arena. Though Skywalker
initially refused to fight, Kreel knew he would ultimately do so because he
wanted to learn to hone his skills as a Jedi. The Kreel also told him that the
Jedi Temple no longer existed, as it had been converted into the Imperial
Palace--so whatever Skywalker was hoping to find was gone, as were the other
Jedi temples in the galaxy. He then threw the lightsaber to Skywalker and
removed the binds that the boy's hands were in. While surrounded by
MagnaGuards, the Kreel used a lightsaber of his own and engaged in a duel to
begin preparing him for the arena match. Though the Kreel was not a Jedi,

The big event soon arrived, and crime lords and other criminal types flocked
to watch the death of the last Jedi. Skywalker spoke to Grakkus, who reminded
him that no one wanted to watch him win and that everyone had paid to see him
die, though the young Jedi believed he could succeed nonetheless. Grakkus also
revealed that scavengers had found Skywalker's X-wing and the Journal of Ben
Kenobi, which Grakkus intended to add to his collection. The event began once
Grakkus left, and Skywalker entered into the arena and was introduced as the
last of the Jedi. The announcer claimed that he was a veteran of battles
across the galaxy and that he had fought Hutts and bounty hunters alike,
hyping up the untrained Jedi hopeful. The announcer then introduced the Jedi's
opponent: [Kongo](/wiki/Kongo "Kongo") the Disemboweler, a large and fearsome
creature from the [dolovite](/wiki/Dolovite "Dolovite") [mines](/wiki/Mining
"Mining") of [Mustafar](/wiki/Mustafar "Mustafar"). Skywalker ignited the
green-bladed lightsaber that was given to him for the show and the fight
began. The young Jedi slashed his blade at the creature, but the opponent's
armor was resistant to a lightsaber blade and made it difficult for Skywalker
to combat the creature. He remained confident, however, reminding himself that
he blew up the Death Star, fought Boba Fett, and was trained by Obi-Wan
Kenobi. He closed his eyes in an attempt

Skywalker tried calling out to Kenobi to ask for miracle. Just as he
did so, the beast's [shock collar](/wiki/Shock_collar "Shock collar") was

announced he was taking Skywalker into custody. Stormtroopers

disabled the Imperials' blasters. Grakkus, skilled at combat in his own right,
began fighting the weaponless stormtroopers, while other troops grabbed
Skywalker. Just then, the young Jedi saw that Artoo, who had infiltrated the
palace, recovered his lightsaber and threw it into the arena, so Skywalker
grabbed it and cut the soldiers down. Kongo chased the spectators out of the
arena, and Skywalker while Kreel confronted Skywalker, knocking him to the
ground and revealing his true identity as a stormtrooper of the [501st
Legion](/wiki/501st_Legion "501st Legion") tasked with arresting him.
Skywalker was saved by the timely arrival of Grakkus, who Kreel attacked as
Skywalker got away.[67]

Skywalker regrouped with Solo, Organa, Chewbacca, and the droids, all of whom
ultimately traveled to Nar Shaddaa to rescue their captive friend. Solo,
Organa, and Chewbacca each wielded lightsabers that Artoo stole from the
palace so they were not defenseless in the wake of the EMP blast, leading
Skywalker to quip that Solo looked good with a lightsaber. Artoo recovered
Kenobi's journal and Skywalker wanted to go back to the palace to recover more
artifacts, but the arena was flooded with blaster-wielding stormtroopers so
Chewbacca grabbed the resistant Skywalker and brought him out of the arena.
The Rebels returned to the _Millennium Falcon_ and escaped from Nar
Shaddaa.[67]

#### Vrogas Vas

    " _...right now I'm just a Rebel pilot who needs to help his friends. Learning to be a Jedi will have to wait._ "
    ―Skywalker, to R2-D2[69]

Though he was unable to acquire the relics in Grakkus' palace, the holocrons
he activated gave Skywalker one important piece of information: the existence
of a Jedi Temple on Vrogas Vas. Skywalker returned to the Alliance but still
sought answers, so he traveled to Vrogas Vas and was stationed in orbit with
Red Squadron, along with [Blue
Squadron](/wiki/Blue_Squadron_\(Rebel_Alliance\) "Blue Squadron \(Rebel
Alliance\)") and [Yellow Squadron](/wiki/Yellow_Squadron_\(Rebel_Alliance\)
"Yellow Squadron \(Rebel Alliance\)"). While in orbit and preparing for
training exercises, Darth Vader[69]--who had learned of Skywalker's location
from one of his associates, a rogue [archaeologist](/wiki/Archaeologist
"Archaeologist") named [Aphra](/wiki/Chelli_Lona_Aphra "Chelli Lona
Aphra")[70]--dropped out of hyperspace in his TIE Advanced x1 starfighter.
Vader made quick work of Blue Squadron and Yellow Squadron, destroying them
both as Red Squadron looked on. Skywalker sensed that Vader was the pilot of
the enemy starfighter, made a run towards him, and crashed his X-wing fighter
into the Sith Lord's TIE Advanced. The collision damaged both vessels and send
them hurtling towards the surface of Vrogas Vas.[69]

Aphra")[70]--dropped out of hyperspace in his TIE Advanced x1 starfighter.
Vader made quick work of Blue Squadron and Yellow Squadron, destroying them
both as Red Squadron looked on. Skywalker sensed that Vader was the pilot of
the enemy starfighter, made a run towards him, and crashed his X-wing fighter
into the Sith Lord's TIE Advanced. The collision damaged both vessels and send
them hurtling towards the surface of Vrogas Vas.[69]

Skywalker senses the presences of Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker in the
temple ruins.

Skywalker and Vader both survived the crashes of their starfighters, though
they impacted on the surface in different places. The young Jedi crashed
outside of the ruins of the Jedi Temple, from which he witnessed the
destruction of [Gray Squadron](/wiki/Gray_Squadron_\(Rebel_Alliance\) "Gray
Squadron \(Rebel Alliance\)") forces sent to attack Vader--part of a major
Rebel operation to capture the lone Sith Lord. He put off his search for
answers and began to make his way towards the Rebel forces, determined to help
his friends.[69] As he passed through the ruins of the Jedi Temple, he could
see [yet another](/wiki/Cyan_Three "Cyan

Jedi crashed
outside of the ruins of the Jedi Temple, from which he witnessed the
destruction of [Gray Squadron](/wiki/Gray_Squadron_\(Rebel_Alliance\) "Gray
Squadron \(Rebel Alliance\)") forces sent to attack Vader--part of a major
Rebel operation to capture the lone Sith Lord. He put off his search for
answers and began to make his way towards the Rebel forces, determined to help
his friends.[69] As he passed through the ruins of the Jedi Temple, he could
see [yet another](/wiki/Cyan_Three "Cyan Three") Rebel pilot being killed by
the Dark Lord. Unknown to Skywalker was that, at the same time, he was being
tracked by Vader's companions--Aphra and the [assassin
droids](/wiki/Assassin_droid "Assassin droid") [BT-1](/wiki/BT-1 "BT-1") and
[0-0-0](/wiki/0-0-0 "0-0-0"). While the Sith Lord's followers prepared a plan
to capture the boy, Skywalker found writings in the ruins that were written
with a lightsaber, letting him deduce that the ruins were from the Jedi. A
cold feeling passed over him and he could sense the presence of what he
thought was Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker. He tried to concentrate, but
he was interrupted by what he thought was Threepio's arrival. In reality, it
was Triple-Zero, painted in gold by Aphra, who placed his metal hand on
Skywalker and sent an electrical charge through the boy's body, knocking him
unconscious.[71]

Aphra and Triple-Zero prepared to take Skywalker hostage when Artoo stepped in
to help. Bee Tee then brought his arsenal to bear on the rebel's astromech and
chased him off. Aphra and Triple-Zero then seized Skywalker but were stopped
by the smuggler Han Solo, who had a sniper rifle aimed at them. Chewbacca then
came in and attacked the protocol droid, ripping his arm off. Skywalker then
regained consciousness, dispatched Bee Tee, and sliced off Triple-Zero's other
arm with his lightsaber. Skywalker and his allies then retreated when Bee Tee
fired his weapons blindly.[72]

help. Bee Tee then brought his arsenal to bear on the rebel's astromech and

fired his weapons blindly.[72]

Skywalker, Solo, Chewbacca, and Artoo made their way back to the Millennium
Falcon. They then lifted off in order to aid princess Leia. They were forced
to the ground when their ship was crashed into by the Wookiee bounty hunter
Black Krrsantan. While Solo and Chewbacca dealt with the mercenary, Skywalker
left to head back to the Jedi ruins.[73]

Luke arrived back at the the Jedi temple looking for Leia. It was then that he
heard the voice of Obi-Wan Kenobi, who told him that he should not have come
to this place and that he was not ready for what is coming. Luke was then
intercepted by a company of stormtroopers who opened fire on him. He retreated
behind cover but was hit in the head and knocked unconscious.[74]

Luke was taken prisoner by the forces of Commander [Karbin](/wiki/Karbin
"Karbin"). However Darth Vader, who had a rivalry with Karbin, used the force
to crash the shuttle Skywalker was kept in. Now free, he then caught up with
Solo, Chewbacca, C-3PO, and R2-D2. They made their way back to the Millennium
Falcon, however Dr. Aphra had laid out a minefield to stop them. When she was
distracted she was knocked out from behind by Princess Leia. Believing her to
be of use, Organa decided to take the archaeologist with them. As they
departed Vrogas Vas, Skywalker felt remorse that he would not be able to go
back to the temple and see what was hidden there.[75]

and Solo deliver nerfs on Ibaar.

Upon returning to the Rebel fleet with their new prisoner, Doctor Aphra,
Skywalker and his friends went their separate ways; Organa, Artoo, and
Threepio went to detain Aphra at an Alliance-controlled space station,
[Sunspot Prison](/wiki/Sunspot_Prison "Sunspot Prison"), with the assistance
of [Sana Starros](/wiki/Sana_Starros "Sana Starros"), whom Organa hired to
transport them to the prison. Meanwhile, Solo and Skywalker were dispatched to
buy supplies for the rebellion. Solo attempted to double the money he was
given for supplies by betting on [sabacc](/wiki/Sabacc "Sabacc"). However, he
was caught cheating, and had to escape with Skywalker on the _Millennium
Falcon_.[76]

Skywalker and Solo traveled to Nar Shaddaa where Luke was tasked with finding
a customer in need of a ship. He made a deal to haul [nerfs](/wiki/Nerf
"Nerf") to [Ibaar](/wiki/Ibaar "Ibaar") for 5,000 credits, which was just
enough to replace the credits lost by Solo. Skywalker and Solo were soon
intercepted by TIE fighters who suspected the Falcon of smuggling illegal
livestock.[77] Luke was able to shoot the fighters and he and Solo made it to
Ibaar with the nerfs. While on Ibaar, Skywalker blackmailed Solo into allowing
him to fly the Falcon for a few parsecs by threatening to tell Leia about
losing the credits in a Sabacc game.[78]

After buying the supplies, Skywalker and Solo received a distress call from
Sana and arrived at Sunspot Prison. They were immediately knocked out and
taken captive by the [masked assailant](/wiki/Eneb_Ray "Eneb Ray") who was
attacking the prison. Neither came to until after the battle had already ended
and the attacker had been captured.[79]

    ―Luke Skywalker to R2-D2[80]

#### Temporary outpost

    " _I just go word that the cargo vessel just arrived. Looks like the mission was canceled. Hope you didn't go through too much trouble._ "
    ―Luke Skywalker to R2-D2[80]

Sometime after the assault on Sunspot Prison, the Alliance established a
temporary [outpost](/wiki/LX-Robynsun_V "LX-Robynsun V") on the Outer Rim
planet [Reamma](/wiki/Reamma "Reamma"). Organa gave Luke a mission to find a
missing Alliance cargo vessel. Skywalker and R2-D2 prepared to make the flight
to look for them. Before they could do that, however, Organa informed
Skywalker that the vessel reported in, cancelling the mission.[80]

#### Hijacking the _Harbinger_

    " _Chances are...This is the last voyage of the_ Harbinger _. So let's make it a memorable one._ "
    ―Skywalker to Organa and Solo[81]

Sometime later, Skywalker and Organa rendezvoused with rebel leadership.
Admiral Ackbar, General Dodonna, and Mon Mothma presented them with the task
of providing aid to the people of [Tureen VII](/wiki/Tureen_VII "Tureen VII"),
a planet that had provided aid to the rebellion in the past. A heavily
blockaded planet with Imperial bases on both of its moons and swarms of TIE
fighters in orbit, the Alliance could not risk sending the fleet. Luke and
Leia proposed stealing an Imperial Star Destroyer and using it to infiltrate
the blockade. Despite some reluctance from Dodonna, Ackbar and Mothma realized
that it was the only choice left.[82]

#### Skorii-Lei Rescue

Afer the hijacking of the [_Harbinger_](/wiki/Harbinger_\(Imperial_I-class\)
"Harbinger \(Imperial I-class\)"), Leia ended up grievously injured on the
planet [Skorii-Lei](/wiki/Skorii-Lei "Skorii-Lei"). Cared for by former
engineer [Pash Davane](/wiki/Pash_Davane "Pash Davane") and carrying vital
Alliance information, Organa was pursued by stormtroopers and barely managed
to escape aboard the _Millennium Falcon_ with Skywalker, Solo, and Chewbacca.
Aboard the _Falcon_ , Davane provided Skywalker with Leia's data tape, which
he noted was a sign of great trust between the two of them. With her place as
a friend of the Alliance confirmed, Skywalker and his allies returned Davane
to her home on Skorii-Lei.[83]

Skywalker worked with Garro to revive a giant of living stone.

Despite the escape from the _Harbinger_ , the heroes quickly realized that
C-3PO was captured during the commotion, and Skywalker was unable to stop
R2-D2 from commandeering an [X-Wing](/wiki/X-wing_starfighter "X-wing
starfighter") to rescue the [protocol droid](/wiki/Protocol_droid "Protocol
droid") on his own. With his own X-wing's [hyperdrive](/wiki/Hyperdrive
"Hyperdrive") temporarily disabled, he resumed reading Ben Kenobi's journal.
Identifying a symbol in the journal as a [star map](/wiki/Star_map "Star
map"), Skywalker decided to visit the [Vagadarr system](/wiki/Vagadarr_system
"Vagadarr system") after reading of a Jedi Master who had ventured there in
the past and encountered enormous [giants](/wiki/Giants_of_living_stone
"Giants of living stone") made of living stone that gave those in close
proximity a power known as [Stonepower](/wiki/Stonepower "Stonepower").
Skywalker hoped that going there would give him the knowledge he needed to
save R2-D2 and C-3PO.[85]

Like the Jedi Master before him, Skywalker was able to

[Vagadarr system](/wiki/Vagadarr_system
"Vagadarr system") after reading of a Jedi Master who had ventured there in
the past and encountered enormous [giants](/wiki/Giants_of_living_stone
"Giants of living stone") made of living stone that gave those in close
proximity a power known as [Stonepower](/wiki/Stonepower "Stonepower").
Skywalker hoped that going there would give him the knowledge he needed to
save R2-D2 and C-3PO.[85]

Like the Jedi Master before him, Skywalker was able to navigate through the
[planet's](/wiki/Vagadarr_Prime "Vagadarr Prime") heavy debris field and land
on the surface, where he encountered [Garro](/wiki/Garro "Garro"), the last
remaining native human, who initially wanted to use Skywalker's life force to
kill the few remaining giant children. Determined to protect them, Skywalker
inspired Garro to change his mind and sacrifice his own life force to revive a
dead giant. Skywalker and the giant children then ventured into the giant's
cave to find the heart of the mountain and finish what Garro started in
reviving the giant, thus completing the mission of the Master from years past
and taking another step in his journey to becoming a [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi
"Jedi").[84]

After arriving on Ktath'atn, Skywalker and the others encountered a mob of
villagers. Skywalker wants to help feed them and Aphra just calls him adorable
and has Krrsantan scare them off. After making the trek to the the entire
party, except for Krrsantan were allowed into the citadel. Skywalker was
curious how Aphra met Krrsantan but she just said it was a long story and that
she owed him a lot of money. Skywalker then asked how Aphra had found him.
Noticing he was struggling, Aphra helped Skywalker put his
[Spavat](/wiki/Spavat "Spavat") on to meet the Queen, and after finished he
insisted that he was more than just a farm boy. While walking toward the main
hall, 0-0-0 teased Skywalker for stuttering when Aphra commented on her
attractiveness but she told the droid only she was allowed to tease him.[86]

In the ballroom, Skywalker was mesmerized by the crowd. Aphra told Skywalker
to follow her lead and advised him to hide his lightsaber, but implies he is
used to keeping his Jedi identity, which he hopes to solidify, a secret. When
Skywalker asked about the Jedi in the crystal, Aphra said she only met him
briefly but that he had strong opinions. After encountering an
[Ezaraan](/wiki/Ezaraa "Ezaraa") guest, Skywalker was initially excited by
them wanting to take down the Empire, but after they explained they wanted to
replace it with a [Dominion of the Ezaraa](/wiki/Dominion_of_the_Ezaraa
"Dominion of the Ezaraa") where they would consume the flesh of all "lesser
species," Skywalker expressed that he thought the guests were crazy. The two
soon saw the [Queen of Ktath'atn](/wiki/Unidentified_Queen_of_Ktath%27atn
"Unidentified Queen of Ktath'atn"), and after being welcomed by one of her
servants, [Varroa](/wiki/Varroa "Varroa"), Aphra presented Skywalker,
describing him as a very interesting Tatooine farm boy, but was rejected.

arm. Skywalker warned the Ezaraan to leave Aphra alone and used the Force to
throw the Ezaraan to the ground, intriguing the Queen and earning a compliment
from Aphra. Varroa ordered all the guests to leave but allowed Skywalker and
his companion to stay so that the Queen could hear his request in the morning,
Aphra telling him he did great. Later, the Queen told her servant
[Vespinax](/wiki/Vespinax "Vespinax") that Skywalker's power and little
experience made him perfect for her intentions to eat him. She then grew her
power in anticipation of eating the Jedi.[86]

The next morning, Skywalker and Aphra made their way to a dining hall to have
breakfast with the Monarch. On the way, after Skywalker expressed how creepy
he thought the place was, Aphra assured him that the Queen's obsession with
Jedi would get her to do what they wanted, but Skwalker was worried by this
because of his encounter with Grakkus the Hutt and Aphra's mention that the
Queen "keeps" her oddities. Aphra told Skywalker to let her do the talking and
then the two walked inside and sat at a table with the Queen, Aphra
introducing the both of them. Excited to see a Jedi, but wanting more
verification, the Queen commanded Skywalker to move a nearby dining tray with
the Force, though he was unable to until the Queen's servant,
[Vespinax](/wiki/Vespinax "Vespinax"), threatened him with a knife to his
throat. However, moving the tray revealed that under it were

Skywalker and Aphra got into an argument about the merits of the Empire in
which Aphra revealed her mother was killed in the Clone Wars, claimed that
regular people preferred the Empire's peace to war, and insisted that she was
not like Solo as Skywalker thought. She attempted to mock him for his

Upon speaking to to the crystal outside, Rur revealed to Aphra that she felt
guilt over leaving Skywalker behind and felt guilt over blaming her actions on

to rescue him, but was quickly enthralled and forced to lead the Queen's
