kills the Queen of Ktath'atn.

Skywalker entered a psychic duel with the Queen to force her to submit. Aphra
allowed [Eternal Rur](/wiki/Eternal_Rur "Eternal Rur") from the crystal to
enter his mind to assist him. Rur advised Skywalker to use the symbiote to his
advantage, claiming that tying the Force's abilities into the parasite's
emotional drive would make him immensely powerful. Realizing Rur was not a
true Jedi and only a person with the knowledge of one, Skywalker ignored him
and instead let go and connected to the Force. He was able to free himself of
the symbiote's influence and strike down the Queen, believing that being free
was more important to be a Jedi than just Rur's knowledge. Solo and all those
under the Queen's control were freed, Skywalker reunited with Organa, and the
Citadel was destroyed by BT-1. Later, after telling Starros it was time to go,
Skywalker told Aphra that he did not want the crystal because it was not a
Jedi in any real way. But he said that he had learned from it that there would
not be any shortcuts to be a Jedi, and that people who tried to take them to
get what they wanted, like her, were deluded. Finally, Skywalker told her to
stay away from them. On the way back, while complaining to herself about
Skywalker 0-0-0 pointed out that Skywalker's virtuousness despite his trauma
and her inability to gain his response must be a heavy reminder of the
failures of her character. Skywalker spoke with Starros on the way back,
learning that Aphra had ruined S4 and shocked that Starros and her could have
ever been together.[88]

Luke and Leia were stranded on an oceanic planet for three weeks.

Skywalker later took part in a mission with Leia, piloting a [Taylander
shuttle](/wiki/Taylander_shuttle "Taylander shuttle") with the princess. With
Imperial TIE Fighters in pursuit, Skywalker was forced to fly into a
[nebula](/wiki/Nebula "Nebula"), which disabled the shuttle's systems, forcing
them to crash land on an [ocean planet](/wiki/Unidentified_ocean_planet
"Unidentified ocean planet"). Stranded on the planet for three
[weeks](/wiki/Standard_week "Standard week"), Skywalker's experience with
machinery, such as [moisture vaporators](/wiki/Moisture_vaporator "Moisture
vaporator") helped keep himself and

With
Imperial TIE Fighters in pursuit, Skywalker was forced to fly into a
[nebula](/wiki/Nebula "Nebula"), which disabled the shuttle's systems, forcing
them to crash land on an [ocean planet](/wiki/Unidentified_ocean_planet
"Unidentified ocean planet"). Stranded on the planet for three
[weeks](/wiki/Standard_week "Standard week"), Skywalker's experience with
machinery, such as [moisture vaporators](/wiki/Moisture_vaporator "Moisture
vaporator") helped keep himself and Leia alive. Having to live off of the
land, the two grew closer, relating to each other because of their status as
orphans. They eventually realized that there was a [native
species](/wiki/Unidentified_aquatic_species "Unidentified aquatic species")
living in the planet's ocean. Not wanting to bring the war to these people,
Skywalker and Organa set a trap for the Imperial forces that were
[pursuing](/wiki/Escape_from_an_unidentified_ocean_planet "Escape from an
unidentified ocean planet") them. Luke used the native's resources, as well as
his own lightsaber, to fend off an AT-AT and
[shoretroopers](/wiki/Coastal_defender_stormtrooper "Coastal defender
stormtrooper"). Although close to being defeated, Leia used a flaming arrow to
light explosive chemicals and disable the [AT-
AT](/wiki/All_Terrain_Armored_Transport_\(Galactic_Civil_War\) "All Terrain
Armored Transport \(Galactic Civil War\)"). Afterwards, they were able to
repair the shuttle and return to the Rebel Fleet.[92]

Shortly afterward, Skywalker and his team intercepted a message from R2-D2,
who had successfully [rescued](/wiki/Mission_to_rescue_C-3PO "Mission to
rescue C-3PO") C-3PO from Imperial capture. They saved R2's X-wing from Darth
Vader and escaped in hyperspace.[93]

By then, Task Force 99 had [destroyed](/wiki/Mission_to_Horox_III "Mission to
Horox III") the Horox III rebel outpost. The team arrived there, discovering
the devastation. Fearing further danger, they left without burying the

and his team intercepted a message from R2-D2,
who had successfully [rescued](/wiki/Mission_to_rescue_C-3PO "Mission to
rescue C-3PO") C-3PO from Imperial capture. They saved R2's X-wing from Darth
Vader and escaped in hyperspace.[93]

By then, Task Force 99 had [destroyed](/wiki/Mission_to_Horox_III "Mission to
Horox III") the Horox III rebel outpost. The team arrived there, discovering
the devastation. Fearing further danger, they left without burying the rebel
troopers, but Skywalker insisted that they honor the dead. Together they built
a cremation pile before leaving.[91]

#### Ashes of Jedha

    " _I've been thinking about Jyn and the rest of Rogue One. How many things went wrong for them? And Rogue One took whatever steps they needed. People making distractions, sacrificing themselves, amping up the signal. All improvised. This chain of sacrifice... All leading to_ me _taking that shot._ "
    ―Luke Skywalker contemplating the sacrifice of Rogue One[94]

rebels journeyed to what remained of the moon [Jedha](/wiki/Jedha "Jedha"),

defended what remained of [Saw Gerrera](/wiki/Saw_Gerrera "Saw Gerrera")'s
[Partisans](/wiki/Partisans "Partisans") from invading
[snowtroopers](/wiki/Cold_weather_assault_stormtrooper "Cold weather assault

[Chulco Gi](/wiki/Chulco_Gi "Chulco Gi"), an aspirant to the [Disciples of the
Whills](/wiki/Disciples_of_the_Whills "Disciples of the Whills"), someone who
could potentially guide him in learning about the Force. Gi led the rebels to
the rest of the Partisans on Jedha and placed hoods over their heads, in
keeping with

Falcon_. Moving to
[NaJedha](/wiki/NaJedha "NaJedha"), the planet that Jedha orbited, Luke met

Saw Gerrera's former second-in-command, the remaining extremists held guns at
their fellow rebels' heads.[95]

Benthic questioned why the Alliance would attempt to mend their relations with
the Partisans and return to Jedha, and Leia revealed that the Empire had
resumed mining [Kyber crystals](/wiki/Kyber_crystal "Kyber crystal") on the
planet and that the Alliance hoped to aid the Partisans in fighting against
the Empire. Though wary of Alliance support, Benthic was nonetheless willing
to accept some aid. Luke, shaken by the Partisans' extreme methods, was
conflicted by agreeing to help them, but
[specforces](/wiki/Rebel_Alliance_Special_Forces "Rebel Alliance Special
Forces") operative [Ubin Des](/wiki/Ubin_Des "Ubin Des") reassured him that it
was the right thing to do. Later in the ruined settlement of [Ai-
jed](/wiki/Ai-jed "Ai-jed"), Luke, Chulco, and Ubin contemplated why people
would stay on a ruined planet. Stormtroopers armed with
[flamethrowers](/wiki/Flamethrower "Flamethrower") attempted to incinerate the
remaining civilians, but Luke lashed out against them with his lightsaber,
cutting them all down. Realizing all that was at stake in the Galactic Civil
War, Skywalker approached Benthic with Han Solo and wholeheartedly agreed to
assist him in his fight. Their first target was the [drill
citadel](/wiki/Drill_citadel "Drill citadel"), a mining device from the planet
[Shu-Torun](/wiki/Shu-Torun "Shu-Torun") that the Empire began using to mine
Kyber crystals on Jedha.[96]

Benthic and Luke scaled the drill citadel and the Tognath ruthlessly killed
the station's guards, much to Skywalker's chagrin. Benthic held a technician
at gunpoint and forced him to lower the citadel's shields before killing him
as well. This allowed Han Solo, aboard the _Millennium Falcon_ , to destroy
the drill citadel after Benthic and Luke escaped. Later, a disillusioned
Chulco asked Luke to accompany him to meet the

that the Empire began using to mine
Kyber crystals on Jedha.[96]

Benthic and Luke scaled the drill citadel and the Tognath ruthlessly killed
the station's guards, much to Skywalker's chagrin. Benthic held a technician
at gunpoint and forced him to lower the citadel's shields before killing him
as well. This allowed Han Solo, aboard the _Millennium Falcon_ , to destroy
the drill citadel after Benthic and Luke escaped. Later, a disillusioned
Chulco asked Luke to accompany him to meet the [Central
Isopter](/wiki/Central_Isopter "Central Isopter"), a death-worshipping cult
that Gi claimed was wise in the Force. Although Luke was hesitant to seek the
guidance from someone other than a disciple of the Jedi, he nonetheless was
willing to go along. Leia attempted to convince him that his duty to the
Alliance was most important, but Luke believed that becoming a Jedi and
avenging all those slain by Darth Vader was the most important duty to him.
Entering a chasm alongside Gi, the duo were attacked by a [sand
slug](/wiki/Sand_slug "Sand slug"), a giant, normally herbivorous animal
negatively influenced by the Dark Side of the Force. Able to slay the beast,
Skywalker and Gi were finally confronted by the Central Isopter, who claimed
that they had come to join them "in the shadow of death."[97]

The temple of the Central Isopter.

At the edge of the planet's blast crater, Chulco and the Central Isopter
presented Luke with the [Temple of Central
Isopter](/wiki/Temple_of_Central_Isopter "Temple of Central Isopter"), a
shrine surrounded by the Dark Side of the Force. The cult implored Skywalker
and Gi to meditate and listen to the chasm's call. They both did, but Luke
refused to let the Dark Side take hold of him. However, Chulco was possessed
by the darkness and attacked Luke, forcing the Jedi trainee to strike him
down. The cultists then announced that they had received a distress call from
Chewbacca, who was being pursued by a TIE fighter over NaJedha. Luke borrowed
a ship, was able to destroy the TIE fighter and bring an injured Chewie to the
planet, where he provided the Alliance with the plans for the
[_Leviathan_](/wiki/Leviathan_\(Continent-class_crawler\) "Leviathan
\(Continent-class crawler\)"), a mobile fortress able to strip mine Kyber
crystals from Jedha.[98]

from
Chewbacca, who was being pursued by a TIE fighter over NaJedha. Luke borrowed

Han, Leia, and Benthic formed a strategy to destroy the _Leviathan_ using the
plans Chewbacca obtained. After the meeting, Luke ruminated on the sacrifice
Rogue One made to get the Death Star plans to the Alliance, ultimately leading
to him making the shot that destroyed the battle station. A newly motivated
Luke accompanied Leia, C-3PO, and R2-D2 aboard the crawler and readied
themselves for taking control of it. Skywalker made his way to the bridge of
the _Leviathan_ and held its commander, [Kanchar](/wiki/Kanchar "Kanchar"),
hostage but the Imperial's cybernetic arm was equipped with a blade able to
defend against Luke's lightsaber.[94]

confronts Kanchar

Kanchar pursued Luke throughout the ship with his cybernetic arm's blade and
flamethrower. Eventually leading the officer to the crawler's hangar,
Skywalker activated an ion torpedo, which shut down Kanchar's cybernetics and
allowed Luke to knock him out. Having taken total control of the _Leviathan_
with the help of the double-crossing Queen [Trios](/wiki/Trios "Trios"), the
rebels brought it to Jedha's chasm, destroyed it, and escaped with not much
time to spare. Having saved what remained of Jedha and made allies in the form
of the Partisans and Queen Trios, Luke and his friends left Jedha.[99]

leads a tour of Crait's salt flats

After a mission with a plan made by Solo went awry, Skywalker, who had helped
fight in his X-Wing, escaped to [Baraan-Fa](/wiki/Baraan-Fa "Baraan-Fa") with
the rest of the Alliance. Organa then put him in charge of a mission to the
planet [Crait](/wiki/Crait "Crait") to survey its facilities as a base.
Skywalker, flying there in a [GR-75 medium
transport](/wiki/GR-75_medium_transport "GR-75 medium transport"), believed
the mission was just delivering farm equipment, and was reluctant to go there
as he directed those on the mission to land. Once there, they met up with
[Trusk Berinato](/wiki/Trusk_Berinato "Trusk Berinato"), who led them all to
the mines of the planet on [V-4X-D ski speeders](/wiki/V-4X-D_ski_speeder
"V-4X-D ski speeder"). After receiving new orders from Organa, Luke stated
that he found the mission particularly irritating, as it reminded him of his
life as a farm boy. Once they arrived, Solo encouraged him to enjoy the
mission since they were not in danger. He told everyone to follow him.[100]

Skywalker and his team, which included Antilles, began using the farming
equipment to make trenches in Crait's surface, though he said he would rather
do anything else. Green worms then appeared from the ground and Antilles and
Solo tried to shoot them, but Skywalker realized they would leave you alone if
you left them alone. Still being reminded of home, Skywalker reluctantly
continued an environmental assessment, discovering and rationalizing an
underground ecosystem where the worms came from and realizing it was drying up
quickly. Following a hunch, Skywalker took Antilles with him on the ski
speeders and they discovered bodies that appeared to have been flash dried.
Realizing what happened, Skywalker rushed to tell the others. He reached
Organa and told her he resented her for sending him on this mission, but she
said he reminded him of her and complimented him before giving him a kiss on
the cheek. He then finished what he was trying to say and explained that they
need to leave because a deadly salt storm was coming in. After

Realizing what happened, Skywalker rushed to tell the others. He reached

Skywalker, Ackbar and Organa began to negotiate as an Imperial [LAAT/le patrol
gunship](/wiki/LAAT/le_patrol_gunship "LAAT/le patrol gunship") approached.

otherwise and advised Skywalker not to use his lightsaber while he spoke with

Solo's plan resulted in stormtroopers pursuing them, Skywalker went with the
others through the forest to a boat where Chewbacca was waiting. On the boat,
Organa continued to try an convince Urtya, but he said that he did not want to
sacrifice Mon Cala, but Skywalker shot back, insisting he could not talk to
the Princess of Alderaan about sacrifice. They eventually made it back to the
_Falcon_ and then to the [Mako-Ta Space Docks](/wiki/Mako-Ta_Space_Docks
"Mako-Ta Space Docks") that the Rebellion was using as a production center,

Moncaladrome

After debriefing the Clawdite, whose name was [Tunga
Arpagion](/wiki/Tunga_Arpagion "Tunga Arpagion"), that he was to impersonate
the Moff of the [Calamari sector](/wiki/Calamari_sector "Calamari sector")
[Tan Hubi](/wiki/Tan_Hubi "Tan Hubi") while they kidnapped him, Skywalker
insisting the ordeal would make Arpagion more famous. At the
[Moncaladrome](/wiki/Moncaladrome "Moncaladrome") on Mon Cala, Skywalker
impersonated a stormtrooper, Organa ordering him to wait until they drugged
the Moff and then bring him back to their hideout. Solo and Chewbacca went
into a refresher and anticipated kidnapping Hubi while Skywalker stood outside
as a stormtrooper and told everyone around that the room was for the Moff's
private use, though one Imperial officer did manage to Force themself through.
After successfully kidnapping Hubi, Skywalker returned to Organa and warned
her to be quick so that others would not notice the switch. After Arpagion
copied Hubi's appearance, Skywalker told him "May the Force be with you"
before departing with the others and a tied up Hubi in a Mon Cal ship to
rescue Mon Cal King [Lee-Char](/wiki/Lee-Char "Lee-Char") from [Strokill
Prime](/wiki/Strokill_Prime "Strokill Prime").[103]

Once there, Skywalker commented that it made sense they would keep Lee-Char on
a water world, though admitted the place looked bleak. After avoiding the
planet's security using Hubi's biosignature, they took the ship to the planet
and underwater, where they encountered a giant terrifying sea creature.[103]
Organa realized that the creature was attracted to their ship because of the
light. Solo was skeptical, but Skywalker told him not to question her and
informed them he was going to carry out a plan with Chewbacca's help and to be
ready. Donning a full body diving suit while Chewbacca set up an underwater
sled, Skywalker shot out far away from the ship after Chewbacca gave Skywalker
a hug and he thanked the Wookiee. Away from the ship in the expanse of the
ocean, Skywalker ignited

underwater, where they encountered a giant terrifying sea creature.[103]
Organa realized that the creature was attracted to their ship because of the
light. Solo was skeptical, but Skywalker told him not to question her and
informed them he was going to carry out a plan with Chewbacca's help and to be
ready. Donning a full body diving suit while Chewbacca set up an underwater
sled, Skywalker shot out far away from the ship after Chewbacca gave Skywalker
a hug and he thanked the Wookiee. Away from the ship in the expanse of the
ocean, Skywalker ignited his lightsaber, leading the creature away with the
light. Chewbacca then used a water sled and a breath mask to quickly go after
Skywalker and bring him back to the ship as he turned off his lightsaber.[105]

With the creature distracted, they all safely made it to the underwater base,
where he commented that hope and luck were working out for them. They then
discovered that Lee-Char was hooked up to a machine that was the only thing
keeping him alive, and Solo said Skywalker jinxed them.[105] Skywalker
attempted to calm an angry Solo, and Lee-Char suggested that they could just
carry his words to his people instead of having to lead them directly,
prompting Skywalker to suggest they search for a recording droid there.[104]

After bringing back a camera droid, Skywalker watched as the King recorded his
message, before noticing stormtroopers and screaming out to everyone that they
had been noticed. The stormtroopers shot into the room, killing Lee-Char, but
the group escaped with the recording back to their ship, Skywalker defending
them with a blaster and directing them to get onboard and get to hyperspace
quickly. He then pointed out that the _Falcon_ with its touchy hyperdrive
would not have been able to pull that off, but Solo warned him to stop
disparaging the ship. They met back up with C-3PO in a deserted cove on Mon
Cala, Skywalker revealing to the droid that the king could not be moved but
having hope that his message was worth it because people were counting on
them. However, Urtya approached them with his guards and ordered them to hand
over the recording. As he forcefully took it from Organa, Skywalker screamed
that Lee-Char would be ashamed, though Solo told him to top talking and that
they needed to get out of there. However, Urtya decided to show the footage
too all of the fleet captains. Back on the _Falcon_ , Skywalker heard on an
earpiece that the people on the Mon Calamari ships were rebelling because of
footage of Lee-Char. Because of this, however, the Imperial fleet
arrived.[104]

Later, Skywalker participated in a celebration of the commencement of the
Rebel fleet at the Rebel Base at Mako-Ta, using his X-Wing to create a display
trail of blue light alongside other X-Wings creating trails of other colors.
After landing back in the hangar bay, Skywalker expressed his enthusiasm that
amount Rebels present could definitively defeat the Empire, though had to
assure General Dodonna that he was not being overconfident and was just
excited. However, due to a betrayal by Queen Trios of Shu-Torun, the
commencement failed and the Imperial Navy arrived, which Skywalker saw from a
window and suspected was led by Vader. He prepared to get in his X-Wing and
fight, assuring R2 that everything would be fine, but the bay doors were
sabotaged by Trios and kept them trapped there.[108]

He then watched with shock as one of the Alliance's cruisers was
destroyed[108] and others started to be, but still assured Zev that they had
survived the Death Star and would not die there. Skywalker and Antilles then
spotted the _Falcon_ taking on the fighters, both confused as to what Solo was
doing there. Unbeknownst to them Solo was trying to get to them to let them
know that the bay doors would open if they just flew toward them because of a
fail-safe.[109]

Skywalker was disturbed by feeling powerless to help and only watch the ships
get destroyed, but Solo sent C-3PO in an escape pod to the hangar bay, who
informed him that they could leave by flying at the doors. Skywalker rallied
all of the fighters to get ready to launch and readied R2. Dodonna commed
Skywalker, who informed him of the situation, but Dodonna warned him that they

### Rebel Commander

#### Battle of Mako-Ta

    " _We have more important business. Leia Ogana: You are now a general. Luke Skywalker: You are now a commander. Han Solo: You are now a colonel._ "  
" _We're being_ promoted?"  
" _The Rebellion command has been decimated. Every candidate of quality needs
to step forward._ "

    ―Mon Mothma and Leia Organa, the former speaking to Organa, Skywalker, and Solo via hologram[110]

Entering the [battle](/wiki/Assault_on_the_Mako-Ta_Space_Docks "Assault on the
Mako-Ta Space Docks"), Skywalker called out to Rogue Eight to warn them that
someone was on their tail, but their X-wing was destroyed. Solo advised the
squadron to stay close to the destroyers, and as they did, Skywalker noticed
the decrepit state of the _Falcon_ and asked what happened to it, Solo merely
replying that Darth Vader got to it and warning Skywalker that he was still
there somewhere. After Solo's plan paid off, Skywalker made a joke to him by
calling him an Admiral, which Solo told

"Assault on the
Mako-Ta Space Docks"), Skywalker called out to Rogue Eight to warn them that
someone was on their tail, but their X-wing was destroyed. Solo advised the
squadron to stay close to the destroyers, and as they did, Skywalker noticed
the decrepit state of the _Falcon_ and asked what happened to it, Solo merely
replying that Darth Vader got to it and warning Skywalker that he was still
there somewhere. After Solo's plan paid off, Skywalker made a joke to him by
calling him an Admiral, which Solo told him never to do again. From the base,
Organa hoped out loud that Skywalker would spread the word after learning that
he was out there.[111]

Knowing that they needed to spread the word to the other cruisers that they
could launch their fighters but not wanting to split up to land on them,
Skywalker told Rogue Squadron to form up on him as he made a run past Ackbar's
ship with his display trail on, ignoring Antilles's warnings against it. As
Ackbar watched, his attention grabbed by the display trail, Skywalker flew
toward the bay doors on one of the cruisers, which opened. Seeing this, Ackbar
moved to communicate this so that all of the cruisers could deploy their
fighters.[111] Solo then announced to Skywalker that the _Falcon_ was too
damaged and so he was flying an X-wing.[112]

Skywalker and Organa return to the Mako-Ta Space Docks to perform a rescue

Skywalker pursued a rogue TIE fighter that had escaped, and that unbeknownst
to him was piloted by Organa, who decided to take it while fleeing Vader and
his Star Destroyer the _[Executor](/wiki/Executor "Executor")_. Sensing
something was off and noticing the pilot's skill, Skywalker had R2 try and
scan and message it, to no avail. When Organ shot down another TIE, Skywalker
realized the pilot was on their side. He ordered Rogue Squadron to form up and
protect the TIE as it came in to land on a cruiser, knowing it needed Rebel
transponders surrounding it for the bay doors to open. This was successful,
but Skywalker's fighter was shot as he did this and crashed into the bay. Solo
and Organa rushed to make sure he was all right, leaving Skywalker shocked
Organa had been piloting the TIE, but all of them were happy things worked out
well for them.[112]

Due to the counter-codes Organa had retrieved from the _Executor_ , the
cruiser escaped to hyperspace, though Skywalker wanted to go back and try and
rescue more people, pointing out that his chance had worked out before.
Dodonna criticized him for this and told him the decision was not his, merely
telling Skywalker and Organa to prepare for war.[112] After it was decided to
attempt a rescue, Solo returned to Mako-Ta with Rogue Squadron, Skywalker
telling them he would fly with them again soon, causing Organa to make a
comment implying he was neurotic. As Organa told Mon Mothma to get the
ambassadors to board their ship, he spotted a TIE fighter coming to them, but
it was shot down by Solo. Soon after, Skywalker tried to inform Solo that they
were almost ready

telling Skywalker and Organa to prepare for war.[112] After it was decided to

#### Er'Kit

    " _Rebel intelligence heard some strange things about the Malachor Company, and as soon as I got here to investigate I felt an... echo in the Force. I don't quite know how to explain it, but there's more going on here on Er'Kit than meets the eye._ "
    ―Luke Skywalker, during the operations on Er'Kit[113]

Following the [attack](/wiki/Assault_on_the_Mako-Ta_Space_Docks "Assault on
the Mako-Ta Space Docks") on the [Mako-Ta Space Docks](/wiki/Mako-
Ta_Space_Docks "Mako-Ta Space Docks"), Skywalker was promoted to the rank of
commander.[114] After being promoted, Skywalker was sent to the desert world
of Er'Kit, where the locals were being oppressed by a group of
[mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenary "Mercenary") known as the [Malachor
Company](/wiki/Malachor_Company "Malachor Company"). Upon arriving on the
desert world, Skywalker sensed through the Force that there was something more
at play beyond the actions of a few mercenaries. He requested the assistance
of [an agent](/wiki/Saponza%27s_partner "Saponza's partner") who had a
reputation for desert warfare and, together, the two defeated the mercenary
outposts. The two also discovered from Imperial operatives in the
[sector](/wiki/Sector "Sector") that Imperial supplies were being ferried from
Nar Shaddaa to Er'Kit, suggesting a large-scale operation was under way.
Eventually, Skywalker and the agent

world, Skywalker sensed through the Force that there was something more
at play beyond the actions of a few mercenaries. He requested the assistance
of [an agent](/wiki/Saponza%27s_partner "Saponza's partner") who had a

village.[113]

Er'Kit

Among the mercenaries' possessions, Skywalker and the agent discovered a
document proving that Malachor Company was preparing to ship supplies
somewhere, and its coordinates led Skywalker and the agent to an Imperial base
on the planet. They subsequently attacked several Imperial bases until they
found intelligence pertaining to the Empire's operation on the planet. Once
they located the base from which the Imperials deployed most of their forces
on the planet, Skywalker assaulted it with the assistance of Princess Organa.
The Rebels razed the base, dealing an important blow to the Empire's
operations on Er'Kit, but they still lacked vital information on what the
Empire's true purpose was on the planet. Skywalker gradually discovered
Imperial logs detailing how Malachor Company had been hired by the Imperial
Security Bureau and

agent to an Imperial base
on the planet. They subsequently attacked several Imperial bases until they
found intelligence pertaining to the Empire's operation on the planet. Once
they located the base from which the Imperials deployed most of their forces
on the planet, Skywalker assaulted it with the assistance of Princess Organa.
The Rebels razed the base, dealing an important blow to the Empire's
operations on Er'Kit, but they still lacked vital information on what the
Empire's true purpose was on the planet. Skywalker gradually discovered
Imperial logs detailing how Malachor Company had been hired by the Imperial
Security Bureau and were tasked with forcibly relocating natives to make room
for [Project Hidden Eye](/wiki/Project_Hidden_Eye "Project Hidden Eye"). This
ISB operation was intended to create cybernetic [sleeper
agents](/wiki/Sleeper_operative "Sleeper operative") who could be deployed
throughout the galaxy and spy on galactic citizens on behalf of the ISB. Upon
its discovery, Project Hidden Eye was nearly ready to deploy its first wave of
spies.[113]

To prevent the operation from being carried out, Skywalker and the agent led
their troops to the base that housed Project Hidden Eye. They fought through
its staging area and ultimately took out the installation, ending the Imperial
project for good. Skywalker thanked the agent for their service and then
remained on Er'Kit for a short time, helping the Rebel Alliance execute
additional missions on the desert world.[113]

and Benthic come into conflict on the Spike.

Skywalker ran through the Spike, using his lightsaber to deactivate a blast
door's controls and close it. As the Partisans started to open it, Skywalker
told R2 that they could not do anything without the droid, instructing him to
hide while he led the Partisans away. He did so successfully, but was cornered
by the Partisans, who then contacted R2 and told him that if he did not come
to them they would kill Skywalker. R2 did what they said despite Skywalker
insisting his life was not worth it and begging him to stop.[119]

As R2 set the Spike to destroy the planet, Skywalker told the droid that he
did not understand him because saving his life was not worth killing millions.
Skywalker secretly hoped stormtroopers would show up and take down the
Partisans. He unsuccessfully tried to talk Benthic into stopping, but Organa
and Solo arrived and the former successfully talked him down. As Skywalker and
the others escaped in the _Falcon_ , refusing to give in to Imperial forces
that had arrived, C-3PO revealed that R2 kept telling Skywalker to "trust in
the Force" when he was beeping. After making it to hyperspace, Skywalker asked
what they would do about the Partisans, who he called traitorous, them all
eventually deciding to drop them off on [Salobea](/wiki/Salobea "Salobea").
Back at the _Home One_ , Skywalker asked Meorti if they had gotten an appetite
for the field, but she said she had not and sped off. Organa then listed off a
bunch of possible locations for a new rebel base provided to her by General
Dodonna, one of which was Hoth, Skywalker declaring that one of the places
would be their new home.[120]

so much at the bar was because she knew the Force, saying she recognized
Skywalker as someone who sought it.[122]

Eventually the speeder Skywalker and Calip were in was deactivated from afar
by the owner and the two introduced themselves to each other. When he
questioned his decision to rescue her, she claimed she had cheated earlier
using a Jedi mind trick, though she was not a Jedi. She also saw his
lightsaber and told him to tell her all about it after they moved the speeder
and then hid. Once they did, and saw the owner coming for it, they hid out in
a forest of dead trees, though Calip no longer was interested in hearing about
his lightsaber or helping him with the Force because she said using the Force
got people killed. He insisted he just needed a little help, before noticing
that Calip had stolen his lightsaber and pulling it back to him to activate
it. After contacting someone named Tinga about the lightsaber, Calip tried to
suggest that Skywalker run away and settle down, but he insisted that he
needed to learn about the Force to fight the Empire and tried to convince her
to help him with his mission to destroy the shuttles that had arrived there,
explaining that he was unable to locate them with the Force. She claimed that
she could teach him to reach out with his mind and find them, but that it
would take too long and they should just rob a bank instead, confusing
Skywalker.[123]

said he was trying to take down a star destroyer with a transport shuttle.

While landing his X-wing on K43, the starfighter was hit by an electromagnetic
pulse generated by the planet's natives, the [Kakrans](/wiki/Kakran "Kakran"),
in an attempt to combat Vader. As a result, the X-wing crashed and R2 was
deactivated, leaving Skywalker worried and rattled as he noticed Vader
approaching him with his red lightsaber ignited. However, Vader was attacked
with a rock by Chewbacca before the Sith Lord could reach Skywalker.[127]
After Chewbacca knocked Vader down into a chasm, Skywalker ran to his friend.
Finding his lightsaber unable to activate, he decided to use a rock to bring
an avalanche down on top of Vader while saying the Guardian's mantra, but
ultimately caught caught in the rock slide and had to be saved from the dark
lord's clutches by Chewbacca. Skywalker tried to get Chewbacca to abandon him
and save himself as Chewbacca carried him and ran away from Vader and
blasterfire shot by stormtroopers at the top of the

Skywalker eventually reunited with R2-D2 at his X-wing, but Vader was there
too, with his lightsaber ignited. Skywalker ignited his lightsaber too, but
before they could duel, the ground beneath them collapsed, forcing Skywalker
to jump in the X-wing as the planet was destroyed. As Skywalker flew his

safe and insisted they rescue Skywalker. Skywalker told her that he had known
she would come through. Later, on the Rebel fleet, which was now over the
planet Hoth, Skywalker watched as Champion spoke to Rieekan and commented he
was really good. Organa claimed the reason for this was that he had plans and
did not just show up and hope for the best like Solo, but Skywalker decided
that was all you needed when you had friends as he watched with a smile as

Kullan revealed that he had been working for the Empire and would have had

arrived and announced herself, before shooting at the tractor beams and
freeing Skywalker. He complimented Myrak and said she might not be grounded

and abandoned Kullan, who was then captured by the Rebels. Akbar and C-3Po
then revealed to Skywalker that Myrak had uncovered Kullan's spy messages and
plan to trap him on Valo. Skywalker assured C-3PO that there never had been
any real danger, because Rogue Squadron was on the case and was the best team

Echo Base on Hoth

In [3 ABY](/wiki/3_ABY "3 ABY"),[38] Skywalker and the Rogue Squadron were
transferred to the [Echo Base](/wiki/Echo_Base "Echo Base"), a rebel base on
the iced planet [Hoth](/wiki/Hoth "Hoth"), where he participated in regular
patrols of the frozen perimeter under the callsign [Echo
Three](/wiki/Echo_Three "Echo Three").[9] Upon Skywalker's arrival at Echo
Base, Rebel leadership expected him to use the Force to help excavate the
tunnels by sensing where and when to dig, even though he was unsure of how to
do that. His belongings, including his lightsaber, were placed in a
decontamination unit in case of off-world pathogens. Sergeant

a rebel base on
the iced planet [Hoth](/wiki/Hoth "Hoth"), where he participated in regular
patrols of the frozen perimeter under the callsign [Echo
Three](/wiki/Echo_Three "Echo Three").[9] Upon Skywalker's arrival at Echo
Base, Rebel leadership expected him to use the Force to help excavate the
tunnels by sensing where and when to dig, even though he was unsure of how to
do that. His belongings, including his lightsaber, were placed in a
decontamination unit in case of off-world pathogens. Sergeant [Reyé
Hollis](/wiki/Rey%C3%A9_Hollis "Reyé Hollis") from [Rebel Alliance Special
Forces](/wiki/Rebel_Alliance_Special_Forces "Rebel Alliance Special Forces")
was assigned to familiarize him with the location. After they introduced
themselves to each other and shook hands, Skywalker declared that he was there
to help.[131]

Skywalker hoped to get to know Hollis since they would be working together,
and they both thought the other had attractive qualities, but the sergeant's
anti-Jedi sentiments gave Skywalker the initial impression that the other man
disliked him. He did not recognize that Hollis had a Naboo name, but he could
sense that Naboo was beautiful through Hollis' mental images of home. Hollis
made a derogatory remark about the Jedi and Skywalker defended them. He also
promised not to let the Naboo man down, just before a giant [fork-nosed ice
worm](/wiki/Fork-nosed_ice_worm "Fork-nosed ice worm") broke through the
ground next to them and they were trapped by a cave-in.[131]

Unused to total darkness, Skywalker experienced claustrophobia. He could hear
but not locate Hollis until he tried to use the Force to stretch out his
senses. He tried to remember that darkness had been a comfort back on
Tatooine, but that did not work and he still felt suffocated by the darkness.
He successfully detected that Hollis was nearby using the Force and told the
other man to stay still. When Skywalker approached, they bickered briefly over
what was responsible for the cave-in, Hollis urging him not to use the Force.

Hollis, recognizing that the Jedi was panicking, grabbed Skywalker's hand and
pressed it to a gap in the wall that had air flowing through it. Skywalker
clutched Hollis' hand and asked for his trust. They sat down and kept holding
each other's hands as Skywalker thought about the light and warmth of his home
on Tatooine. Skywalker began to reflect on his fear of what the darkness would
do to him psychologically, referring both to the literal situation they were
in and the general darkness in the galaxy he faced. As their hands warmed,
Skywalker could sense where they could dig through the ice to free themselves
in the Force. They teased each other and laughed before they started digging,
Skywalker recognizing that the Force had never steered him the wrong direction
and suspecting it never would.[131]

At some point, Skywalker walked outside of Echo Base to speak with Captain
[Magna Tolvan](/wiki/Magna_Tolvan "Magna Tolvan"), [Vulaada
Klam](/wiki/Vulaada_Klam "Vulaada Klam"), and [Korin Aphra](/wiki/Korin_Aphra
"Korin Aphra"), the latter of which had been very excited by the idea of the
Force-sensitive pilot and the former recognizing him as the man who destroyed
the Death Star, which Skywalker confirmed. After confirming that they were the
friends of Doctor Chelli Aphra, Skywalker told them that a Rebellion spy had
revealed that he had learned from a comms jockey on the _Executor_ that
someone had sabotaged the Empire's computers and made it hard for them to
search for the Alliance. He explained that the Empire had put out a warrant
for the culprit, and then revealed that their description matched that of
Doctor Aphra and her droid companions. Skywalker revealed that sabotage had
set the Empire back enough for them to set up their shields and finalize their
evacuation plans. He told them that he had always known that there was good in
Aphra before turning and leaving, the three then discussing and then deciding
against telling him that Aphra had also saved the Emperor's life.[133]

Traveling to Dagobah, Skywalker sought out Grand Master Yoda in order to
complete his Jedi training.

Skywalker then traveled to [Dagobah](/wiki/Dagobah "Dagobah"), which turned
out to be a remote [swamp](/wiki/Swamp "Swamp") planet, where he encountered
Yoda, the former [Grand Master](/wiki/Grand_Master "Grand Master") of the
fallen Jedi Order. In their initial meeting, Skywalker was frustrated and
impatient and was rather short-tempered with the diminutive Yoda, who did not
initially identify himself and purposefully tested Skywalker's patience,
telling him a story about three brothers,[135] and taking him back to his
[hut](/wiki/Yoda%27s_Hut "Yoda's Hut") to partake in a meal of [rootleaf
stew](/wiki/Rootleaf_stew "Rootleaf stew"), which he did not find very
appetizing.[9]

However, Skywalker gained a new appreciation for the small creature

However, Skywalker gained a new appreciation for the small creature upon
learning his identity, and Yoda agreed to train Skywalker only at the
insistence of Kenobi's spirit. Skywalker's training proved to be difficult, as
his adventurous past had shaped his mind toward action and emotional
instinct.[9]

Yoda trains Luke Skywalker on Dagobah.

Skywalker's training on Dagobah lasted several weeks, with Kenobi needing to

Luke's training and argue that the boy

trains Luke Skywalker on Dagobah.

Skywalker's training on Dagobah lasted several weeks, with Kenobi needing to
appear in Yoda's dreams more than once to convince the old master to keep up
Luke's training and argue that the boy would not end up like this father. When
Skywalker and Yoda argued, Kenobi also regularly appeared to stop their
arguments.[137] One day during his training with Yoda, the Jedi Master had
Skywalker climb a tree to use his senses to find a way through the tree,
Skywalker lost his balance and fell from the tree. Yoda decided to have
Skywalker carry him as he redid the task.[138]

When Yoda asked him to enter a [cave](/wiki/Cave_of_Evil "Cave of Evil") that
was strong in the dark side in which he was supposed to find only what he took
with him, he was challenged by a vision of himself wearing the [armor of Darth
Vader](/wiki/Darth_Vader%27s_armor "Darth Vader's armor"), meant to symbolize
his inner darkness.[9] Master and apprentice then had an encounter with a
raging [elephoth](/wiki/Elephoth "Elephoth"), which Skywalker managed to calm
by leading her to her child.[135]

#### Leaving prematurely

    " _Luke! You must complete the training.."  
" I can't keep the vision out of my head. They're my friends. I've gotta help
them._"

    ―Yoda and Skywalker[9]

Shortly after, he had a vision of Han Solo and Leia Organa suffering at [Cloud
City](/wiki/Cloud_City "Cloud City") on [Bespin](/wiki/Bespin "Bespin").
Unable to get the visions out of his head, and convinced that his friends
would surely die if he did not help them, Skywalker decided to end his
training prematurely to rescue them, despite Yoda and Kenobi's insistence that
he was not ready to face the dark side on his own yet, but Skywalker was
convinced that he would learned enough to hold his own, and he could not just
stand by and leave his friends to the mercy of the Empire.[9]

Seeing that Skywalker's mind was made up, Kenobi let him know that if he ended
up facing Vader, he could not interfere on his

to get the visions out of his head, and convinced that his friends
would surely die if he did not help them, Skywalker decided to end his
training prematurely to rescue them, despite Yoda and Kenobi's insistence that
he was not ready to face the dark side on his own yet, but Skywalker was
convinced that he would learned enough to hold his own, and he could not just
stand by and leave his friends to the mercy of the Empire.[9]

Seeing that Skywalker's mind was made up, Kenobi let him know that if he ended
up facing Vader, he could not interfere on his behalf, and advised him not to
give into hatred. Likewise, Yoda advised him to mind what he would learned.
Skywalker promised to do so, and vowed to return to Dagobah one day to finish
his training.[9]

    ―Darth Vader and Luke Skywalker[9]

Skywalker confronted Vader on Bespin while attempting to save his friends.

Upon his arrival at Cloud City's [East Platform](/wiki/East_Platform "East
Platform"), Skywalker felt Vader's presence,[135] and went into the nearest
building, where he was shot at by Fett, who had come to claim a bounty put on
Solo by Jabba the Hutt, and tried to pursue a group of stormtroopers

confronted Vader on Bespin while attempting to save his friends.

Upon his arrival at Cloud City's [East Platform](/wiki/East_Platform "East
Platform"), Skywalker felt Vader's presence,[135] and went into the nearest
building, where he was shot at by Fett, who had come to claim a bounty put on
Solo by Jabba the Hutt, and tried to pursue a group of stormtroopers and
[Imperial officers](/wiki/Imperial_officer "Imperial officer") who held
Organa, Chewbacca, and C-3PO captive. The princess attempted to warn Skywalker
that he was walking into a trap, but his path was diverted to the [carbon-
freezing](/wiki/Carbon-freezing "Carbon-freezing") [chamber](/wiki/Carbon-
freezing_chamber/Legends "Carbon-freezing chamber/Legends") where Darth Vader
awaited him, with the intention to freeze him in [carbonite](/wiki/Carbonite
"Carbonite") to present him to the [Emperor](/wiki/Galactic_Emperor "Galactic
Emperor"). Skywalker engaged the Dark Lord in a fierce [lightsaber
duel](/wiki/Duel_on_Cloud_City "Duel on Cloud City").[9]

During the duel, Vader praised Skywalker's training in the Force thus far and
attempted to goad him into giving into his anger and hatred, claiming that it
was the only way to defeat him. Vader managed to knock Skywalker into the
carbon-freezing chamber and appeared to have frozen him like he had Solo, but
Skywalker [leapt](/wiki/Force_jump "Force jump") out of the chamber before the
process was finished, which left Vader impressed.[9]

The duel eventually carried into the control room of one of Cloud City's [gas-
processing vanes](/wiki/Gas-processing_vane "Gas-processing vane"). Vader
began using the Force to throw various objects in the chamber at the young
Jedi hopeful. One such projectile, a large piece of metal piping, was
misdirected and smashed through a nearby observation port. The chamber was
quickly depressurized, sucking Skywalker out onto the nearby sensor relay
catwalk overlooking the [reactor shaft](/wiki/Reactor_shaft "Reactor shaft").
Skywalker managed to grab on to the catwalk's railing and pull himself

room of one of Cloud City's [gas-
processing vanes](/wiki/Gas-processing_vane "Gas-processing vane"). Vader
began using the Force to throw various objects in the chamber at the young
Jedi hopeful. One such projectile, a large piece of metal piping, was
misdirected and smashed through a nearby observation port. The chamber was
quickly depressurized, sucking Skywalker out onto the nearby sensor relay
catwalk overlooking the [reactor shaft](/wiki/Reactor_shaft "Reactor shaft").
Skywalker managed to grab on to the catwalk's railing and pull himself up.[9]

Vader re-entered the fray and forced Skywalker back onto the catwalk. Sensing
that Skywalker was weakened, the Sith Lord demanded that Skywalker surrender,
lest he be destroyed as Obi-Wan Kenobi had been. Skywalker refused and
desperately tried to keep fighting Vader, to which Vader responded with
several ferocious strikes, ultimately forcing Skywalker to the very edge of
the catwalk and slicing off his right hand. Both Skywalker's hand and his
lightsaber fell into the depths of the reactor shaft.[9]

"No...that's not true! That's _impossible _!"  
"Search your feelings. You _know _it to be true."

The revelation that Vader was Skywalker's father shook the Jedi hopeful to his
core.

Seeing that Skywalker was vulnerable in his weakened state, Vader offered to
show Skywalker the power of the dark side and complete his training, but
Skywalker adamantly refused to ever join Vader, the man who had killed his
father. In that moment, Vader revealed the truth: that _he_ was his father.[9]

Horrified by Vader's shocking revelation, Skywalker initially denounced the
Sith Lord's claim as untrue and impossible, but Vader insisted that they both
knew that it was the truth. Vader further claimed that Skywalker was powerful
enough to destroy the Emperor, and when he did, they could rule the galaxy
together as father and son.[9][139] Unwilling to join Vader but too weak to
fight back, Skywalker took the only option he had left, and allowed himself to
fall down the reactor shaft, being sucked through several vents and eventually
being deposited to the outside of the floating city. Though he managed to grab
onto a [weather vane](/wiki/Weather_scanner_vane "Weather scanner vane") to
avoid falling to his death, he knew he was unable to stay there

Skywalker was powerful
enough to destroy the Emperor, and when he did, they could rule the galaxy
together as father and son.[9][139] Unwilling to join Vader but too weak to
fight back, Skywalker took the only option he had left, and allowed himself to
fall down the reactor shaft, being sucked through several vents and eventually
being deposited to the outside of the floating city. Though he managed to grab
onto a [weather vane](/wiki/Weather_scanner_vane "Weather scanner vane") to
avoid falling to his death, he knew he was unable to stay there forever,
especially in his weakened state. Calling out to Kenobi at first but getting
no response, in desperation, he called out to Leia Organa through the Force,
who was able to hear the call.[9]

Soon, the _Millennium Falcon_ , with [Lando
Calrissian](/wiki/Landonis_Balthazar_Calrissian "Landonis Balthazar
Calrissian"), Organa, Chewbacca, and the droids onboard, arrived to rescue
him. As they [escaped](/wiki/Escape_from_Cloud_City "Escape from Cloud City")
from Bespin, and the _Falcon_ was faced with the Imperial fleet, Vader reached
out to Skywalker through the Force, calling him "son."[9] Skywalker fought
tears back, after hearing the word he had always longed to hear while
lamenting that Kenobi had not told him the truth,[135] just as the _Falcon_
made the jump into hyperspace thanks to R2-D2.[9]

#### Haunted by the truth

    " _Ben... Ben. Why didn't you tell me?_ "
    ―Luke Skywalker[9]

Haunted by the truth of his parentage, Skywalker found his connection to the
Force considerably weakened, with his control over it remaining sporadic.
Aboard the _Falcon_ , after introducing Skywalker to Calrissian, Organa
informed Skywalker of what had happened to Solo. Skywalker wanted to begin
searching for his friend immediately, but Organa told him that there was more
at stake than just Solo's life and it would be best to reconvene with the
Rebel fleet first. He revealed that he had received no response from reaching
out Kenobi, but she assured him that he was

by the truth of his parentage, Skywalker found his connection to the
Force considerably weakened, with his control over it remaining sporadic.
Aboard the _Falcon_ , after introducing Skywalker to Calrissian, Organa
informed Skywalker of what had happened to Solo. Skywalker wanted to begin
searching for his friend immediately, but Organa told him that there was more
at stake than just Solo's life and it would be best to reconvene with the
Rebel fleet first. He revealed that he had received no response from reaching
out Kenobi, but she assured him that he was strong and would find his way.
With Skywalker agreeing to her plan, the _Falcon_ jumped to hyperspace.[140]

in
the Mid Rim to find the fleet's Fourth Division under attack from several Star

Zahra](/wiki/Ellian_Zahra "Ellian Zahra"). As the _Falcon_ entered the battle,
Skywalker volunteered to commandeer the ship's belly gun, despite his
injuries. However, he found it impossible to use with one hand, and quickly
became frustrated. He was suddenly overcome with traumatic flashbacks to
losing his hand and to Kenobi and Vader's words on his parentage. His anger
resulted in him unknowingly using the Force to make several of the attacking
TIE Fighters crash into one another. With Luke stunned by his sudden show of
strength, the fleet jumped to hyperspace.[140]

With the fleet regrouped, Skywalker found a deserted part of the flagship and
attempted to contact Yoda through the Force to receive his guidance. Angry at
the Jedi Master's refusal to answer, he almost shattered one of the ship's
windows in another frustration-fueled loss of control over his Force
abilities. Speaking to R2-D2, he revealed that he was incredibly afraid and
angry and considered that those feelings and his parentage meant he should not
be a Jedi. He wondered whether the lack of answers from his mentors, who he
was now frustrated with for lying to him, signified a premature end to his
Jedi training, and who he was meant to be if not a Jedi.[140]

As Calrissian prepared to go to Tatooine to locate Solo, Skywalker, who was
unsure if he could trust him, insisted that he inform him if he found Solo. He
suggested they could meet up at the [Jundt Massif](/wiki/Jundt_Massif "Jundt
Massif") so he could help, since he knew the area from growing up there,
though Calrissian was skeptical. Skywalker insisted that he did not need both
hands because he had the Force, but Calrissian still insisted a rescue mission
from Jabba's palace would be impossible. Organa told Skywalker that he should
have a [prosthetic hand](/wiki/Mechno-arm "Mechno-arm") installed

    ―Verla, to Luke Skywalker[145]

While Skywalker traveled to find the woman from his visions, Vader followed a

pretending to be him to get pilot jobs and claiming that a droid named 'Ardee'
helped him destroy the Death Star. Vader killed him and declared that anyone

flies his X-wing to Serelia.

While Skywalker traveled to find the woman from his visions, Vader followed a
false lead from an Imperial officer to Skywalker, only finding a con man
pretending to be him to get pilot jobs and claiming that a droid named 'Ardee'
helped him destroy the Death Star. Vader killed him and declared that anyone
who claimed Skywalker's name would die. He told the Imperial officer to verify
his findings next time and said Skywalker could still be anywhere.[145]

Having used the planet he saw in his vision as the basis for his search,
Skywalker arrived at the planet [Serelia](/wiki/Serelia "Serelia"), where he
encountered the woman from the vision at a dock on the coastline. However,
when he asked whether she was a Jedi, the woman responded by dropping a large
amount of fish on top of him and escaping in a boat. Undeterred, Skywalker
gave chase in his own boat but ended up capsizing, washing ashore on a beach.
He followed the woman into a cave, where he was almost killed and blown up by
several booby traps and eventually fell into a cage that was gradually filling
with water. As the woman watched, Skywalker attempted hold back the rising
water with the Force, but was unable. The hooded woman asked him who he was
and revealed herself to be Verla.[145]

Verla reveals herself

Verla informed Skywalker that it would be safer if he was to give up his dream
of becoming a Jedi, cynically telling him about [Order

reveals herself

Verla informed Skywalker that it would be safer if he was to give up his dream
of becoming a Jedi, cynically telling him about [Order 66](/wiki/Order_66
"Order 66"), the Inquisitorius and Darth Vader himself. Sensing Skywalker's
suspicious reaction to the mention of his father, Verla probed deeper into his
mind and realized that he was the son of Vader. Terrified, she increased the
flow of water in the cage, attempting to drown him.[145]Fortunately,
Skywalker's life was saved by R2-D2, who incapacitated Verla and resuscitated
him. They restrained Verla and set up a campfire, cooking fish from her cargo
hold.[146]

When she regained consciousness, Skywalker freed her as a show of good faith
and asked her about his vision. Verla told him that she did not possess a
lightsaber, as she had given up on the Force and refused to take part in the
conflict between the light and dark sides. She also revealed that Vader's name
was Anakin Skywalker, and that she had learned from her master [Ferren
Barr](/wiki/Ferren_Barr "Ferren Barr") that Anakin had once been a hero of the
Clone Wars but that something happened to him. She revealed that she had spent
her entire life on the run from the Inquisitors and Vader and had finally
given up on Barr's wishes and had decided to live a normal life. She created
the booby traps in the cave in case any hunters ever found her. She refuted
Skywalker's belief that the Force had led her to him and insisted that Force
only used people.[146]

acknowledged his training was incomplete but also that he was already skilled
and would be a Jedi. The Inquisitor ignited both blades of the
[lightsaber](/wiki/Double-bladed_spinning_lightsaber "Double-bladed spinning
lightsaber") and started destroying the artifacts there, insisting the Jedi
Order was a lie that was over. As they fought, he told the Inquisitor that
that place was inspiring him to want to be a part of the Jedi Order and fight
what they fought for, and that he was beginning to understand loss and
sacrifice for what was worth fighting for as they understood it. He cut off
the Inquisitor's hand and disarmed him of his saber, before successfully
slicing through him and escaping before Vader arrived.[146]

the future of the Rebellion.[146]

Somewhere in the Inner Rim, Skywalker and Organa met with Commander
[Grek](/wiki/Grek_\(commodore\) "Grek \(commodore\)") and instructed him to
move forward with their rendezvous with the Seventh Division as part of a plan
to strike back against the Empire. C-3PO was concerned that this would alert
the Empire to their location, but Skywalker told him that it was about more
than just protecting their own lives.[149]

The Empire's Commander Ellian Zahra intercepted a transmission that revealed
the Alliances [Fourth](/wiki/Fourth_Division "Fourth Division") and Seventh
Divisions were planning to rendezvous somewhere in the Inner Rim, so Zahra
initiated an [attack](/wiki/Battle_at_Elessia "Battle at Elessia") that saw
her split her forces to strike simultaneously. Zahra's primary strike force
led an attack on the Alliance's Seventh Division, while her secondary strike
force attempted to attack Leia Organa's Fourth Division, however the Fourth
had already left their rendezvous point before the strike force arrived. The
Imperial forces overwhelmed the Seventh Division's capital ships. TIE
interceptors created a blockade of _Home One_ 's hangar bay, that prevented
Alliance starfighters from launching, including Red

an [attack](/wiki/Battle_at_Elessia "Battle at Elessia") that saw

force attempted to attack Leia Organa's Fourth Division, however the Fourth
had already left their rendezvous point before the strike force arrived. The
Imperial forces overwhelmed the Seventh Division's capital ships. TIE
interceptors created a blockade of _Home One_ 's hangar bay, that prevented

Chewbacca in the _Millennium Falcon_. While fighting, Organa contacted him to
check in, Skywalker informing her that the Imperials were pinning down the
Seventh Division's cruiser and preventing them from scrambling their fighters.
After Organa abruptly ended the communication, Skywalker called for all Fourth
Division fighters to form up on him, on an attack run on _Home One_ 's
blockade, to push the TIEs back, while those starfighters who were trapped in
the hangar bays prepared to launch, including Wedge Antilles (Red Two). As
soon as Skywalker cleared the TIEs, all the Alliance starfighters aboard _Home
One_ , including Antilles, launched to repay the favor.[148]

Skywalker eventually left the space battle to board the frigate where Leia
Organa was under attack from an Imperial boarding party, led personally by
Zahra. As Zahra threw a sword at Skywalker, which he easily dodged, and then
kicked him to the ground, she claimed that she could kill him if she wanted to
but was not allowed to because of Vader's plans for him. After Zahra jumped
out a window with a jetpack to escape, Skywalker and Organa went to
celebratory meeting for successfully regrouping and fending off the Empire.
There, Skywalker noticed something was off with Organa, who revealed that she
was perturbed by the amount of hate Zahra seemed to have for her.[148]

it caused him to repair, Vader wondered if Skywalker's pain, including losing
his hand, had made him stronger. Vader suspected it had not and considered
Skywalker weak, believing the fledgling Jedi had not accomplished anything
without the help of his friends, who Vader believed he allowed to survive. No
longer wishing to turn Skywalker he resolved to kill him, and began his path
to do so by searching for Han Solo.[151] In

While practicing his lightsaber and Force skills by fighting training remotes,
during which he recalled Yoda's training, Skywalker was interrupted by C-3PO,
insisting he did not mind the distraction. C-3PO said that R2-D2 wanted to
speak with him about something related to Tempes, where he found his new
lightsaber. Before R2-D2 could say anything, Chewbacca arrived and revealed,
via C-3PO translating, that Boba Fett had been spotted on Nar Shaddaa and
urged Skywalker to come with him to rescue Solo from him. Chewbacca shot down
Skywalker's suggestion that they bring Calrissian, saying he was not to be
trusted and that Solo would not want to see him, but Skywalker agreed.
Skywalker, C-3PO, R2-D2, and Chewbacca then took the _Falcon_ to Nar Shaddaa,
though R2 complained to C-3PO on the way that he had not been able to speak to
Skywalker. Skywalker was annoyed that Organa had to stay behind to coordinate
[Operation Starlight](/wiki/Operation_Starlight "Operation Starlight") and
urged Chewbacca to ensure the mission would be quick, recalling how awful he
found the planet and what had happened with Grakkus the Hutt.[150]

Hearing that Skywalker, who had made the trench run on the Death Star was

Skywalker started to make the run while the others kept TIEs off of him,
feeling like he was making the Death Star run again, but he started to have a
flashback to the battle of Yavin that instead ended with Vader taking down the
_Falcon_ and saying he would claim Solo for himself, disturbing Skywalker and
causing him to miss the target. However, the rest of Starlight Squadron were
on the same vector and were able to hit it, triggering a volcanic explosion
that destroyed the Star Destroyer that attacked the Eleventh Division.
Afterward, Skywalker apologized for missing the shot, before the others
realized they had rescued Mon Mothma. Skywalker then told Antilles that he was
going to Jekara to help Organa.[154]

whether Organa could still hear him, he warned that Vader was potentially
coming after Solo, having realized that his vision on Ab Dalis might have been
a warning and a premonition.[154] This premonition also made him panic as he
did not believe he could beat him. In hyperspace on the way to Jekara,
Skywalker recalled fighting Vader on Cloud City and the Sith Lord's utter
brutality, strength, and ineffable power, likening it to a [gravel
storm](/wiki/Gravel_storm "Gravel storm"). Imagining himself as he was at that
moment fighting Vader on Cloud City with his yellow lightsaber, Skywalker
began to believe he could be a storm too, but then just thought he was kidding
himself and that Yoda and Vader had been right about him. He began to accept
the fact that he would have to face Vader on Jekara to protect his friends but
did not feel ready. Desperate for guidance, he

brutality, strength, and ineffable power, likening it to a [gravel

began to believe he could be a storm too, but then just thought he was kidding
himself and that Yoda and Vader had been right about him. He began to accept

did not feel ready. Desperate for guidance, he tried to reach out to the Force
to speak to Kenobi, but his fear made it difficult to access.[157]

Just as he was about to exit hyperspace, Organa asked Skywalker for help in
distracting Vader because the Sith Lord arrived at the auction, but he was
quickly occupied dealing with Vader's Super Star Destroyer the _Executor_ that
was over Jekara. Overwhelmed, Skywalker fought off various TIE fighters before
leading them close to and getting their shots to hit the ship of one of the
crime syndicates present at the auction, the [Son-tuul Pride](/wiki/Son-
tuul_Pride "Son-tuul Pride"), which made the syndicate retaliate against the
Empire as Skywalker hoped it would. Finally given a window to approach the
planet, he told Organa he was approaching as she told him to hurry. However,
the Imperials established a secure channel between him and Vader, who had
sensed that he was there in the Force. Vader threatened to kill the frozen Han
if he did not arrive to face him,[157] while imagining fighting Skywalker and
thinking that he would not be a father to him or let him hide behind his
friends.[158] After hearing the message, Skywalker, haunted by the image of
his current self being killed by Vader on Cloud City, decided he was not ready
to face him and turned his X-wing around.[157]

Opting to fly away to the planet's [Polar Sea](/wiki/Polar_Sea "Polar Sea") to
get Vader to follow him, Skywalker briefly thought he had lost Vader until
Vader's TIE fighter emerged from the water beneath him. Vader taunted him,
saying his increased strength in the Force would not save him and that he had
Solo, so he would not be saving Skywalker either. Noticing how quickly the
sea's water was freezing, Skywalker trapped Vader in the ice by making a giant
wave of water with his X-wing and leading Vader into it when it quickly froze.
Despite having the perfect opportunity to shoot at and kill Vader, Skywalker
could not do it after what he had revealed at Cloud City, but knew he would
eventually need to face him. Skywalker reached out to Organa on the _Falcon_
who explained that they and the Imperial shuttle had been hit by a blast that
had immobilized them, meaning they could not reach Solo but Solo could not be
taken to the flagship. Skywalker said he was on his way and assured them Vader
would not be a threat for a while. With Hutt fighters now chasing the shuttle
with Solo on it, Organa tried to get Skywalker to help, but Vader emerged from
the ice in his TIE fighter and dragged Skywalker back into a fight, so
Skywalker told her he could not help.[160]

Vader soon chased Skywalker back into space.[158] With Vader reveling in
making Skywalker feel fear due to his friends lives being put in danger,
Skywalker cried out as the shuttle containing Solo was fired at by Hutt and
Imperial fighters.[158] Thankfully, Vader was soon ordered by the Emperor to
assist with a Hutt attack that was happening against the Empire, which forced
the Sith Lord to leave his son behind, not before reminding Skywalker that he
was no Jedi. Skywalker insisted that when they met again he would be a
Jedi.[161] Vader resented having to leave but was proud of terrifying
Skywalker, recognizing that the Emperor wanted Skywalker to live and was
orchestrating things so that it could be the case.[162] During his
confrontation with Vader, Organa and the rest failed to rescue Han Solo, who

#### In search of Jedi secrets

    " _I know I'm needed here, Leia. But I can't help but think I should be following that path, trying to grow as a Jedi. I'll have to face Vader eventually. [ …] I need to find a way to finish my training…and soon._"
    ―Luke Skywalker to Leia Organa[163]

After the breakout of the [Syndicate War](/wiki/Syndicate_War "Syndicate
War"), the Rebel Alliance had a meeting with many of its leaders that Luke
Skywalker was present for. As Admiral Ackbar discussed the Alliance's next
moves in its rebuilding effort, Leia Organa noticed that Skywalker was
distant. He explained that R2-D2 had given him a list of possible Jedi sites
across the galaxy from an Imperial archive. He expressed that he knew he was
needed by the Alliance, but that he felt like he should be trying to continue
growing as a Jedi. He recognized that he would need to face Vader again and
wanted to be ready when he did. Organa told him that it was okay and that he
should trust what the Force was telling him, offering to smooth things over
with Mon Mothma and telling him that they could fight the battles without him
for now.[163]

Luke Skywalker consults a list of Jedi sites.

Skywalker consulted R2-D2 for the list of Jedi sites and worried that since it
was an imperial list all of the places would have been destroyed or looted.
But he recognized that he needed to keep going if he was going to face Vader,
though he wished Master Yoda would talk to him. Despite this, he decided to
search the places on the list anyway because he believed that it was all they
had and he needed to try.[163]

He visited the planet [Ilum](/wiki/Ilum "Ilum") first and discovered the mass
imperial blockade and presence there and the Empire's exploitation of the
planet. He felt in the Force that the planet was important, but also felt that
now only held pain as the Empire was killing it more and more every day. He
believed there was nothing for him there and he and R2-D2 used the weather of
the planet to leave and slip past the blockade. He visited
[Arashar](/wiki/Arashar "Arashar") next, but only orbited it as it had a
massive orbital Imperial presence and he did not think he could get by it. He
then visited [Lothal](/wiki/Lothal "Lothal"), and

felt in the Force that the planet was important, but also felt that
now only held pain as the Empire was killing it more and more every day. He
believed there was nothing for him there and he and R2-D2 used the weather of
the planet to leave and slip past the blockade. He visited
[Arashar](/wiki/Arashar "Arashar") next, but only orbited it as it had a
massive orbital Imperial presence and he did not think he could get by it. He
then visited [Lothal](/wiki/Lothal "Lothal"), and traveled to the former
location of the [Lothal Jedi Temple](/wiki/Lothal_Jedi_Temple "Lothal Jedi
Temple"). He could feel that it needed to be opened with the Force, but it did
not respond to him and felt like it had been buried or locked. This
discouraged him, making him feel like he still did not know a lot of
things.[163]

#### A legacy on Al'doleem

    " _A Jedi saved my life once. Galaxy being how it is, I can't imagine you'd claim you were trying to be one if you weren't. I've wanted to repay that debt my whole life. You're probably as close as I'll ever get._ "
    ―Colli to Luke Skywalker[163]

He finally traveled to the river moon of [Al'doleem](/wiki/Al%27doleem
"Al'doleem") and decided to visit it because it did not have an Imperial
blockade and was not being destroyed. He flew [Mount
Pasvaal](/wiki/Mount_Pasvaal "Mount Pasvaal") as was encouraged by the sight
of something important there without much guarding. He landed in the ruins of
[Am'balaar City](/wiki/Am%27balaar_City "Am'balaar City"), after seeing that
it had been rebuilt some after a [Dam collapse](/wiki/Mission_to_Al%27doleem
"Mission to Al'doleem"). He told R2-D2 that they would head into town, but he
did not want to draw attention as one of the Empire's biggest targets. He
walked up to two stormtroopers and tried to perform a Jedi mind trick on them
that Yoda had taught him and he

Skywalker that he was surprised he did not know but bet he had other people
fix his starships. Colli explained that the Jedi flew Delta-7 Aethersprites in
the Clone Wars. Colli told Skywalker to come inside, as he had noticed the
lightsaber on his belt, and warned that if he had others might have too. Colli
asked him if he was really a Jedi, to which Skywalker explained that he was

[monastery](/wiki/Al%27doleem_Jedi_monastery "Al'doleem Jedi monastery") on
top of Mount Pasvaal and had allowed him and his sister to escape in his
Aetherspire when the city was attacked and destroyed. He explained that both
Infil'a and his parents had died. Colli asked Skywalker about his story, but
R2-D2 tried to stop him from saying anything. Colli insisted that he was

"Kirak Infil'a") who had worked in the
[monastery](/wiki/Al%27doleem_Jedi_monastery "Al'doleem Jedi monastery") on
top of Mount Pasvaal and had allowed him and his sister to escape in his

could from what of their legacy remained and that he believed the mountain
that Infil'a had come from was connected to the Order and that he wanted to
figure out what the Empire was looking for there.[163]

[](/wiki/File:LukeYodaHolo-
SW2020-19.png)

Luke Skywalker finds a recording of Yoda in a holocron.

Colli took Skywalker to the Monastery at the top of the mountain, but
explained that there were also tunnels and chambers in the mountain that the
Jedi had used and that the Empire was bringing artifacts out of it all the
time. Skywalker considered using his lightsaber and the Force to let go and
cut right through the Imperial forces in his way but could not bring himself
to do it and instead gave his lightsaber to R2 for safekeeping. He went and
meditated with the Force on the side of the mountain before returning to the
warehouse where Colli had told him the Empire stored the artifacts they found
in the mountain. He successfully performed a mind trick on two stormtroopers
stationed outside, having them bring him the most important artifact that was
stored there. They brought him a holocron, which Luke recognized from his
experience with Grakkus the Hutt. He reached out with the Force to unlock it
as he had learned how to do and found a recording of Master Yoda teaching
lessons.[163] Skywalker was disappointed, however, that the lesson Yoda taught
in the holocron was one that he had already taught him back on Dagobah.
Burdened by the series of setbacks he had faced recently, Skywalker considered
dropping the holocron off of a cliff, but was stopped by R2. Skywalker opened
the holocron again, and this time Yoda discussed [Vergences](/wiki/Vergence
"Vergence") in the Force, listing the Jedi Temple on Coruscant, Jedha, and the
[Living Sea](/wiki/Living_Sea "Living Sea") of [Gazian](/wiki/Gazian "Gazian")
as examples. Luke had never heard of the Living Sea of Gazian and decided to
go to the planet to check it out.[164]

ocean. Mann then told Skywalker that he knew the kind of pressure that the

he did not think many other Jedi would tell him: He did not have to be a Jedi.
Mann told him that there were other ways to use the Force safely and protect
life and light, and that there are many paths and choices that could be true
to the person he wanted to be. But he also told Skywalker that if he wanted

and floated around them until they found themselves back in the void-like
vision of the Living Sea. He asked Skywalker if he wanted to stay there and
speak to him and the many minds in the Living Sea, but Skywalker told him that
he thought he should leave. Mann was disappointed, but reminded Skywalker that
a part of him would remain there to talk to them as Skywalker saw an imprint
of himself appear in front of him.[164]

#### Unity Day attack

    " _This is amazing."  
"We've earned it. It's been a long time since we had a solid win. Not a single
casualty. You planned one heck of mission, Leia._"

    ―Organa and Skywalker during the celebration after the Unity Day attack[166]

The Unity Day parade

After he returned to the Alliance, Skywalker took part in an
[attack](/wiki/Unity_Day_attack

Unity Day parade

After he returned to the Alliance, Skywalker took part in an
[attack](/wiki/Unity_Day_attack "Unity Day attack") on the Imperial Unity Day
Parade on [Bar'leth](/wiki/Bar%27leth "Bar'leth"), one of the Rebels' first
large scale operations since the Battle of Hoth. Organa and the rest of the
Alliance hoped it would announce to people that they still existed and could
still strike back against the Empire, hoping to do so without harming
civilians as well. Skywalker flew in his X-Wing as part of Red Squadron during
the attack. After destroying the Empire's vast artillery on display in the
parade, Skywalker told the others over comm that R2-D2 had detected a wave of
TIE fighters launching from a nearby Imperial airbase outside of the city and
suggested they leave. Wedge Antilles, flying as Red Leader, acknowledged
Skywalker and told everyone to follow him, leading all of the Alliance
fighters to a successful escape.[166]

Afterward, Skywalker participated in a toast to the Rebel Alliance lead by
Antilles before having a drink and sitting down. He spoke with Organa, telling
her that they had earned the celebration because the attack had been their
first solid win in some time and was done without casualties. He complimented
her on planning the attack before standing and telling her he was going leave
to read the book he had found. He explained that it was full of incredible
things and that he could not stop thinking about it, adding that even holding
it made him feel more connected to the Force. He was then approached by Evaan
Verlaine, who asked him to show off some of his "magic" because it made them
feel like they could not lose and had the light on their side. He was
reluctant to do so because it made him feel like a show-off, but he agreed,
igniting his yellow lightsaber. Verlaine called it magic while many looked on
in awe.[166]

Later, in a separate room, Syndulla asked Skywalker if he truly believed there
was something significant about the defectors and wondered if he was sensing
something due to his connection with the Force. Luke said that he has learned
everything is connected to the Force, Syndulla responding that he sounded like
[Kanan Jarrus](/wiki/Kanan_Jarrus "Kanan Jarrus"), her late Jedi lover.
Skywalker asked if that was a good thing, and she said it usually was.
Commodore [Grek](/wiki/Grek_\(commodore\) "Grek \(commodore\)") decided that
anything that Skywalker thought was worth looking into was worth looking into
and had someone look up information about the case to walk Skywalker through

go in return for information about a classified weapons site, though the
Alliance lost connection after they told them to wait for authorization and

the last place the shuttle's signal had popped up was on Coruscant, and so

the former reminding him that the Emperor lives there and the latter
suggesting that they send pathfinders to mount a rescue mission but not him
because he was too valuable, there were bounties for him across the galaxy,
and because he was the only Jedi they had.[167]

Skywalker got the Meltons back safely for them to debrief their intelligence
people, but they talked to him on the way. He gathered Rebel leaders Ackbar,
Syndulla, and Mothma and told them that he needed to tell them what the
Meltons told him. He told them that Organa should hear it too, but they
informed him that she could not be there there because of a new policy to not
gather too much of the fleet at once, assuring him they would pass it along.
Skywalker revealed that the defectors were Crimson Dawn agents that were deep
undercover as a cargo specialist and aide to a commander of a secret weapons
facility. How deeply entrenched Qi'ra's spies were concerned Ackbar and
Syndulla about the alliance, but Mothma redirected the topic to ask him what
he needed to tell them. Skywalker revealed that the Empire was building
another Death Star. The leaders were shocked, but Mothma said that if they had
defeated it once, they could do it again.[167]

At some point after this, Skywalker sensed the activation and attempted
opening of the [Fermata Cage](/wiki/Fermata_Cage "Fermata Cage"), an ancient
Sith device, by members of Crimson Dawn.[169]

#### Search for the _Kezarat_ convoy

target."  
"Some people say that, Luke. But I think it was something different. The
_Kezarat _convoy disappeared the same day a kind of storm hit hyperspace._ "
