Skywalker and his companions arrive in No-Space

Later, back at Holdo's friend's house, Holdo explained that she was planning
to go after the [_Kezarat_ convoy](/wiki/Kezarat_Convoy "Kezarat Convoy"),
which Organa had suspected. She explained that it was a massive [Byne
Guild](/wiki/Byne_Guild "Byne Guild") fuel convoy that disappeared when
entering [hyperspace](/wiki/Hyperspace "Hyperspace") many years earlier.
Skywalker asked if it was because it got hit by raiders because it was such a
sought-after target, but Holdo revealed it actually disappeared during a
[storm](/wiki/Great_Hyperspace_Disaster "Great Hyperspace Disaster") in
hyperspace caused by the Nihil. She hoped that the last message sent by the
convoy that was thought to be nonsense was actually navigational data designed
only to communicate with a Path engine and that both together could take them
to the convoy. After Chewbacca finished installing the Path engine into their
ship the _[Skyfarer](/wiki/Skyfarer "Skyfarer")_ , a group of TIE fighters
found them and started going after them. Holdo attempted to pilot the ship out
of the atmosphere so they could jump to hyperspace and escape, but the Path
engine activated on its own and sent the ship through hyperspace into [No-
Space](/wiki/No-Space "No-Space"), near the [Great Hall of the
Nihil](/wiki/Great_Hall_of_the_Nihil "Great Hall of the Nihil").[170]

##### The lost colony

    " _Sometimes people find their way to No-Space, just like you all did. [ …] One of those was a Jedi. Alareen Xie. She joined us, helped us fight off the Nihil. We wouldn't have survived without her. She died in time, as most people do. But after she did, a sort of belief rose up. That someday a Jedi would return and take us out of this place. Would take us home._"
    ―Blythe, to Skywalker[172]

Skywalker and his friends did not recognize No-Space and had no idea where
they were, but

people find their way to No-Space, just like you all did. [ …] One of those was a Jedi. Alareen Xie. She joined us, helped us fight off the Nihil. We wouldn't have survived without her. She died in time, as most people do. But after she did, a sort of belief rose up. That someday a Jedi would return and take us out of this place. Would take us home._"
    ―Blythe, to Skywalker[172]

Skywalker and his friends did not recognize No-Space and had no idea where
they were, but Skywalker expressed that while he had not traveled as much as
they had, he knew the galaxy had strange things in it. He added that the Force
seemed off and distant, as if there was not much around that was alive. After
Holdo tried and failed to take the ship to hyperspace again, Skywalker
suggested that they needed to disconnect the Path engine to see if it would
fix the problem, but Holdo revealed they would need to land somewhere first.
After landing on the Great Hall, Lando lamented the dangers of falling off the
edge there and said it was worse than Cloud City, but Skywalker insisted that
Cloud City had been really bad. A child in a spacesuit then appeared and asked
them if they had 'flavors', which Calrissian interpreted to mean the kid
wanted to eat them. Skywalker said he was just a kid, but Calrissian asked him
to remind him to tell Skywalker about the [White Worms](/wiki/White_Worms
"White Worms") gang's savage children. The kid eventually advised them to hide
and ran off, and Skywalker sensed with the Force that the kid was terrified
and did not know where he was going. The kid then jumped off the edge of the
Hall, which shocked Skywalker, but he just activated a jetpack and flew
away.[173]

attack and were listening, the individual introduced himself as Captain

over somewhere else. Blythe told Skywalker to let Forvan down easy, and when
he said he did not understand, Blythe said he would.[172]

there or to make their lives better. Forvan once again said that Jedi could do

them that they would be there for a while and would not be able to get back to
their ship, Skywalker and the others all went to sleeping quarters given to
them. Skywalker paced around the room and Organa recognized something was
wrong and asked him about it. Skywalker explained that he had to get out of
there to get back to the ship to get the irreplaceable Jedi text that he had
left on it. When she brought it up, Skywalker said he was not worried about
his lightsaber as he could get another one, but that without the text he would
not be able to move forward with his training. He feared that if he lost it
and was no longer able to access its knowledge, techniques, and history of the
Force and the Jedi Order or be able to use it to find places he could learn
more, he would never truly become a Jedi.[172]

After Chewbacca realized that they could use the Path engine to escape No-
Space, Blythe gathered Skywalker and the others, offering them an old
[Longbeam cruiser](/wiki/Longbeam_cruiser "Longbeam cruiser") to retrieve it.
Skywalker was skeptical that it could fly, but Blythe assured them that it
used to and just needed to be fixed up. Once they got the cruiser to take off
and leave the colony, Holdo and Lando took inventory of what they had,
including that they had a Jedi. Skywalker reminded them that his connection to
the Force was different and hard to use in No-Space and something strange felt
like it was happening to it anyway, but he assured them he would try his best.
Calrissian assured them they would be fine, but Skywalker was still skeptical
and pointed out that the killdroids had found and taken the Path engine.
Skywalker decided that he would distract the droids so the others could get
the engine, but after needed to go back to the _Skyfarer_ and get his Jedi
text, refusing to leave without it. He added that he had talked to Forvan
before they left and that the boy, wanting to help out a Jedi, gave him
specialized gear, including a spacesuit, that he could use to get down to the
Great Hall. Wearing the spacesuit, Skywalker jumped from the cruiser down to
the Hall, ignited his lightsaber, and called out to the droids, encouraging
them to go after him. As Skywalker, Holdo, and Calrissian distracted the
droids, Skywalker deflecting their blastershots with his lightsaber, Chewbacca
went after the engine. However,

before they left and that the boy, wanting to help out a Jedi, gave him

the Hall, ignited his lightsaber, and called out to the droids, encouraging
them to go after him. As Skywalker, Holdo, and Calrissian distracted the
droids, Skywalker deflecting their blastershots with his lightsaber, Chewbacca
went after the engine. However, some droids noticed and went after Chewbacca
anyway, so Skywalker sent them flying away off into no-Space with the Force.
He warned Chewbacca that he probably would not be able to do it again, so he
needed to run and get the engine back to the ship.[174]

Kezarat Colony

After shooting a droid behind Chewbacca with a blaster, Skywalker started to
run off and told Holdo to keep Chewbacca safe while he ran after the Jedi
text. She reminded him that his lightsaber could not get through their armor
and that it was just a book, but Skywalker said that it was more than just a
book and that he had not been focused when his lightsaber would not cut them
the first time, but now was. Skywalker sliced through the droids with his
lightsaber while saying "the Force is with me" and calling out for what they
did with his book. He eventually found the book on a ledge at the edge of the
Hall and decided that he would easily be able to grab it and fly back to the
ship, but a killdroid shot his jetpack, sending him flying uncontrollably
toward the book and leaving it without fuel. As killdroids approached him,
their footsteps shaking the ground caused the book to go over the edge.
Skywalker screamed in horror and reached out to it with his right hand, which
was holding his lightsaber, but a droid grabbed his hand and lifted him up by
it, crushing both his hand and his lightsaber.[174] The droid threw him onto
the ground and into the remains of the _Skyfarer_ , and Skywalker cried out in
horror when he saw his hand and lightsaber. Calrissian and Holdo saw what
happened and decided to try and get to Skywalker before the droids killed him.
A delirious Skywalker told the approaching droids to stop, but when they did
not, he threw all of the droids out of the Hall in a massive wave using the
Force while telling himself "may the Force be with me." Calrissian, Holdo, and
Chewbacca were shocked at how he was doing it, and Calrissian told Chewbacca
to remind him never to get on his bad side. Skywalker then pulled the Jedi
text to him with the Force and passed out immediately after.[175]

Later, on the way back to the colony, Calrissian checked in on a now handless
Skywalker, though the droid had only destroyed his already mechanical hand.
Calrissian asked him how he would done what he did, but he said that he did
not understand how it happened and that

Holdo, and

Later, on the way back to the colony, Calrissian checked in on a now handless
Skywalker, though the droid had only destroyed his already mechanical hand.
Calrissian asked him how he would done what he did, but he said that he did
not understand how it happened and that it felt like the Force suddenly came
back to him stronger than ever, and that it was frightening. Calrissian told
him to cheer up, but thinking about his broken lightsaber and his inevitable
confrontation with Vader, told Calrissian that he was not sure he would be
able to do something he needed to anymore. Back at the colony, Skywalker
showed Organa, who had stayed behind, what happened to his hand. Blythe and
Forvan offered to fix it up, the latter suggesting a claw or grappling hook,
but Skywalker said he would just wait until they got home even though those
things would be cool. Skywalker and Chewbacca then presented the Path engine
to Blythe. After Blythe presented the group to the members of the colony, but
Organa and Calrissian warned them about the dangers of the Empire and
traveling with them, Blythe revealed to them that several of the colony
decided to go back with them. However, he revealed that many were going to
stay on the Great Hall since they got rid of all the killdroids. Chewbacca
pointed out that Skywalker got rid of all the droids by himself, and Blythe
commented that it seemed the things people said about Jedi were true. However,
Skywalker, who was struggling to pull a piece of scrap to him with the Force,
said they sometimes were true and sometimes were not. Later, after a rough
hyperspace jump made with many ships secured together and assisted by Lobot,
Skywalker and his friends as well as several members of the colony arrived
back in the greater galaxy.[175]

Back with the fleet, Skywalker had his mechanical hand repaired by a medical
droid while R2-D2 did his best to repair his lightsaber. Organa reminded
Skywalker that it could have been worse if the droid had crushed his other
hand, and asked him about the powerful act of the Force he had pulled off on
the Great Hall. He confirmed that he had not learned it from his book but that
it was instead related to something being wrong with the Force, describing it
as if something hit the Force while he was in No-Space and caused it to
ripple. He added that it felt like waves on the beach in the way that it
vacillated from him being the strongest he had ever been where he almost could
not control it, to not being able to feel it at all. Organa then wondered if
since he could feel it, and even she could slightly, that the Emperor and
Vader were also feeling it immensely and were distracted, making it their
chance to defeat them. Skywalker said her theory made sense, and she went to
speak with Mon Mothma. Skywalker thanked R2 for attempting to fix his
lightsaber, but admitted that he was going to need a new one for when he
inevitably faced Vader again.[175]

Aphra kidnaps Skywalker on Numidian Prime.

Though his lightsaber was still not fixed, Skywalker traveled to [Numidian
Prime](/wiki/Numidian_Prime "Numidian Prime") with R2-D2 in search of a
[temple](/wiki/Unidentified_temple_\(Numidian_Prime\) "Unidentified temple
\(Numidian Prime\)") on the planet. He briefly left R2 in a temporary camp
while he searched for it, but after finding no sign of it and it started to
rain he returned to the camp, finding peace in the solitude. He apologized to
R2 for leaving, saying they needed to wait for the rain to taper off, but then
noticed the droid was deactivated and laying on the ground. He cried out and
ran to the droid, but a node underneath the droid started shooting smoke out,
confusing Skywalker and knocking him out after he inhaled it. The trap had
been set by Doctor Chelli Aphra, who then stood over an unconscious Skywalker
and greeted him, calling him a "farm boy", and asked how he felt about going
on an adventure.[179]

Aphra eventually bound and gagged Skywalker and placed him in a crate on her
ship the _[Ark Angel IV](/wiki/Ark_Angel_IV "Ark Angel IV")_. When he woke up,
she opened the crate and said she was glad he was still breathing before
offering him [Caf](/wiki/Caf "Caf"). She started to get him some as he
realized who kidnapped him, telling her he did not want Caf and just wanted to

put a restraining bolt on and turned off R2, and Skywalker realized that she

Realizing it was a Jedi holo, Skywalker listened as Jedi Master [Shaak

and Aphra believing Skywalker had referenced her and Sana Starros's breakup,
though in reality Skywalker had no idea that they had been in a relationship.
As the argument reached its peak as Aphra asked him how he broke his
lightsaber, a creature slammed onto the other side of the crystal wall,
terrifying the two, but after Kythoo's bell rang it retreated. After hurriedly
leaving to another section of the temple, Skywalker began to realize that the
entire place was made up of illusions after almost falling into a pit of
spikes. He suggested that things felt wrong and they should leave, but Aphra
held a gun to his head to stop him and revealed that she was trying to make
Skywalker more powerful because Vader had become more powerful, and she wanted
Skywalker to protect her from the Sith Lord. Skywalker agreed and convinced
her to put her blaster down, the two using Skywalker's ability to sense the
bell with the Force and Aphra's ability to take down the traps, obstacles, and
guardians in their way to eventually locate the bell.[180]

and Aphra face a Starweird.

As Skywalker used the Force to manipulate the reflections of the crystals to
lure the Starweird toward them, Aphra used her electro-tattoos to activate the
holograms of Masters Ti and Secura. Skywalker, Aphra, and R2-D2 were able to
flee the creature and its scream while it was distracted. However, the
creature found them, knocking Skywalker to the edge of the temple and leaving
him barely hanging on. While proclaiming her desperation to protect Skywalker,
she fought the Starweird using his lightsaber. Skywalker eventually pulled
himself up and shot at the creature, saying he would keep it if she died right
before Aphra sliced the creature's hand off, which Skywalker commented did not
feel good. Escaping into the _Ark Angel IV_ , but with the Starweird still on
their tail, Skywalker directed Aphra to lead them into the magnetic storm and
used the Force to activate the emitter, knocking the creature into the storm
and eviscerating it, and leaving him surprised at his ability.[181]

Later, back on Numidian Prime, Skywalker told Aphra she did not need to trick
or bribe him into protecting her from Vader, insisting he would help because
it was the the Jedi way. Aphra warned against his kindness, but Skywalker
declared he preferred to take the chance than close himself off from people in
need and leave himself all alone. Aphra told him to call her the next time he
needed to get into a Jedi tomb, but Skywalker said he would not and took off
in his X-wing, having taken the emitter with him before Aphra could
realize.[181]

#### Christophsis

    " _Every time I think I have a handle on being a Jedi, something happens to kick me back. The ground under my feet just disappears … I'm going to have to face Vader again, and I am not ready. I don't even have a lightsaber I can rely on._"
    ―Skywalker to Organa[182]

While studying his Jedi text and the yellow kyber crystal from his lightsaber
on the _Home One_ , Skywalker realized that he did not know a lot about kyber
crystals except them being in every lightsaber as their power source. He
explained to R2-D2 that the text only contained details about the philosophy
and spirituality

something happens to kick me back. The ground under my feet just disappears … I'm going to have to face Vader again, and I am not ready. I don't even have a lightsaber I can rely on._"
    ―Skywalker to Organa[182]

While studying his Jedi text and the yellow kyber crystal from his lightsaber
on the _Home One_ , Skywalker realized that he did not know a lot about kyber
crystals except them being in every lightsaber as their power source. He
explained to R2-D2 that the text only contained details about the philosophy
and spirituality of kyber crystals and an old rite of passage for younglings
to find a crystal to make their first lightsaber on the planet Ilum, referring
to another manual by Professor [Huyang](/wiki/Huyang "Huyang") for building
instructions. He figured that Yoda and Kenobi had never taught him anything
about them because he had already had one, but lamented that his had never had
a connection with him like they were supposed to due to the almost living
nature of the crystals. He ignited his lightsaber and said that now that the
crystal was cracked it no longer was a useful tool and was unstable. Due to
the saber's unsteadiness, R2 made a concerned beep and Skywalker shut it off
and apologized. Realizing that he needed a new crystal, Skywalker decided that
he and R2 should visit other worlds the text mentioned to find them since Ilum
was locked down by the Empire. Just then, Organa walked in. After he told he
was going somewhere, she expressed her concern for him especially due to the
strangeness of the Force as well as her desire for him to stay and help the
Alliance. Skywalker insisted he was fine, saying he was just troubled by not
knowing why the Force was strange or how to fix his lightsaber and felt like
he could never truly get a handle on being a Jedi. He also admitted that he
needed a lightsaber for his confrontation with Vader, and that he felt like he
needed to go on this mission in order to take control and take

Organa walked in. After he told he
was going somewhere, she expressed her concern for him especially due to the
strangeness of the Force as well as her desire for him to stay and help the
Alliance. Skywalker insisted he was fine, saying he was just troubled by not
knowing why the Force was strange or how to fix his lightsaber and felt like
he could never truly get a handle on being a Jedi. He also admitted that he
needed a lightsaber for his confrontation with Vader, and that he felt like he
needed to go on this mission in order to take control and take action.[182]

Christophsis

Skywalker chose to go to Christophsis, due to the fact that there was not much
of a permanent Imperial presence there despite it being an Imperial world and
because the text said kyber crystals could regularly be found there. He flew
his X-Wing there with R2 and landed outside of a small mining town where
prospectors sell their finds so he would not get noticed, though did not want
to have to walk the way there. R2 indicated to him that he wanted to know the
plan, so Skywalker admitted that he did not have one. He explained that
Calrissian had told him there was a black market for crystals on Christophsis
because prospectors try to sell them since there was not enough for the Empire
to set up a full-scale mining operation. He told R2 that he just planned to
put the word out and pose as a buyer to see who

Calrissian had told him there was a black market for crystals on Christophsis
because prospectors try to sell them since there was not enough for the Empire
to set up a full-scale mining operation. He told R2 that he just planned to
put the word out and pose as a buyer to see who would speak with him. He
admitted that it was not much of a plan but gave R2 his lightsaber to hold
onto while he looked around, not wanting to make it obvious he was a Jedi. He
assured R2 he would be fine and told the droid that he could save him if he
got into trouble. He then started in to a nearby cantina.[182]

was offering to point Skywalker to his quarry, a human with green hair shot
and killed him and everyone else in the cantina except for Skywalker, leaving
him shocked. She taunted him and called him by name, so Skywalker used the
Force to pull his lightsaber to him from R2, who had just rolled in and
ordered her to explain herself. She introduced

out a blaster behind the counter. She explained that the whole place was ploy
to trap people looking for kyber and sell them to the Empire, and that she
saved him from it because he was a Jedi. She claimed that she still believed
and recognized him from the dark channels, having posted out there in case any
Jedi came through. She told him that there was kyber near and told him that
she had to kill the people there because she knew he would not. Skywalker was
still upset that she killed everyone there, insisting they died for nothing
and urging her to live a better life before leaving. Skywalker went off to
look for crystals on the planet, sensing she had told the truth about there
being some there, but she called after him and told him he was going the wrong
direction. He saw she had a speeder with her and urged him to let her help
him, explaining that she was from Jedha and that her people were the
[Fallanassi](/wiki/Fallanassi "Fallanassi"). She revealed that they were
killed by the Death Star, and that when Skywalker had destroyed it he had
avenged them, and thus she wanted to return the favor. Skywalker told R2 to go
back to the ship and tell the others where he was if he did not come back in a
day, assuring the droid he would be okay and that he needed to do this while
getting in Gretta's speeder.[182]

On the way, Skywalker asked Gretta about the Fallanassi. She explained that
they did not use kyber crystals and had not been Force-sensitive for many
years, only understanding it, not using it. When he asked, she also revealed

avenged them, and thus she wanted to return the favor. Skywalker told R2 to go

On the way, Skywalker asked Gretta about the Fallanassi. She explained that
they did not use kyber crystals and had not been Force-sensitive for many
years, only understanding it, not using it. When he asked, she also revealed
that they were going to meet a man named [Cuata](/wiki/Cuata "Cuata") who had
hid there to escape the eye of the Empire and continue his studies, having
been sought out by the Imperials to help design the weapon. Skywalker was
confused about how she knew this information, and she explained that she has
been working for him. Suddenly, a massive creature emerged from the gournd and
knocked Skywalker and Gretta off of the speeder. Skywalker ignited his
lightsaber and told Gretta to run, but she was delirious and urged him to
fight the creature. Noticing the instability of his lightsaber, he decided
just to run as the creature crushed their speeder with its mouth. The creature
pursued them closely, so Skywalker just told Gretta to run, intending to use
the Force to calm the creature. However, when he tried to he found himself
unable to touch the Force. The creature nearly reached him until a massive
explosion rocked him and Cuata emerged from the smoke and dust, instantly
asking Skywalker if he could have his lightsaber.[182]

At Cuata's workshop, Skywalker explained that he had found his lightsaber and
that he and his R2 unit had worked on it. Cuata, concerned at Skywalker's lack
of knowledge, explained the components and inner workings of a lightsaber and
told Skywalker that a lightsaber's wielder should have a strong connection
with its crystal, something Skywalker admitted he had never felt, not even
with his father's lightsaber. While Cuata worked on fixing the lightsaber, he
gave Skywalker a red kyber crystal and asked him to pull the dark side out of
it. Gretta, whose people had a history with healing crystals, explained how
crystals were turned red by [bleeding](/wiki/Bleeding "Bleeding") them with
the Dark side, but could be healed afterward, though the process of doing so
could change people and forced them to connect with whoever bled it.[183]

raw kyber crystal, assuring him that he would pull him out if his crystals
told him the Force was receding. After reaching out to the crystal, Skywalker

still asked Yoda why he never answered when he reached out to him with the
Force especially since he was hurt and trying to learn. Yoda insisted that all
Jedi need to walk their own Path and that he would have returned to him
otherwise. Yoda warned that Skywalker would need to make a decision about
himself soon. Skywalker decided that he was not getting anything from speaking
to Yoda and that he would be better off just learning from his Jedi text. He
tried to leave the vision but could not, realizing that the Force had pulled
back from him as it had been recently. Yoda told Skywalker that it was not
really gone even when it was out of sight, waved his hand, and sent Skywalker
out of the vision, wishing him goodbye. Yoda, who had been really speaking to
Skywalker the whole time, asked the spirit of Kenobi what he thought. They
both agreed that he was still not ready, but Yoda pointed out that he had
learned much and would be ready when the time came.[183]

When Skywalker exited the vision, he discovered that the clear kyber crystal

tell Cuata anything.
Skywalker thanked Cuata for fixing his lightsaber and told him that he would
take the green crystal for when he needed to build his own saber, also taking
the red one in case one day he could heal it. Back at his X-Wing, Skywalker
thanked Gretta for helping him and said he had learned despite things not
going the way he had thought. He said he would go back to the Alliance
eventually as his biggest battles still lay ahead, but revealed that he was
going to spend time thinking first while holding up both the red and green
crystal with the Force.[183]

While he was away, Organa used the intel Skywalker gave her that the Emperor
and Vader were distracted by a Force anomaly to launch an [aerial assault on
Coruscant](/wiki/Aerial_assault_on_Coruscant "Aerial assault on Coruscant"),
successfully destroying a statue of Palpatine in the hopes of inspiring
rebellion across the galaxy.[184]

When studying his Jedi text, he found a refrence to a Jedi outpost in the

a map R2-D2 pulled up for him, however, he decided that there was probably
nothing there but that they could swing by if they got the chance. Later, as
the [Scourge of the droids](/wiki/Scourge_of_the_droids "Scourge of the
droids") began across the galaxy, Skywalker was in a meeting with Rebellion
higher-ups concerning how to handle the new Death Star. Commodore Grek
suggested they just threw Skywalker at it again, but Skywalker suspected it
might take more than him in an X-wing to take down the new station.[186]

Later, while Skywalker was meditating and practicing telekinesis, he was
approached by C-3PO, who had been infected by the malevolent droid entity
called the [Scourge](/wiki/Scourge "Scourge") that was behind the scourge of
the droids. The Scourge, as C-3PO questioned Skywalker on the nature of the
Force and if droids could use it. Skywalker explained that he had never heard
of that happening but thought it could potentially be possible. When the
Scourge then asked if Skywalker's cybernetic arm felt connected to the Force,
he explained that his whole being felt connected, but that he was not a true
cyborg like Darth Vader. Skywalker expressed his concern that something was
wrong with C-3PO, leading to the Scourge briefly considering killing him.
Instead, the droid just apologised and agreed to get a diagnostic, before
agreeing to Skywalker's request to send R2-D2 his way.[187]

As the scourge of the droids continued, Calrissian recruited Skywalker and
Organa for a mission to the planet [Epikonia](/wiki/Epikonia "Epikonia") to
rescue Lobot, who had been infected by the Scourge. When they arrived in the
_Millenium Falcon_ , Skywalker was unsure what made the world special until
Organa explained that it was a communications hub. Calrissian then

As the scourge of the droids continued, Calrissian recruited Skywalker and
Organa for a mission to the planet [Epikonia](/wiki/Epikonia "Epikonia") to
rescue Lobot, who had been infected by the Scourge. When they arrived in the
_Millenium Falcon_ , Skywalker was unsure what made the world special until
Organa explained that it was a communications hub. Calrissian then refused to
allow Skywalker to access transpoder signals and turned off the _Falcon_ 's
navigation systems to prevent the infection from reaching the ship's [droid
core](/wiki/L3-37 "L3-37"). Skywalker and Organa were concerned, but
Calrissian managed to land them safely on a satelite dish. The Scourge soon
learned that Skywalker was on the planet and became obsessed with the idea of
infecting him so that it could use the Force.[188]

Organa, Calrissian, and Chewbacca fight the Scourge on Epikonia.

As the group traversed through the planet's main city where the Scourge was
headquartered, Skywalker noticed that there were no people around. They were
then [attacked](/wiki/Battle_on_Epikonia "Battle on Epikonia") by a horde of
violent Scourge-infected droids, Skywalker using his yellow lightsaber to
begin taking them down alongside his friends.[188] Skywalker sliced through
the ever-growing mob of droids while urging himself to stay calm, focused, and
concentrated on the Force. When the droids ominously and suddenly retreated, a
new swarm of [spider-droids](/wiki/Spider-droid "Spider-droid") attacked.
Skywalker tried to fight them off, but was quickly infected with the Scourge
by one. As the Scourge was controlling Skywalker's body and declared itself
the 'new Force' it was defeated by Ajax Sigma, freeing Skywalker from its
control. Though unsure what happened, Skywalker went with the others to find
Lobot. Once they did, Calrissian and Chewbacca started to take him back to the
ship while Skywalker and Organa assisted people who had been experimented on
by the Scourge.[185]

Skywalker and Organa returned to the ship very quickly, as they found
themselves unable to assist a great amount. They discovered Calrissian with
the [Talky droid](/wiki/Autonomous_Translator_Module,_Mark_II "Autonomous
Translator Module, Mark II") that contained much of the Alliance's secrets. As
Organa and Calrissian threatened each other, Skywalker urged them to focus on
healing Lobot. Calrissian then explained the circumstances that had led him to
sell the droid, and thus the Alliance's secrets, to Jabba the Hutt, leaving
Skywalker and Organa shocked.[185]

### The last of the Jedi

#### Zastiga

    " _Weapons and war don't make you a Jedi. I know that now._ "
    ―Luke Skywalker[189]

After the command of Red Squadron was transferred to Antilles following his
promotion to squadron leader, which pleased Skywalker,[139] he declined to
rejoin the squadron and chose to be stationed onboard the _Redemption_. When
he went to [Zastiga](/wiki/Zastiga "Zastiga"), he and R2-D2 were the ones to
greet Organa on her arrival to the planet after she and C-3PO left the
_[Mellcrawler](/wiki/Mellcrawler "Mellcrawler")_ , piloted by its owner [Nien
Nunb](/wiki/Nien_Nunb "Nien Nunb") and Lieutenant [Caluan
Ematt](/wiki/Caluan_Ematt "Caluan Ematt"). When the time came for Organa to
attend the top clearance meeting with the Rebel leadership, Skywalker and Nunb
met with Antilles for a discussion of "reconnaissance tactics" about Antilles'
refusal to pay the [Sullustan](/wiki/Sullustan "Sullustan") a drink. He would
later return to escort Organa to her quarters before going to his, and two
days later, he saw her off, before catching his own shuttle back to the
_Redemption_.[189]

Soon afterwards, he would go to [Kothlis](/wiki/Kothlis "Kothlis"), where he
would learn of Solo's location—still frozen in carbonite and kept in Jabba the
Hutt's palace—, and where he would keep himself up-to-date with the status of
the Alliance Fleet's assembly. He had already devised a plan to rescue Solo
when Organa contacted him following the successful [Operation Yellow
Moon](/wiki/Operation_Yellow_Moon "Operation Yellow Moon"), and showed
eagerness to join him on his attempts to [rescue](/wiki/Rescue_of_Han_Solo
"Rescue of Han Solo") the Corellian smuggler.[189]

Luke Skywalker during the raid at Imperial Refining Platform M36.

Sometime before the rescue of Solo, Skywalker took part in a
[raid](/wiki/Raid_at_Imperial_Refining_Platform_M36 "Raid at Imperial Refining
Platform M36") on [Imperial Refining Platform
M36](/wiki/Imperial_Refining_Platform_M36 "Imperial Refining Platform M36").
During

Skywalker during the raid at Imperial Refining Platform M36.

Sometime before the rescue of Solo, Skywalker took part in a
[raid](/wiki/Raid_at_Imperial_Refining_Platform_M36 "Raid at Imperial Refining
Platform M36") on [Imperial Refining Platform
M36](/wiki/Imperial_Refining_Platform_M36 "Imperial Refining Platform M36").
During the raid, Skywalker used [his new
lightsaber](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker%27s_green_lightsaber "Luke Skywalker's green
lightsaber"), along with his Force abilities, to clear a path for Rebel forces
to acquire copious Imperial fuel stores. His Rebel companions became awed at
his use, although one of them, the
[major](/wiki/Unidentified_Rebel_major_\(Pau%27an\) "Unidentified Rebel major
\(Pau'an\)") in charge of the operation, held reservations about its power as
he had only previously seen such power being wielded by the Sith. Unknown to
Skywalker, the Emperor had begun to probe his mental defenses from afar, which
caused Skywalker to briefly open his saber in alarm.[190]

As Skywalker and the strike team flew away from the platform, they were
ambushed by an Imperial Star Destroyer, which launched several TIE Fighters in
pursuit. As the battle began to rage, Skywalker's mind was penetrated by a
vision from the Emperor. The vision saw Luke follow a possible series of
events wherein he would begrudgingly leave the Rebel strike team to its fate
and crash-land on an unknown planet, losing his X-wing in the process. As he
journeyed from the wreckage together with R2-D2, Luke would leave his
lightsaber and helmet on the ground, symbolizing his complete retreat from the
concerns of the war.[190]

Having later broken free of the Emperor's vision, Skywalker proceeded to aid
the Rebels in escaping the Imperial ambush, using his lightsaber to prevent
the major's shuttle from leaving, giving him time to pilot the shuttle and
draw the Imperials away from the rest of the Rebels.[190]

In [4 ABY](/wiki/4_ABY "4 ABY"),[38] Skywalker set in motion the plan to
rescue Solo from Jabba the Hutt[10] due to their failure to do so during the
[Attack on the _Executor_](/wiki/Attack_on_the_Executor "Attack on the
Executor").[161] Once again, Skywalker returned to Tatooine, and to Kenobi's
hut, wherein he found the missing parts he needed for the construction of his
own lightsaber, the pieces left to him by Kenobi. While his friends bustled
about preparing for the rescue, Skywalker retreated into the solitude of a
desert cave they had chosen as their rendezvous point. Using the Force to
assemble the weapon, he brought the kyber crystal inside to life, making the
weapon his own, almost an extension of himself.[139]

Afterward, Skywalker waited to see if Organa's impersonation of
[Boushh](/wiki/Boushh "Boushh") and liberation of Solo was successful without
his intervention, but she was only half-successful. She then sent a message to
Skywalker and Calrissian that she had been captured as well, prompting
Skywalker to act and go to Jabba's Palace.[139] Skillful use of the Force
allowed Skywalker to get past Jabba's [Gamorrean](/wiki/Gamorrean "Gamorrean")
guards and use a Jedi mind trick to get his [majordomo](/wiki/Majordomo
"Majordomo"), [Bib Fortuna](/wiki/Bib_Fortuna "Bib Fortuna"), to present him
to the Hutt. However, Jabba was not so easily swayed by Skywalker and ignored
both his demand to give him Solo and Chewbacca and Skywalker's warnings about
underestimating him. Jabba laughed and dispatched Skywalker through a trap
door where he was standing, dropping the young Jedi into a pit below, where
the Hutt unleashed his massive [rancor](/wiki/Rancor "Rancor")
[Pateesa](/wiki/Pateesa "Pateesa"). Skywalker struggled against the terrifying
creature that tried to feast on him. But to the shock of Jabba and his
henchmen, Skywalker was

Skywalker was taken on a [skiff](/wiki/Skiff "Skiff") to the pit, where Jabba
watched on from his [sail barge](/wiki/Sail_barge "Sail barge") the
_[Khetanna](/wiki/Khetanna "Khetanna")_. Before he was walked out onto a plank
above the mouth of the sarlacc, Skywalker yelled to Jabba, telling him that he
had one last chance to free them and would die if he did not. Skywalker nodded
to Calrissian, who was on the skiff, and then saluted to R2-D2, who was on the
_Khetanna_ , before jumping off the plank, grabbing onto it, and using as a
springboard to flip back onto the skiff. Skywalker then escaped when R2-D2
shot his lightsaber to him, allowing him to take down the guards and free the
other prisoners on the [skiff](/wiki/Skiff "Skiff"). A skirmish ensued in
which Skywalker protected his friends, including facing and fending off Boba
Fett, jumping over and onto the _Khetanna_ , ending the life of several of
Jabba's thugs[10]--including [Klaatu](/wiki/Klaatu "Klaatu")[139] and
[Nysad](/wiki/Nysad "Nysad"), who shot his cyborg hand during the skirmish--
and helping Organa, who had killed the Hutt by strangling him, escape the
_Khetanna_ by swinging together on a rope back over to the skiff. After
destroying the sail barge by pointing one of its guns at its deck and
activating it before they left it, he and his friends left on the skiff once
he made sure they brought C-3PO and R2-D2 back with them.[10] Skywalker and
his entire team then escaped unscathed through a dangerous sandstorm,[139]
after which he boarded his X-Wing with R2-D2 and parted ways with the
others.[10]

Yoda as he
becomes one with the Force.

Skywalker then returned to Dagobah to complete his training and keep the
promise he had made to Yoda,[10] but the aged Jedi Master, whose long life was
supported by the Force, had fallen ill and was finally starting to succumb to
age. Yoda explained this to Skywalker and assured him that it was the way of
the Force, with no way to prevent it. Yoda told Skywalker that he would
already completed all the training he required, but in order to finally become
a true Jedi, he needed to confront Darth Vader one more time.[139][10] As his
final moments creeped up on him, Yoda reflected on Skywalker being too old for
what he was learning, too serious, too tall to fit in the hut, truly good, and
that he was able to see Anakin's eyes in Luke's.[192]

Skywalker inquired if Vader was truly his father.[10] Having grown less and
less sure since the revelation, Skywalker feared that it was the truth.[139]
Skywalker received such confirmation from Yoda,[10] which angered him that
they had lied to him for so long but Yoda confessed that he knew that
Skywalker had not been ready to shoulder the burden of being the child of the
Dark Lord of the Sith.[139] When Yoda suggested that Skywalker should not have
rushed to face Vader, Skywalker expressed his regret that he did not listen to
him the first time. Yoda then reached out to Skywalker in the Force and felt
his fear and awe.[192] The dying Jedi then warned him not to underestimate the
Emperor's [powers](/wiki/Force_power "Force power") or allow the dark side to
take hold of him, and that as "the last of the Jedi" he had to pass on what he
had learned.[10] Wishing to give Skywalker a chance to find connection and
family in someone other than Vader,[192] Yoda made one final revelation to
Skywalker before he became one with the Force--that there was "another
Skywalker."[10]

Skywalker received confirmation from Kenobi that Darth Vader was indeed his
father.

Sensing his turmoil,[139] the spirit of Kenobi appeared before Skywalker, who
confronted him for lying about his father. Claiming that the good man that
Anakin Skywalker had been had died upon his fall to the dark side, Kenobi
stated that he did not directly lie to him about his father; he was simply
telling him what happened "from a certain point of view." Skywalker voiced his
belief that there was still good within his father, and that he could not
bring himself to kill him, but Kenobi insisted that he needed to face him
again in order to restore balance to the Force. Skywalker then asked about

telling him what happened "from a certain point of view." Skywalker voiced his
belief that there was still good within his father, and that he could not
bring himself to kill him, but Kenobi insisted that he needed to face him
again in order to restore balance to the Force. Skywalker then asked about the
"other Skywalker," who Kenobi told him was his long-lost twin sister, who had
been separated from him at birth to protect them from the wrath of the Empire.
Skywalker instantly came to the realization that this sister was Organa, which
was confirmed by Kenobi.[10] Skywalker almost immediately inquired about their
mother's identity and fate, but Kenobi asked him to let that truth stay with
him for a while longer, as he knew Skywalker carried too many burdens
already.[139]

"Scout trooper") that were guarding the shield bunker, and Skywalker and
Organa pursued them on [speeder bikes](/wiki/74-Z_speeder_bike "74-Z speeder
bike"). Though they successfully stopped the scouts, Organa became separated
from Skywalker.[10]

Upon learning of her disappearance, Solo, Skywalker, Chewbacca, and the droids
went looking for her, only to be captured by a tribe of [Ewoks](/wiki/Ewok
"Ewok"). Using the Force to prove C-3PO's [deific](/wiki/Deity "Deity")
"[magic](/wiki/Magick "Magick")," Skywalker convinced the Ewoks to release
them and, after C-3PO's tale of their adventures, the whole group was accepted
as a part of the [village](/wiki/Bright_Tree_Village "Bright Tree
Village").[10] However, Skywalker felt as Vader reached out to him through the
Force and landed on the moon,[139] and knew that he had to confront Vader. He
quietly slipped away from the celebration, but Organa noticed that he had left
and followed him. He informed her of what he was planning to do and also told
her that, in the event that he did not make it back, she would the last hope
of the Alliance, going on to tell her that she was his sister, and she could
use the Force too.[10]

Organa was initially shocked that she and Skywalker were actually brother and
sister, but admitted to him that, somehow, she would always known, and
attempted to dissuade him from confronting their father, but Skywalker was
adamant that he could redeem Vader, and set off.[10]

Eventually encountering an Imperial patrol and willingly surrendering
himself[10] to Commander [Igar](/wiki/Altadan_Igar "Altadan Igar"),[193]
Skywalker was brought to Vader and tried to convince his father to renounce
the dark side by referring to him as "Anakin Skywalker," but Vader harshly
denounced his former name.[10] Although he managed to make Vader question the
dark truths that had long ruled him,[139] Skywalker ultimately became a
prisoner of the Emperor as he was escorted to his [throne
room](/wiki/Emperor%27s_Throne_Room "Emperor's Throne Room") onboard the Death
Star.[10]

#### The final duel

    " _If you will not be turned, you will be_ destroyed _! Young fool. Only now, at the end, do you understand. Your feeble skills are no match for the power of the dark side. You have paid the price for your lack of vision! Now, young Skywalker …you will die._"
    ―Darth Sidious to Luke Skywalker[10]

Palpatine retained a consistent belief that Skywalker would become his new
apprentice and replace Vader, even making the claim to a spectre of Yoda that
appeared before him.[192] As Skywalker was brought before the Emperor, the
Dark Lord of the Sith repeatedly told the young Jedi that he would fall to the
dark side just as easily as Vader had, and let him know that he had purposely
allowed the Alliance to discover the second Death Star's location in order to
lure them into a trap and finish them off once and for all.[10]

Skywalker confronted Vader on the second Death Star, believing he could redeem
his father in spite of the Emperor's control over him.

In order to temper Skywalker's negative emotions, Sidious forced him to watch
as the [Imperial Fleet](/wiki/Imperial_Navy "Imperial Navy")
[engaged](/wiki/Battle_of_Endor "Battle of Endor") the Rebels. He constantly
encouraged Skywalker to give into his anger and hatred. Though Skywalker was
resistant at first, his feelings of hopelessness and desperation only grew as
the destruction of the Rebel fleet and the death of his friends appeared
imminent. Attempting to strike down the Emperor, Skywalker found himself once
again facing his father in a duel. Unlike their previous encounter on Bespin
(where Vader was largely able to dominate the proceedings, throughout), this
time the pair would fight as equals.[10]

After successfully parrying a flurry of blows, Skywalker sent Vader tumbling
down a stairwell before regaining his composure and appealing to the good in
his father. Vader would have none of it and attacked once again, though
eventually Skywalker withdrew from combat altogether and refused to fight
Vader any further, retreating into the shadows of the throne room.[10]

In order to goad his son back into fighting him, Vader used
[telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") to probe his thoughts, learning of
the existence of his daughter and Skywalker's twin sister, stating that
perhaps she could be seduced to the dark side if Skywalker could not. This
statement pushed Skywalker over the edge and caused him to finally give into
his rage. Attacking his father much more aggressively this time, he unleashed
his full might upon the Sith Lord. Eventually pushing Vader into a corner,
right next to the Death Star's reactor shaft, Skywalker repeatedly struck him
with multiple heavy blows, and with one

him, Vader used
[telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") to probe his thoughts, learning of
the existence of his daughter and Skywalker's twin sister, stating that
perhaps she could be seduced to the dark side if Skywalker could not. This
statement pushed Skywalker over the edge and caused him to finally give into
his rage. Attacking his father much more aggressively this time, he unleashed
his full might upon the Sith Lord. Eventually pushing Vader into a corner,
right next to the Death Star's reactor shaft, Skywalker repeatedly struck him
with multiple heavy blows, and with one final, devastating strike of his
lightsaber, sliced Vader's hand off at the wrist, sending it--and the weapon
it still gripped--cascading down into the depths below.[10]

A cackling Sidious, delighted that Skywalker had not only given into his
hatred, but made use of it to such an extent, encouraged him to deliver the
killing blow to his father and take his place as his apprentice. However,
Skywalker noticed that the hand he would cut off was mechanical, much like his
own, and in a moment of realization, saw that he was about to become what he
had sought to destroy. Skywalker tossed his lightsaber aside and defiantly
declared to the Emperor that he had failed, and that he was a Jedi like his
father before him.[10]

Infuriated that his plan to corrupt Luke had gone up in smoke, Sidious
declared that, if Skywalker would not be turned, he would be destroyed, and
unleashed a barrage of [Force lightning](/wiki/Force_lightning "Force
lightning") against him. Unprepared for the lightning, Skywalker desperately
tried to protect himself, to no avail. During the Sith master assault on the
Jedi Knight, Vader had gotten back to his feet and returned to his master's
side, and Luke begged his father to save him.[10]

Eventually, seeing his son in such terrible pain became too great for Vader to
bear any longer, and in that moment, the Sith Lord Darth Vader was gone, and
the Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker was reborn. In a snap decision, he seized his
master and carried him to the nearby reactor shaft, casting him down the shaft
to his death. In doing so, however, he turned Sidious's lethal Force lightning
on himself,

bear any longer, and in that moment, the Sith Lord Darth Vader was gone, and
the Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker was reborn. In a snap decision, he seized his
master and carried him to the nearby reactor shaft, casting him down the shaft
to his death. In doing so, however, he turned Sidious's lethal Force lightning
on himself, irreparably damaging his life-supporting armor.[10]

Vader found redemption through his son and fulfilled the prophecy of the
Chosen One before ultimately dying as Anakin Skywalker.

Luke carried Anakin to Imperial shuttle _[ST 321](/wiki/ST_321 "ST 321")_
,[139] where his father asked him to remove his breathing mask. Though Luke
was hesitant to do so, convinced that his father would die without it, Anakin
told him that nothing could prevent his death now, but before he died, he
wanted to look upon his son with his own eyes. Luke relented and removed the
mask, gazing upon his father's real face for the first and only time. Anakin
then encouraged Luke to leave him and save himself. Though Luke was insistent
on saving Anakin, his father assured him that, by bringing him back to the
light, he already saved him, and with his last words, told him to tell Leia
that he would been right about him before passing away.[10] At the cost of his
own life and with the help of his son, Anakin Skywalker had finally fulfilled
his destiny as the Chosen One and had brought balance to the Force.[194]
Similarly, by helping his father to return to the light side of the

first and only time. Anakin
then encouraged Luke to leave him and save himself. Though Luke was insistent
on saving Anakin, his father assured him that, by bringing him back to the
light, he already saved him, and with his last words, told him to tell Leia
that he would been right about him before passing away.[10] At the cost of his
own life and with the help of his son, Anakin Skywalker had finally fulfilled
his destiny as the Chosen One and had brought balance to the Force.[194]
Similarly, by helping his father to return to the light side of the Force by
offering him unconditional love and refusing to fight, destroy, or let his
anger eclipse the goodness in his [heart](/wiki/Heart "Heart"), Luke Skywalker
had achieved what Anakin and the whole Jedi Order failed to achieve upon being
twisted by the Clone Wars: to forgive a monster and reveal a man.[195]

Skywalker took his father's body on board the shuttle and escaped just before
the Death Star's destruction,[10] when he was almost intercepted by [Green
Squadron](/wiki/Green_Squadron_\(Rebel_Alliance\) "Green Squadron \(Rebel
Alliance\)")'s Shara Bey, who proceeded to cover him from [TIE
interceptors](/wiki/TIE/IN_interceptor "TIE/IN interceptor") after he
identified himself.[196] Back on Endor, Skywalker [cremated his father's
armor](/wiki/Funeral_of_Anakin_Skywalker "Funeral of Anakin Skywalker") (his
body had vanished) in the manner of a [Jedi's funeral](/wiki/Jedi_funeral
"Jedi funeral"), and then joined his friends and sister in the celebration. It
was during this moment of celebration that Skywalker saw the onlooking Force
spirits of Kenobi, Yoda, and his father, looking at him in approval and with a
sense of peace.[139][10]

#### Aftermath of Endor

Following the Battle of Endor, In the battle's aftermath, Skywalker reported
to the Rebel Alliance that the Emperor and Darth Vader were dead. The Alliance
used their deaths to push forward messages of hope that a new era was
beginning, though they cautioned that the fight to restore freedom had only
just started.[197]

#### Aftermath of Endor

Following the Battle of Endor, In the battle's aftermath, Skywalker reported
to the Rebel Alliance that the Emperor and Darth Vader were dead. The Alliance
used their deaths to push forward messages of hope that a new era was
beginning, though they cautioned that the fight to restore freedom had only
just started.[197]

Skywalker and Organa helped the Ewoks [Kneesaa](/wiki/Kneesaa_a_Jari_Kintaka
"Kneesaa a Jari Kintaka") and [Wicket W. Warrick](/wiki/Wicket_Wystri_Warrick
"Wicket Wystri Warrick") reset their traps to stop a [Gorax](/wiki/Gorax
"Gorax"). Sensing that Ewoks and Organa needed time to complete the task,
Skywalker used his lightsaber to slice through a log that the Gorax had thrown
at him before he threw his lightsaber to Organa to use to cut a log.[198]

Skywalker later officiated the
[wedding](/wiki/Wedding_of_Han_Solo_and_Leia_Organa "Wedding of Han Solo and
Leia Organa") between his sister and Solo.[199]

In the days ahead, the Rebel Alliance began the formation of the [New
Republic](/wiki/New_Republic "New Republic"), a successor state to the
Galactic Republic. The Empire, meanwhile, reeled from its defeat and its
leadership was in chaos, and the Imperial government claimed that the reports
of the Emperor's demise were treasonous propaganda.[200]

Skywalker encountered Del Meeko during his search for the Emperor's
Observatory on Pillio.

Not long after the Battle of Endor, Skywalker felt a calling from
[Pillio](/wiki/Pillio "Pillio") in the [Jinata system](/wiki/Jinata_system
"Jinata system"). Chasing the call, Luke, along with R2, took his X-wing and
set course for the remote aquatic planet. When they arrived, the two came
across an Imperial Shuttle making its descent, confirming Skywalker's
suspicions that the planet held something of importance. He left his faithful
Astromech Droid with his ship, and it was not long before the young Jedi
encountered Stormtroopers on guard, who attacked him on sight. Skywalker made
his way through several dozens of troopers and

[Jinata system](/wiki/Jinata_system
"Jinata system"). Chasing the call, Luke, along with R2, took his X-wing and
set course for the remote aquatic planet. When they arrived, the two came
across an Imperial Shuttle making its descent, confirming Skywalker's
suspicions that the planet held something of importance. He left his faithful
Astromech Droid with his ship, and it was not long before the young Jedi
encountered Stormtroopers on guard, who attacked him on sight. Skywalker made
his way through several dozens of troopers and officers, remarking that the
Empire must have been searching the planet. Sensing something unnatural from
within a nearby cave, the Jedi found that native wildlife,
[Scritters](/wiki/Scritter "Scritter"), were attacking the invading imperials.
Hearing cries for help, Skywalker made his way further into the depths of the
planet to find [Del Meeko](/wiki/Del_Meeko "Del Meeko"), a member of [Imperial
Special Forces](/wiki/Imperial_Special_Forces "Imperial Special Forces") Unit
[Inferno Squad](/wiki/Inferno_Squad "Inferno Squad"), with his arm stuck in
the amber of the Scritters. Despite their different allegiances, Skywalker
used his lightsaber to cut through the amber and free the soldier. When Meeko
asked why the Jedi helped him, Skywalker simply responded, 'Because you
asked'.[201]

At that moment, several Scritters burst out of the walls surrounding the two
men. Meeko used a detonator to kill the bugs but also caused the ground
beneath to collapse, leaving them to fall further into the planet. They landed
in a small shallow stream of water, and Skywalker used the Force to protect
Meeko from falling rocks. After being helped to his feet, Meeko remarked that
stories of the Jedi always scared him as a young boy. Skywalker responded that
if they want to get out, they'll need to work together. Making their way
through the caves, Luke shared that the Force has brought them to together and
apologizes for killing the rest of his men; he was reluctant to do so, but
they left him no choice, while Meeko did. As the two made their way out of

planet. They landed
in a small shallow stream of water, and Skywalker used the Force to protect
Meeko from falling rocks. After being helped to his feet, Meeko remarked that
stories of the Jedi always scared him as a young boy. Skywalker responded that
if they want to get out, they'll need to work together. Making their way
through the caves, Luke shared that the Force has brought them to together and
apologizes for killing the rest of his men; he was reluctant to do so, but
they left him no choice, while Meeko did. As the two made their way out of the
cave, Del revealed that the Emperor had an observatory on the planet and that
Meeko was tasked with destroying it. Skywalker and Meeko eventually escaped
the cave and gained access to the observatory by destroying its defense
system.[201]

Skywalker discovered that the key to opening the vault door is to use the
Force, prompting Meeko to wonder why the observatory could only be opened by
the Force and if the man who hunted down the Jedi was secretly one of them.
Luke suggested that Del had learned to fear the wrong thing.[201]

The two investigated the vault, apparently full of junk, and Skywalker took a
[compass](/wiki/Jedi_star_compass "Jedi star compass"). When Meeko asked why
he should be allowed to keep it, Skywalker responded, 'Because I asked'. As
the two left, Skywalker remarked that the Empire had done enough damage to
innocent worlds and that Meeko could choose not between the Empire or the
Rebellion, but to be a better person. He wished the Force with Meeko before
leaving.[201]

At some point Skywalker was promoted to General.[202]

after the Battle of Endor, Skywalker planned a

and, along with Artoo, they flew a stolen Imperial shuttle,

told Bey about the plan, including how she would pose as ISB Agent [Alecia

Pathfinders during a [raid](/wiki/Raid_at_the_Wretch_of_Tayron "Raid at the

unannounced inspection. The base's commander, [Commandant](/wiki/Commandant
"Commandant") [Hurron](/wiki/Hurron "Hurron"), showed them into the facility
and led them to the research lab containing the tree, at which point he

attempted to stop their escape. Once back at _Antarra_ , Hurron ordered his
forces to throw thermal detonators at the escaping

[Hurron](/wiki/Hurron "Hurron"), showed them into the facility
and led them to the research lab containing the tree, at which point he
revealed that he knew that Bey was not Beck. Hurron questioned why two Rebels
would break into the facility, and Skywalker explained the importance of the
tree--which he found had two remaining fragments. Skywalker and Bey fought
their way out of the base, making their way through numerous stormtroopers who
attempted to stop their escape. Once back at _Antarra_ , Hurron ordered his
forces to throw thermal detonators at the escaping Rebels, but Skywalker used
the Force to deflect them back, killing Hurron and several of his
stormtroopers in an explosion.[203]

The Rebel trio made their way back towards the Alliance Fleet. During the trip
back, Skywalker and Bey discussed the latter's future plans for service in the
Rebellion, as Skywalker knew that Bey was considering leaving the Alliance to
reunite with her husband, Pathfinder Sergeant Kes Dameron, and their son Poe
Dameron|Poe. Bey was unsure as to whether she wanted to leave the Rebels
behind, but Skywalker's guidance helped Bey decide to leave the Alliance. The
Jedi Knight gifted one of the tree fragments to her, as he had only expected
to find one, believing that the important relic would be kept safe with Bey
and her family. She and Dameron planted it outside of their [new
home](/wiki/Wetyin%27s_Colony "Wetyin's Colony") on Yavin 4.[203]

#### Legends and rumors

An [Imperial officer](/wiki/Unidentified_Imperial_gunner "Unidentified
Imperial gunner") stationed on a Star Destroyer claimed to have seen the Jedi
Knight using the Force and a lightsaber to dispatch Star Destroyers in space,
causing them to crash into the surface of the planet. When the Star Destroyer
crashed into the surface the officer said he was recovered by a figure who

The Galactic Civil War came to a close with the signing of the [Galactic
Concordance](/wiki/Galactic_Concordance "Galactic Concordance"), a peace
treaty between the Republic and the Empire that forced it to remain within
pre-established borders, though some of the remnants of the once-powerful
military force disappeared into the [Unknown Regions](/wiki/Unknown_Regions
"Unknown Regions").[206] Following the signing of the treaty, Leia gave birth
to her and Han's son and Luke's nephew, Ben Solo. There were rumors that
Skywalker visited his sister and Han before disappearing on an untold mission.
Others claimed that his absence was conspicuous.[207]

After the Battle of Endor, Skywalker's sister became his first apprentice.

After the Battle of Endor, Skywalker took on his first student and trained his
twin sister in the ways of the Force. At the latter's suggestion the two of
them trained together on [Ajan Kloss](/wiki/Ajan_Kloss "Ajan Kloss"). Under
his tutelage, Organa constructed [her lightsaber](/wiki/Leia%27s_lightsaber
"Leia's lightsaber"), and began to learn the principles of lightsaber combat.
Skywalker also instructed in her in the basics of the Force, teaching her
about light side, and in meditation. He was impressed by Organa's strength in
the Force and how quickly she progressed in her training. While training her,
he found it interesting that she struggled with skills and concepts that he
had a natural affinity for (like lightsaber combat), but excelled in other
areas (like meditation) that were harder for him to master. He would use
various tools to help Organa develop her senses, such as a repurposed [KSE-H44
A-wing pilot helmet](/wiki/KSE-H44_A-wing_pilot_helmet "KSE-H44 A-wing pilot
helmet") and marksman-H combat training remotes.[4]

Skywalker explained from personal experience that the Force allowed glimpses
of the future, past, and at times, departed, and that these voices would offer
her guidance from beyond death in times of hardship.[4]

##### Leia's final training session

    " _It was the last night of her training. Leia told me that she had sensed the death of her son at the end of her Jedi path. She surrendered her saber to me and said one day it would be picked up again by someone who would finish her journey._ "
    ―Luke Skywalker, to Rey[15]

On the final night of her training, Organa experienced a dark vision that her
Jedi path would lead to the death of her [unborn son](/wiki/Ben_Solo "Ben
Solo").[15] Realizing where the galaxy needed her most,[4] she set aside her
lightsaber[15] to focus on her new family and
[senatorial](/wiki/New_Republic_Senate "New Republic Senate") duties.[4] While
Skywalker hoped that his sister would resume her training later on, Organa
gave him her lightsaber to convince him otherwise, asking to pass it on to a
promising student someday. However, Skywalker did not do that and never told
her where he stored her lightsaber.[208]

#### Quest for knowledge

    " _I had great hope for the future of the Jedi. I came to believe that if a single Jedi could help bring balance back to the Force, then perhaps a restored Jedi Order could maintain peace and prevent the dark side from ever regaining its hold on the galaxy. So I scoured worlds for the remaining Jedi texts and gathered a new class of apprentices under my tutelage._ "
    ―Luke Skywalker[212]

With the Empire fallen and the Sith seamlessly vanquished, Skywalker had great
hope for the future of the Jedi. He believed if a single Jedi could bring
balance to the Force as his father had done, then a revived Jedi Order could
keep the peace and prevent the dark side from ever returning to such
strength.[212]

Just as he promised Farnay near the start of his own Jedi studies,[45] in 5
ABY,[213] Skywalker set about rebuilding the Jedi Order. Despite his optimism,
he had many unanswered questions[214] and was hesitant to take on another
apprentice after his sister Leia, unsure of his grounding in Jedi lore.[4]
Instead, Skywalker largely disappeared from galactic view and dedicated
himself to traveling the galaxy in hopes of finding what remained of the Jedi
after the Empire's long efforts to eradicate their history. Through his quest,
he came to understand much about himself and his destiny and gained the
confidence he needed to rebuild the Jedi Order.[214] Luke, being the last
Jedi, became a caretaker of the Jedi Order's legacy. As he traveled the
galaxy, he also searched for force-sensitives who could possibly become

another
apprentice after his sister Leia, unsure of his grounding in Jedi lore.[4]
Instead, Skywalker largely disappeared from galactic view and dedicated

he came to understand much about himself and his destiny and gained the

Jedi, became a caretaker of the Jedi Order's legacy. As he traveled the
galaxy, he also searched for force-sensitives who could possibly become his
students.[215]

Skywalker's research into the Jedi was a long and difficult task that took him
years.[214] He was aided by [Lor San Tekka](/wiki/Lor_San_Tekka "Lor San
Tekka"), an explorer and member of the [Church of the
Force](/wiki/Church_of_the_Force "Church of the Force")[216] who, though not
Force-sensitive himself, believed in the Jedi ideals. San Tekka was old enough
to remember the Jedi Knights before the Clone Wars, and he did not believe the
Emperor's lies about how the Jedi betrayed the Old Republic.[206] San Tekka,
who believed that the return of the Jedi Order was essential to bring balance
to the Force,[8] became a valuable ally for both Skywalker and

"Lor San
Tekka"), an explorer and member of the [Church of the

Force-sensitive himself, believed in the Jedi ideals. San Tekka was old enough
to remember the Jedi Knights before the Clone Wars, and he did not believe the
Emperor's lies about how the Jedi betrayed the Old Republic.[206] San Tekka,
who believed that the return of the Jedi Order was essential to bring balance
to the Force,[8] became a valuable ally for both Skywalker and Organa.[206]

[Gatalenta](/wiki/Gatalenta "Gatalenta") was one of the first destinations in
Skywalker's search,[14] and he also traveled to Moraband,[217] the ancient
home of the Sith,[19] to investigate anything he could about the Force.[217]
He visited the [Deep Core](/wiki/Deep_Core "Deep Core") planet of
[Tython](/wiki/Tython "Tython") many times and studied its ancient [ruined
temple](/wiki/Force-henge "Force-henge"), impressed by the majesty of the site
every time he visited.[7] He scoured many worlds and assembled a collection of
eight ancient bound [books](/wiki/Book "Book")[4] and scrolls[17] that
described Jedi tenets, history and guidance for those following the path of
the Jedi--[sacred Jedi texts](/wiki/Sacred_Jedi_texts "Sacred Jedi texts").
One of the books was the _[Rammahgon](/wiki/Rammahgon "Rammahgon")_ , an
influential work that was thought destroyed over 5,000 years ago but retrieved
by Skywalker while he explored the subterranean ruins of [Ossus](/wiki/Ossus
"Ossus"). The _[Aionomica](/wiki/Aionomica "Aionomica")_ was another, a two-
volume collection of Jedi explorations and codifications of the Force, part
codex, correspondence and scrapbook.[4] He also found a book that was a
catalog of the [Eeshaypher Collection](/wiki/Eeshaypher_Collection "Eeshaypher
Collection"), a forbidden gallery of artifacts related to the dark side of

but retrieved

Temple](/wiki/First_Jedi_Temple "First Jedi Temple"). He uncovered many
tantalizing clues that hinted at the origins of the Jedi, but the precise
location was a mystery. One key to unravelling the mystery was his study of
the spread of the Force-sensitive uneti saplings.[214] He also made use of the
[Jedi star compass](/wiki/Jedi_star_compass "Jedi star compass") he had

"Plasma")-encased [supraluminite](/wiki/Supraluminite "Supraluminite")
[lodestone](/wiki/Lodestone "Lodestone") at

but the precise
location was a mystery. One key to unravelling the mystery was his study of
the spread of the Force-sensitive uneti saplings.[214] He also made use of the
[Jedi star compass](/wiki/Jedi_star_compass "Jedi star compass") he had
discovered in the Emperor's storehouse on Pillio. With a [plasma](/wiki/Plasma

[lodestone](/wiki/Lodestone "Lodestone") at its center, the compass functioned
much like the ancient [wayfinders](/wiki/Wayfinder "Wayfinder") and was
attuned to specific points in hyperspace. Through studying the compass,
Skywalker uncovered a path to Ahch-To the site of [Temple
Island](/wiki/Temple_Island "Temple Island") and the first Jedi Temple.[4]
With the help of Lor San Tekka, he finally put together the many clues and
learned the location of the temple, a discovery that he and San Tekka kept a
secret.[214]

With San Tekka, Skywalker hunted down relics the force across the stars.
Following the Jedi compass he recovered on Pillio, the pair mapped out the
network of Jedi temples scattered across the galaxy, many of which were
forgotten after the end of the Jedi Purge. Their voyages proved fruitful most
of the time, Skywalker amassing a massive collection of tomes, texts, scrolls,
data cards, ritual items, sigils, and other antique symbols. Besides the Jedi
star compass, Skywalker also acquired lightsabers. All of this, the pair of
men researched, gaining even deeper understanding of the old Jedi Order and
its

Following the Jedi compass he recovered on Pillio, the pair mapped out the

Skywalker instructing Grogu on Ossus.

Fulfilling the dying wish of Yoda,[10] Skywalker set out to begin training a
new generation of Jedi. Having rescued and brought in an original Jedi Padawan
from the twilight years of the Galactic Republic, Skywalker ventured to Ossus
with the young Grogu to build the first [Jedi
Academy](/wiki/Jedi_Temple_of_Luke_Skywalker "Jedi Temple of Luke Skywalker")
after the Jedi Order's near extinction following Order 66. Possessing the
wisdom and teachings of his own masters, Skywalker tried to educate his young
student through the ways of the Force. Telling tales of Master Yoda onto
Grogu, the young Jedi Master passed on what he had learned, echoing Yoda's
words "size matters not" and to do, not try. However, Skywalker strived to
make impression on his small student, having to stop him from using the Force
to eat creatures and let Grogu use the Force as he did. Knowing that knowledge
lied in Grogu's memory, Luke offered to help him remember and placed his hands
gently on the alien's head. Seeing the traumatic images of the 501st Legion
gunning down three Jedi Knights protecting the Padawan, everything faded to
black when the clones killed the Jedi and moved towards Grogu. When his
student awoke, Luke greeted his return and began to better understand the
turmoil and subsequent reluctance of Grogu towards his

impression on his small student, having to stop him from using the Force
to eat creatures and let Grogu use the Force as he did. Knowing that knowledge
lied in Grogu's memory, Luke offered to help him remember and placed his hands
gently on the alien's head. Seeing the traumatic images of the 501st Legion
gunning down three Jedi Knights protecting the Padawan, everything faded to
black when the clones killed the Jedi and moved towards Grogu. When his
student awoke, Luke greeted his return and began to better understand the
turmoil and subsequent reluctance of Grogu towards his lessons.[223]

Heeding the advice of Tano, Skywalker decided to offer Grogu a final choice.
In the stone hut, Skywalker presented Grogu with Din Djarin's gift as well as
the lightsaber of Master Yoda, which Skywalker had kept. The first path was to
accept the present from Djarin and be returned to him, however, by choosing
attachment he would forsake the Jedi way. The second was to pick up [Yoda's
lightsaber](/wiki/Yoda%27s_second_lightsaber "Yoda's second lightsaber") and
pledge himself to Luke's teachings to become his first Jedi Padawan. He told
Grogu that to become a Jedi would take years and hard work, though at the end
he could be a great Jedi. He then let Grogu choose.[223]

Grogu would choose the armor, thus leading Skywalker to put him in his X-wing
starfighter and instruct R2-D2 to pilot him to Tatooine to be reunited with
Djarin.[224] Despite their time together being brief, Skywalker's guidance had
a significant impact on Grogu. After being asked about Grogu's impressive use
of the Force by fellow Mandalorian [Bo-Katan Kryze](/wiki/Bo-Katan_Kryze "Bo-
Katan Kryze"), Djarin noted that his abilities were a result of Skywalker's
training.[225]

Some time after his meeting with Ahsoka Tano, the
[Nightsister](/wiki/Nightsisters "Nightsisters") [Morgan
Elsbeth](/wiki/Morgan_Elsbeth "Morgan Elsbeth") recruited former Jedi Knight
of the old Jedi Order [Baylan Skoll](/wiki/Baylan_Skoll "Baylan Skoll"), who
was aware of the truth behind Skywalker's father, to help locate Imperial
[Grand Admiral](/wiki/Grand_Admiral "Grand Admiral")
[Thrawn](/wiki/Mitth%27raw%27nuruodo "Mitth'raw'nuruodo"). As Skywalker had
become prominent during the Galactic Civil War, Skoll became aware of his
existence, and kept his name, alongside the names of other Rebel heroes,
listed in a device on his gauntlet during the search for the planet
[Peridea](/wiki/Peridea "Peridea") in a

Skoll"), who
was aware of the truth behind Skywalker's father, to help locate Imperial
[Grand Admiral](/wiki/Grand_Admiral "Grand Admiral")
[Thrawn](/wiki/Mitth%27raw%27nuruodo "Mitth'raw'nuruodo"). As Skywalker had
become prominent during the Galactic Civil War, Skoll became aware of his
existence, and kept his name, alongside the names of other Rebel heroes,
listed in a device on his gauntlet during the search for the planet

Skywalker and Solo together

Though reluctant to take on another apprentice at first, when the Force
awakened in Skywalker's nephew Ben Solo[4] and his mother Leia could see the
dark side taking hold of her son, she entrusted the boy to her brother to help
him find balance.[212] He agreed to train the 10-year-old Solo,[4] in [15
ABY](/wiki/15_ABY "15 ABY").[228] Skywalker took on the responsibilities of a
Jedi Master by teaching his nephew. After Ben's fall to the dark side however,
Luke would say that he was merely playing the role of Jedi

to take on another apprentice at first, when the Force
awakened in Skywalker's nephew Ben Solo[4] and his mother Leia could see the
dark side taking hold of her son, she entrusted the boy to her brother to help
him find balance.[212] He agreed to train the 10-year-old Solo,[4] in [15
ABY](/wiki/15_ABY "15 ABY").[228] Skywalker took on the responsibilities of a
Jedi Master by teaching his nephew. After Ben's fall to the dark side however,
Luke would say that he was merely playing the role of Jedi Master as it was a
title he had not formally earned.[212]

Skywalker taught Solo the ways of the Jedi, in its many forms, under the
tutelage and impressed on his pupil the importance of practicing discipline
and control. Solo gave his best efforts to gain his Master's approval,
although at times their familial bond caused him to address Skywalker as uncle
instead of Master.[7] Though he loved his nephew,[229] Skywalker had committed
his life to reestablishing the Jedi Order's teachings, which had virtually
nothing to do with family ties; therefore, he taught Solo that detachment and
distance were necessary to gaining the pure focus that every Jedi aspired to
achieve.[7]

His nephew soon joined in exploring the galaxy for ancient Jedi lore,[4] and
together they found holocrons from forgotten eras and ancient Jedi texts with
arcane writings.[195] The two shared more than the same Skywalker blood, for
like him, Ben gained a strong devotion to the ways of the Jedi Order.[212]
Skywalker saw his nephew's raw power and believed he could pass on his
strengths to him,[17] and he attempted to manage his progress through the
Force by having him exercise a level of restraint.[230] Solo was his strongest
and most prized student,[18] and Skywalker went on to place his hope for the
Jedi Order's future within his nephew,[212] and despite knowing of the
darkness within his pupil, the Jedi Master believed he was strong enough to
keep it in check.[214]

Skywalker was a kind master,[215] and Solo considered his uncle to be a strong
and amazing teacher,[227] but Skywalker made mistakes that culminated over
time, protecting Ben from the dark truths of their family, much like his
sister did before him, and inadvertently

a level of restraint.[230] Solo was his strongest
and most prized student,[18] and Skywalker went on to place his hope for the
Jedi Order's future within his nephew,[212] and despite knowing of the
darkness within his pupil, the Jedi Master believed he was strong enough to
keep it in check.[214]

Skywalker was a kind master,[215] and Solo considered his uncle to be a strong
and amazing teacher,[227] but Skywalker made mistakes that culminated over
time, protecting Ben from the dark truths of their family, much like his
sister did before him, and inadvertently isolated Ben over the years of his
training.[4] At the request of his sister, Luke never provided his nephew with
the details of Anakin Skywalker's fall to the dark side or Darth Vader's
redemption and return to the light.[195]

During his training of his nephew, a powerful dark side-practitioner known as
[Snoke](/wiki/Snoke "Snoke"),[227] who was the [Supreme
Leader](/wiki/Supreme_Leader "Supreme Leader") of a splinter group of the
Empire known as the [First Order](/wiki/First_Order "First Order"), and also
secretly a puppet of the resurrected Emperor Palpatine,[15] began influencing
Ben from afar, clouding him with the dark side.[227] At some point Skywalker
had encountered Snoke and supposedly damaged him,[18] and Snoke was
responsible for indirectly inspiring Luke to rebuild the Jedi Order, having
tried to shatter his resolve.[214]

Skywalker training a new generation of Jedi

Around [16 ABY](/wiki/16_ABY "16 ABY"),[3] Skywalker gathered disciples, young
force-sensitive beings adrift with no way to harness their abilities as a
result the Jedi Purge,[195] who went on to be his first students.[214]
Skywalker's new students numbered about a dozen besides his nephew,[206]
including students [Voe](/wiki/Voe "Voe"), [Tai](/wiki/Tai "Tai"), and
[Hennix](/wiki/Hennix "Hennix"),[18] and he worked to teach them everything he
had learned in his own training and about the light side of the Force per
Yoda's command.[231]

Skywalker hoped that teaching the students in a real Jedi Temple would offer
them a more traditional Jedi path than his own training under Obi-Wan Kenobi
and Yoda. He kept temple's location on Ossus a secret known only to the
members of the Order and his loyal droid R2-D2.[214] Skywalker stored the
recovered Jedi knowledge and relics that he and Lor San Tekka had recovered
within the Jedi Temple,[7] a decision which Solo disagreed, which he believed
was just locked up and never used.[227]
