command.[231]

Skywalker hoped that teaching the students in a real Jedi Temple would offer
them a more traditional Jedi path than his own training under Obi-Wan Kenobi
and Yoda. He kept temple's location on Ossus a secret known only to the
members of the Order and his loyal droid R2-D2.[214] Skywalker stored the
recovered Jedi knowledge and relics that he and Lor San Tekka had recovered
within the Jedi Temple,[7] a decision which Solo disagreed, which he believed
was just locked up and never used.[227]

With the small gathering of his new students looking to him as a spiritual
guide and mentor for the Jedi arts, Skywalker believed he could usher in a new
era of enlightenment.[195] With his attention now split between several other
apprentices, Skywalker's nephew Ben Solo's focus was drawn away to dark Force
knowledge.[4] Teaching several Jedi techniques and traditions as telekinesis,
meditation, and the use and construction of [lightsabers](/wiki/Lightsaber
"Lightsaber"),[219] Skywalker's approach for guiding the young minds under his
care was steeped in his own master Yoda's teachings passed on while he was on
Dagobah, so would often be preaching about patience and balance.[195]

While also instilling the belief that all beings were equal within the
Force,[195] he gave lectures outside his temple, passing on ever more
experience from training with Yoda on Dagobah as he taught the levitation of
rocks through the Force. During one such event, student Voe asked why Ben Solo
was stronger, where Skywalker compared the Force to a door, that it would
become easier to use the more she opened herself up to it. The Jedi Master
also tutored Hennix in opening holocrons through the Force, reminding the
young [Quarren](/wiki/Quarren "Quarren") to listen to the unique voices of
each holocron, for each one was different based on their teachings.[219]

Skywalker desired heavily to preserve the teachings of the Jedi Order,
laboring to pass on the best of what Yoda and Obi-Wan taught him as Jedi
mentors at his Jedi temple and to instill the core beliefs they embodied
within the next generation. Additionally, Luke understood what Yoda
experienced with himself on Dagobah as teacher,

opening holocrons through the Force, reminding the
young [Quarren](/wiki/Quarren "Quarren") to listen to the unique voices of
each holocron, for each one was different based on their teachings.[219]

Skywalker desired heavily to preserve the teachings of the Jedi Order,
laboring to pass on the best of what Yoda and Obi-Wan taught him as Jedi
mentors at his Jedi temple and to instill the core beliefs they embodied
within the next generation. Additionally, Luke understood what Yoda
experienced with himself on Dagobah as teacher, having the same unique
frustrations with his own pupils; a master guiding a young unseasoned student
that was convinced they were wasting time on pointless exercises, such as
stacking stones.[195]

Skywalker, Solo, and San Tekka discover the Jedi Outpost on Elphrona.

In [19 ABY](/wiki/19_ABY "19 ABY"), the year his nephew turned

Solo, and San Tekka discover the Jedi Outpost on Elphrona.

In [19 ABY](/wiki/19_ABY "19 ABY"), the year his nephew turned fourteen,[195]
Skywalker, Ben, and Lor San Tekka [traveled](/wiki/Mission_to_Elphrona
"Mission to Elphrona") to a [Jedi outpost](/wiki/Elphrona_Outpost "Elphrona
Outpost") on [Elphrona](/wiki/Elphrona "Elphrona"), a location from the days
of the High Republic Era, hoping to find Jedi artifacts. Luke flew the ship
and conversed with San Tekka, while Solo, without his master's knowledge, was
communing with Snoke. Skywalker was initially skeptical of a Jedi presence so
far from the core, but San Tekka assured him that with his expertise he had
recognized the description from his contact as a Jedi Outpost, and explained
that the Jedi's activity was greatly expanded throughout the galaxy during the
High Republic Era. Meanwhile, Solo telepathically communicated with Snoke,
expressing that he was tired of missions to find artifacts with Skywalker that
he would just lock away in the temple and never use. Solo admitted that
Skywalker was an amazing teacher, but was frustrated that he never wanted Solo
to use any of the things he had taught him, which Snoke claimed was because
Skywalker viewed Solo as a child and had not realized his true capabilities.
Skywalker then told Solo that they would possibly find insights into the old
Jedi, and added that they could find interesting weapons, as he knew that Solo
was interested in such subjects, which San Tekka affirmed. Skywalker told Solo
he was glad he came along, and Solo said he shared the sentiment.[227]

When they landed, Skywalker was impressed by the sight of the outpost. He
cautioned his apprentice to careful and warned that such a place was likely to
be rigged with traps, recalling a time he found a lightsaber in a similar
place that turned out to be a trap and nearly killed him. Inside, they found a
treasure trove that Skywalker judged so impressive he thought it may be better
than Jocasta Nu's cache, including many Jedi holocrons and a [lightsaber
rifle](/wiki/Lightsaber_rifle "Lightsaber rifle"). Skywalker was excited

the sentiment.[227]

themselves.[227]

### Quest for Exegol

#### Visions and voices

    " _But this …place, whatever it is. I'm seeing it for a reason, Lor. I can feel it._"
    ―Luke Skywalker to Lor San Tekka on his visions[7]

As his first disciples grew older[18] and new younglings came into the New
Jedi Order's care, Skywalker had a Twi'lek named [Enyo](/wiki/Enyo "Enyo")
help him as one of the younglings' instructors.[7]

In [21 ABY](/wiki/21_ABY "21 ABY"),[232] Skywalker started feeling an
increasing darkness in the Force and having dark visions that frequently came
to him in meditation. One day, Lor San Tekka, who was the only person
Skywalker told about the visions, visited Skywalker in his temple on Ossus,
his old friend's arrival heralded to Skywalker by Ben Solo. San Tekka greeted
Skywalker and Solo, but once the latter was gone, asked Skywalker about the
visions and whether or not they had become stronger or changed. Skywalker
asked San Tekka to help him understand the visions and learn what the place in
them was by standing vigil over him while he accessed the vision and described
it. San Tekka was hesitant, but agreed, and Skywalker thus began

One day, Lor San Tekka, who was the only person
Skywalker told about the visions, visited Skywalker in his temple on Ossus,
his old friend's arrival heralded to Skywalker by Ben Solo. San Tekka greeted
Skywalker and Solo, but once the latter was gone, asked Skywalker about the
visions and whether or not they had become stronger or changed. Skywalker
asked San Tekka to help him understand the visions and learn what the place in
them was by standing vigil over him while he accessed the vision and described
it. San Tekka was hesitant, but agreed, and Skywalker thus began the
meditation.[7]

the vision for a reason. Skywalker asked San Tekka the reason he had come to

    ―Mico Haswell to Luke Skywalker, after being influenced by a kyber crystal bled with the dark side of the Force[7]

Skywalker and San Tekka arrived at the archeological expedition on Yorturba
that was being conducted by the [Lerct Historical
Institute](/wiki/Lerct_Historical_Institute "Lerct Historical Institute") and
were greeted by archaeologist Dr. [Beaumont Kin](/wiki/Beaumont_Kin "Beaumont
Kin"), who informed them that the dig site was disappointing and they had not
found a Jedi temple. Skywalker still carried a feeling that he was there for a
reason despite this, and he would be proven correct when an archaeologist
named [Tee Mairi](/wiki/Tee_Mairi "Tee Mairi") discovered a [Sith
holocron](/wiki/Sith_holocron "Sith holocron") at the site. Skywalker
recognized it immediately, and San Tekka recognized the writing on it as the
Sith's mirrored [Aurebesh](/wiki/Aurebesh "Aurebesh"). Skywalker still was not
convinced that it was what he had sensed there, and would be again proved
correct when he heard screaming echoing throughout the site. Archeologist
[Mico Haswell](/wiki/Mico_Haswell "Mico Haswell") had discovered a Sith kyber
crystal and had his mind influenced by it, causing him to uncontrollably lash
out and cause destruction with the Force. Luke restrained him with the Force,
but in reaching out to him once again had a vision of Exegol that Haswell was
now present in. Haswell leapt toward Skywalker in the vison and moved in a way
that Skywalker recognized to be inhuman and even reptilian. Then Skywalker was
on Yoturba again and managed to restrain the man with the

Haswell](/wiki/Mico_Haswell "Mico Haswell") had discovered a Sith kyber
crystal and had his mind influenced by it, causing him to uncontrollably lash
out and cause destruction with the Force. Luke restrained him with the Force,
but in reaching out to him once again had a vision of Exegol that Haswell was
now present in. Haswell leapt toward Skywalker in the vison and moved in a way
that Skywalker recognized to be inhuman and even reptilian. Then Skywalker was
on Yoturba again and managed to restrain the man with the Force again, calling
a team of medics to sedate him via an injection.[7]

Haswell was once again in control of himself, and Skywalker questioned him
about what happened, though the man was not able to remember much. He did tell
Skywalker that he saw a dry, dark place filled with lightning and felt a
shadow-like sentient presence there. Once Haswell passed out, Skywalker
discovered the [bled](/wiki/Bleeding "Bleeding") kyber crystal in his hand,
and confiscated it. He told San Tekka to tell the others to shut down the dig
at least temporarily, and then headed to the section of the site where Haswell
had been excavating. He discovered that the chamber was actually a crashed
ship, and discovered more bled kyber crystals within it, that like the one
Haswell had been holding, were the wrong size and shape for a lightsaber. This
and his experience on the planet confirmed for Skywalker that something dark
and evil was coming, deciding to leave San Tekka there to look over the dig
site while he went to Tython in search of answers.[7]

Skywalker traveled to Tython and visited the ruined Jedi temple known as the
Force-henge, where he sat on the seeing stone and began to study the Sith
Holocron and the kyber crystals and perform research through his many ancient
tomes and personal notes. In a book that was a catalog of the Eeshaypher
Collection, Skywalker discovered an entry about a [Sith
wayfinder](/wiki/Sith_wayfinder "Sith wayfinder"), which he found remarkably
similar in appearance and utility to the Sith holocron. The book stated that
the wayfinders contained navigational data to an ancient Sith world called
Ixigul--or in Skywalker's translation: Exegol. Skywalker gleaned from both the
catalog and his other research that Exegol was meant to be a place of power
and eternal life, and that its secret was so important

In a book that was a catalog of the Eeshaypher
Collection, Skywalker discovered an entry about a [Sith
wayfinder](/wiki/Sith_wayfinder "Sith wayfinder"), which he found remarkably
similar in appearance and utility to the Sith holocron. The book stated that
the wayfinders contained navigational data to an ancient Sith world called
Ixigul--or in Skywalker's translation: Exegol. Skywalker gleaned from both the
catalog and his other research that Exegol was meant to be a place of power
and eternal life, and that its secret was so important that only two Sith
wayfinders were ever made. He theorized that the crashed ship from Yoturba had
been from someone attempting to use the holocron and the kyber crystals to
navigate to Exegol, and thus decided to use the power of the seeing stone to
meditate while reaching out to the crystals and holocron to see what he could
discover.[7]

During his meditation, Skywalker once again had a vision of Exegol, but this
time if felt like he was truly on the planet, causing him to wonder if the
information stored in the holocron had allowed the seeing stone to actually
transport him to the planet. Skywalker was then approached by nine Sith
wraiths on the planet who ignited red lightsabers and began to attack him.
Skywalker could block their lightsabers with his own, but could not attack the
wraiths themselves, his blade and his body merely passing right through them.
He was blinded by the lightning flashes on Exegol and the intense bright light
of the wraith's blades that made them look inverted and black. Skywalker
started struggling to fight them more and more until all nine wraiths
eventually went in for one coordinated strike, but before they could a blue
glow in the shape of a person holding a lightsaber appeared in from of
Skywalker and pushed them away. Skywalker realized he was being assisted by a
Force-spirit with a blue-bladed lightsaber and initially thought was Kenobi,
but when the figure lowered his hood, Skywalker learned that it was his
father, Anakin Skywalker. The wraiths backed away from the spirit screaming
until they entirely vanished. Anakin Skywalker then reached out his hand to
Luke, who took it and then found himself back on Tython as if he had

went in for one coordinated strike, but before they could a blue
glow in the shape of a person holding a lightsaber appeared in from of
Skywalker and pushed them away. Skywalker realized he was being assisted by a
Force-spirit with a blue-bladed lightsaber and initially thought was Kenobi,
but when the figure lowered his hood, Skywalker learned that it was his
father, Anakin Skywalker. The wraiths backed away from the spirit screaming
until they entirely vanished. Anakin Skywalker then reached out his hand to
Luke, who took it and then found himself back on Tython as if he had never
left.[7]

back.[7]

Calrissian expressed his worry over Ochi's implication that the Sith were
still out there pulling strings, and wondered why they would want that family
and go through the trouble of kidnapping the girl. Skywalker told Calrissian
about his visions of Exegol, and told him that the way to the planet was
hidden in a Sith wayfinder. Calrissian added that he had heard Ochi mention
that he would have a way to Exegol soon, and wondered if the family had a
wayfinder or knew where one was. But unbeknownst to Skywalker and Calrissian,
the father of the family was a [strand-cast](/wiki/Strand-Cast "Strand-Cast")
of the late Emperor Palpatine named [Dathan](/wiki/Dathan "Dathan"), and the
girl, his daughter named [Rey](/wiki/Rey_Skywalker "Rey Skywalker"), was thus
Palpatine's genetic granddaughter.[7]

Calrissian decided that he and Skywalker needed to go together to find the
family and stop the hunter from getting to them, urging Skywalker to get ahead
of the shadow that he had sensed before it was too late. Skywalker was
hesitant to bring Calrissian along, but agreed to partially because he was
aware of Calrissian's daughter's kidnapping and his friend's desperate hope
that investigating this kidnapping could lead to her. They agreed to meet at
the [Adelphi system](/wiki/Adelphi_system "Adelphi system") where Calrissian
had a contact with the New Republic that they hoped could tell them where the
New Republic had sent the family.[7]

hunting the fugitive family. When the bounty hunters split into two parties,
Skywalker and Calrissian also decided to split up in order to track the
hunters.[7]

While riding his speeder bike through a ravine system, Skywalker was
[ambushed](/wiki/Skirmish_on_Torrenoteer_Minor "Skirmish on Torrenoteer
Minor") by the two bounty hunters, also riding speeder bikes. Skywalker
deflected their blaster bolts of using his lightsaber, and hit one bolt back
at one of the hunters, causing the hunter's speeder bike to crash in a ravine.
Skywalker chased the second speeder over a lake, once again deflecting the
hunter's blaster bolts, causing the hunter and his speeder bike to fall in the
lake by hitting the bolts back at him. Skywalker then approached the
[Weequay](/wiki/Weequay "Weequay") hunter in his wrecked vehicle and attempted
to question him, but he fought Skywalker instead and subsequently died from
being impaled by his speeder bike's steering vane. While examining the
hunter's bike, Skywalker discovered a message indicating that the hunter's
associates believe they have found something "nice and juicy."[7]

Heading to coordinates transmitted by the hunter's associates, Skywalker found
that the Gran hunter Krastan had captured

Heading to coordinates transmitted by the hunter's associates, Skywalker found
that the Gran hunter Krastan had captured Lando and was holding him in the
prisoner clamp of a [CAP-2](/wiki/CAP-2 "CAP-2") walker. Skywalker fought
Krastan with his lightsaber, killing him by defecting his own blaster bolts
back at him. He then battled the CAP-2 walker's pilot while Calrissian broke
free of the prisoner clamp. Skywalker sliced the CAP-2's left leg with his
lightsaber, causing the machine to stumble, before using the Force to throw
the machine to the ground. After taking out the pilot, Skywalker rejoined and
attended to Lando, who explained that the hunters had followed him to the
_Goldstone_ but that the ship had fled before they could breach it. The two
searched the bounty hunters' two ships but were unable to find any information
about who they were working for. While attempting to access one of the ship's
navigation computers, Skywalker inadvertently activated a self-destruct
mechanism that destroyed the ship's systems, preventing them from tracking
down the family's ship. Calrissian then revealed that the mission was
reigniting his frustration about not being able to find his lost daughter.[7]

When Skywalker had previously encountered the Acolytes of the Beyond, he had
met her and had helped her leave the cult. When they arrived on Polaar, a
radioactive planet cut off from outside communication by an impenetrable
interference field, they were greeted by a former Imperial mouse droid called
[M-1](/wiki/M-1 "M-1") and a sword-wielding humanoid droid named
[KB-68](/wiki/KB-68 "KB-68"), who was serving as [Komat](/wiki/Komat
"Komat")'s sentry. Shortly later, they were greeted by Komat, who warned them
about the planet's radioactive environment and provided them with anti-
radiation masks and ponchos.[7]

Agreeing to help them if they helped her in turn, Komat took them to a wrecked
[Mon Calamari cruiser](/wiki/MC-series_star_cruiser "MC-series star cruiser")
that [crashed](/wiki/Skirmish_near_Polaar "Skirmish near Polaar") on Polaar
during the Galactic Civil War, explaining that with the shields overloaded,
the ship's fusion core had melted down, contaminating the planet with
distronic radiation that rendered it uninhabitable for most lifeforms.

wayfinder. Explaining that two Sith wayfinders were made as navigational

Using coordinates retrieved from the droid lander's [navigation
computer](/wiki/Navigation_computer "Navigation computer"), Skywalker and
R2-D2 located Kiza by tracking the attackers' origin to an
[asteroid](/wiki/Kiza%27s_world "Kiza's world") at the edge of the [Red
Honeycomb Zone](/wiki/Red_Honeycomb_Zone "Red Honeycomb Zone"). He discovered
her base, a wrecked Separatist [Core ship](/wiki/Core_ship "Core ship") and
entered it tentatively. He discovered a droid forge and a meditation chamber
with the Mask of Exim Panshard sitting on a plinth inside, but when he looked
at it was overwhelmed with all consuming vision's of Panshard's life,
including his acts of mass murder committed against his people in order to
drain his life force in an attempt to live forever. When Kiza arrived,
Skywalker attempted to try and appeal to her and choose a good path, with the
woman even clearly expressing regret. He insisted that the mask was using her
and she did not have to listen to it, but Kiza explained that it had promised
her rebirth on Exegol, which Skywalker told her was a lie. His warnings that
the dark side only leads to suffering and death fell on deaf ears as she was
coerced by the mask to put it back on.[7]

Kiza engaged Skywalker in lightsaber combat, fueled by the knowledge of
Panshard. Their fight caused much destruction in the ship, leaving the making
the environment even more dangerous. While fighting, Kiza used the Force in
attempt to pour hot molten metal onto Skywalker, but the Jedi Master used the
Force to escape the ensuing molten fire in the

attempt to pour hot molten metal onto Skywalker, but the Jedi Master used the
Force to escape the ensuing molten fire in the droid foundry. However, molten
material began to spread everywhere melt the ship. Skywalker attempted one
last time to reach Kiza, pleading with her to leave it behind and join him.
Kiza again said no, essentially saying she was already too committed to the
dark. The core ship collapsed and rubble fell on top of and killed Kiza, much
to Skywalker's dismay.[7]

Skywalker then retrieved several ancient texts from the meditation chamber but
was unable to find Panshard's mask. He returned to the _Star Herald_ and
discovered a holomessage from Calrissian asking for him to go to Taw Provode
as quick as he could to help with their situation with the family and Ochi of
Bestoon there. But unbeknownst to Skywalker, Panshard's mask survived, and as
he departed some of Kiza's droids followed programming to reforge the mask
with melted bled kyber crystals, before placing the mask on Kiza's dead body,
allowing Panshard to live again by possessing and reanimating her body.[7]

Skywalker and Lando Calrissian spent some time tracking down Ochi of Bestoon.

Skywalker arrived on Taw Provode just as Calrissian and Komat had been
discovered and captured by Ochi of Bestoon and his subordinate
[Corsec](/wiki/Corporate_Sector_Authority "Corporate Sector Authority")
forces. Skywalker faced off with Ochi, and was surprised that his lightsaber
did not cut through Ochi's dagger. The power of Ochi's dagger allowed him to
hold himself off against the Jedi for some time until Skywalker managed to use
his lightsaber to ignite a fuels reserve and trigger a massive explosion.
Panshard appeared in his TIE Defender and started shooting at Skywalker and
the others, leading Skywalker to realize that the mask was not really
destroyed and the ancient Sith Lord lived on. Skywalker and Komat decided to
chase him into space, while Calrissian and R2-D2 went after the family.[7]

Skywalker and Komat followed Panshard to [Taw Provode's solitary
moon](/wiki/Taw_Provode%27s_solitary_moon "Taw Provode's solitary moon"),
using the _Star Herald_ to shoot his TIE Defender down and strand him on the
moon. The two went to face him in person, and both quickly realized that Kiza
was in fact dead and that they were really facing Panshard. Panshard told

Sensing the darkness within Ben Solo, Skywalker instinctively moved to strike
down his nephew.

One night in [28 ABY](/wiki/28_ABY "28 ABY"),[233] Skywalker, sensing the
darkness within his nephew Ben growing in glimpses during his training,
decided to probe Solo's mind as he lay asleep. He learned that Snoke had
turned his apprentice's heart to the dark side,[17] and experienced a brief
dark vision[4] that Solo would bring nothing but death and destruction[17] and
leave Skywalker's loved ones in anguish. Despite the love for his nephew,[229]
in a flash of defensive instinct,[4] Skywalker thought he could stop that
future and for a brief moment of pure instinct he raised his lightsaber to
destroy him, believing that it was the only way to halt his descent into
darkness and prevent the end of everything he loved. This instinct was gone
almost the second that it had come, and Skywalker was immediately filled with
shame.[17]

Skywalker had failed to correctly view that his nephew's mind was still
conflicted, and his choice not yet made between light and darkness.[215] From
Rey's point of view, Skywalker's failure as not only Solo's Jedi Master, but
his uncle and family,

Jedi Temple is destroyed by Ben Solo.

Solo had already awoken to see his uncle standing over him with his lightsaber
raised. Confused and angry, Solo pulled his own
[lightsaber](/wiki/Kylo_Ren%27s_lightsaber "Kylo Ren's lightsaber") to him in
self-defense and attacked Skywalker, using the Force to pull down the hut on
top of him.[17] Solo emerged from the hut and screamed toward the temple,
asking Skywalker why he had done it, and in his anger bringing down a
lightning strike with the Force that destroyed the temple and set it on
fire.[3][18] When Skywalker came around, he emerged from the rubble of the hut
to find his temple destroyed, with his other apprentices either killed or
vanished along with Solo. This effectively left Skywalker the last of the Jedi
once more[17] as he was after the death of his own master, Yoda, decades
earlier.[10]

Three of Skywalker's apprentices, Tai, Hennix, and Voe, eventually returned to
the temple while it burned and were not able to sense his presence, which they
normally felt overwhelmingly in the Force. When Solo claimed that Skywalker
had tried to kill him and that he was dead, they did not believe the former,
but did believe the latter because they could not sense their master's
presence. Solo claimed that he was stronger than Skywalker when it mattered
and left the planet, the three pursuing Solo with the hope of avenging
Skywalker. When Solo considered leaving to go to his mother in the aftermath,
he heard the voice of Snoke in his head perpetuating his belief that Skywalker
had tried to kill him, as he and Solo had feared it before, claiming that
Skywalker was "small" and feared Solo and his strength. Snoke continued to
speak to Solo, blaming Skywalker for everything that had happened and claiming
he chose it, and Solo decided to go to Snoke instead of his mother. On the

with Snoke, Solo noticed the man's appearance and asked him what Skywalker had
done to him, but Snoke redirected the conversation to what Skywalker had done
to Solo. Solo tried to claim it did not matter because he had killed the Jedi
Master, but Snoke warned that Skywalker was not dead and would not die

cries out in anguish at discovering the temple destroyed.

Left deeply affected and mentally broken by what he believed to be his
ultimate failure, Skywalker lost faith in the Force and the vision of the Jedi
for having failed to rebuild the Jedi Order. Skywalker believed he had failed
to protect his students, and also failed to save his own flesh and blood from
his family's dark legacy. So Skywalker fled into self-imposed
[exile](/wiki/Exile_\(punishment\) "Exile \(punishment\)"), vanishing from the
galaxy at-large without a trace. No one knew for sure where he went, but those
closest to him believed he went off in search of the first Jedi Temple.[8]

To those who knew what Skywalker was seeking, there remained a way to find
him: after destroying the Jedi, the Empire had begun to seek out the thousands
of Jedi temples scattered across the galaxy, with the aim to prevent anyone
from discovering the lost secrets of the Order. As such, Imperial authorities
discovered the locations of some of the first Jedi Temples. The partial map
remained within the archives of the Empire. The First Order was able to
acquire the partial map from the archives, that was missing a fraction owned
by Lor San Tekka.[234] As he had downloaded Imperial star maps during his time
on the first Death Star,[235] R2-D2, Skywalker's faithful astromech, was able
to recover the contents of the map.[234]

The Jedi Master fled to the location of the Temple--on an aquatic planet named

Having failed in bringing back the Jedi Order, Skywalker intended nothing more
than to live out the rest of his days there in reclusive exile[231] and had

relics he had uncovered with

exiling himself to Ahch-To, Skywalker resolved to die as the last Jedi.

The Jedi Master fled to the location of the Temple--on an aquatic planet named
Ahch-To--that he discovered by studying the spread of uneti saplings.[214]
Having failed in bringing back the Jedi Order, Skywalker intended nothing more
than to live out the rest of his days there in reclusive exile[231] and had
pledged to protect the hidden world and its many secrets.[237] Taking the
relics he had uncovered with him, the [hermit](/wiki/Hermit "Hermit") [shut
himself off from the Force](/wiki/Sever_Force "Sever Force"),[231]
consequently ceasing the guidance of Obi-Wan Kenobi, Yoda, and Anakin
Skywalker's spirits.[212] It had taken years for him to learn the discipline
of blocking the Force out, and he considered the fact that it was harder to do
so than to feel it and let it in a dark secret that was never taught. He
believed the Force and the Jedi had many secrets and that not even the
greatest and in his opinion arrogant Jedi Masters could understand all of it.
Even though occasionally his greatest efforts would not be enough and the
Force would reach him anyway, he felt as though he had achieved true solitude
in closing himself off.[238]

Among the relics Luke had collected and brought into his exile were the sacred
Jedi texts and the Jedi Crusader pendant.[214] Some of which were mentioned as
being taken from the island long before in the Lanais' songs. The
[Caretakers](/wiki/Caretakers "Caretakers") tolerated Skywalker's presence,
though he had learned the [Lanai's language](/wiki/Lanai%27s_language "Lanai's
language") and ways, insisted on doing most of their duties to care for him
himself, and had appeared each month on the [Festival of
Return](/wiki/Festival_of_Return "Festival of Return"), something which
puzzled [Alcida-Auka](/wiki/Alcida-Auka "Alcida-Auka").[239]

Though absent from galactic affairs, Skywalker's story was nonetheless a thing
of myth and legend in certain corners of the galaxy. His exploits in the
Galactic Civil War were known to the

"Lanai's
language") and ways, insisted on doing most of their duties to care for him
himself, and had appeared each month on the [Festival of
Return](/wiki/Festival_of_Return "Festival of Return"), something which
puzzled [Alcida-Auka](/wiki/Alcida-Auka "Alcida-Auka").[239]

Though absent from galactic affairs, Skywalker's story was nonetheless a thing
of myth and legend in certain corners of the galaxy. His exploits in the
Galactic Civil War were known to the [Resistance](/wiki/Resistance
"Resistance"), a band of freedom fighters led by now-General Organa to
[combat](/wiki/Cold_War "Cold War") the rise of the First Order. Resistance
fighter pilot [Jessika Pava](/wiki/Jessika_Pava "Jessika Pava") learned that
C-3PO, who also served in the Resistance, knew Skywalker and asked the droid
to tell her a story about his former master. Threepio regaled her with the
tale of Skywalker's encounter with Sarco Plank on Devaron, and how Skywalker
kept his promise to Farnay and indeed returned to Devaron.[45] Members of the
First Order, however, had a less-than-ideal view of the Jedi Master; the First
Order taught their followers, including
[stormtroopers](/wiki/Stormtrooper_\(First_Order\) "Stormtrooper \(First
Order\)") like [FN-2187](/wiki/Finn "Finn"), that Skywalker was an enemy who
helped destroy the Empire. Despite the knowledge about Skywalker, the mystical
elements of his life, as well as the Jedi in general, were seen as mythic
rather than historic.[240]

Prior to Rey's arrival, Luke Skywalker hears the will of the Force despite his
efforts to block it out.

Prior to Rey's arrival on Ahch-To, Luke Skywalker had a dream while sleeping
in his hut. In his dream, he saw the life he would never have, one in which he
never left Tatooine and remained in the moisture farming business with his
uncle, marrying Camie Marstrap and allowing the Galactic Empire to shatter the
Rebel Alliance and destroy more planets with the Death Star. Luke eventually
awoke, trying to shake away his dream, and left his hut. He was still
astonished at the oceans of Ahch-To, which he attributed to growing up in the
deserts of Tatooine. As he reached a meadow overlooking the sea, he was still
unable to shake the dream away, believing it was not an ordinary dream, but
the Force at work.[239] Also shortly before Rey arrived, one of the moments
where the Force demanded to be heard and got through despite Skywalker's block
occurred. In that moment, the old Jedi Master undeniably felt that the Force
was telling him that someone had found him.[238]

#### Skywalker is found

    " _You think what? I'm going to walk out with a laser sword and face down the whole First Order?_ "
    ―Luke Skywalker to Rey[17]

In [34 ABY](/wiki/34_ABY "34 ABY"), Organa sent Resistance fighter Poe
Dameron,[8] the son of Shara Bey and Kes Dameron,[206] to Jakku to find San
Tekka and recover the map to Skywalker's alleged location, as she hoped her
brother would return and help in the fight against the dark side. The First
Order also learned of the map and sought it so they could destroy the last
Jedi. Dameron found San Tekka living in the village of [Tuanul](/wiki/Tuanul
"Tuanul"), and the old explorer gave the map to Dameron, who in turn gave it
to his astromech droid [BB-8](/wiki/BB-8 "BB-8"), before Kylo Ren and the
First Order arrived and [sacked](/wiki/Attack_on_Tuanul "Attack on Tuanul")
the village. Ren killed San Tekka and took Dameron into custody in the hopes
of finding the map, while BB-8 came into the possession of a Jakku
[scavenger](/wiki/Scavenger "Scavenger") named Rey. Rey believed that
Skywalker was only a myth, but she too possessed strength in the Force that
she had not yet discovered. Rey teamed with FN-2187, an ex-Stormtrooper who
took the name Finn after defecting from the First Order, and, with the help of
Han Solo and Chewbacca, sought to return the map fragment to the
Resistance.[8]

Accompanied by Chewbacca, Rey flew the _Millennium Falcon_ to Ahch-To and

When Rey arrived on the island, Skywalker was standing up top the
[saddle](/wiki/Saddle_\(Ahch-To\) "Saddle \(Ahch-To\)"), summoning the will to
try to torch the tree library again having just failed to do so.[239] While
standing there, Skywalker was reflecting that his efforts to block the Force
from him was impossible as it always demanded to be heard. But in that moment,
the old Jedi Master felt that someone had found him, turning around to see who
was, discovering Rey.[238] After making her way to Skywalker, Rey presented
him with his father's old weapon as a symbol of the only hope that the galaxy
had left.[234]

Though reluctant to take on another apprentice, Skywalker chose to train Rey
after R2-D2 replayed Organa's call for help.

After taking his old lightsaber and looking it over, Skywalker,[17] emotion
roiled over his face,[4] hoping to lose the blade once again,[33] tossed it
behind him and left the plateau, with Rey following close behind him. Despite
her repeated attempts, Skywalker declined to help her or the Resistance, even
though he knew that the girl had been sent by his sister Leia.[17] Secluding
himself in his hut, Skywalker thought to himself that he did not expect that
the person who found him would be a child with what he considered a worthless
antique and delusions of grandeur.[238]

comforted by the Wookiee, who hugged him, before Skywalker comforted Chewbacca
back.[238]

Skywalker learned that she had the Force within her and sought assistance to
understand it and her place in the galaxy. Skywalker refused to teach her
revealed that he had come to the place where the Jedi started in order to die,

Skywalker agreed to give Rey three lessons about the Force

The next night, the former Jedi Master slipped into the _Millennium Falcon_
and recalled the adventures he had experienced. While aboard, Skywalker
reunited with R2 who, after he insisted that he could not be convinced to
help, replayed Leia's holographic message to Kenobi. Although Skywalker
grumbled that the tactic "was a cheap move" on the droid's part, it
nevertheless inspired Skywalker to agree to give Rey some basic initiation
training as a Jedi, explaining the basic foundations of the Force.[17] R2 also
told Skywalker that she had grown up on a desert planet before discovered a
droid carrying secret data vital to the Rebellion, which he recognized a
similar story to his own. He approached Rey while she slept, telling her that
R2 had told him her story[238] and that he would give her three lessons to
both teach her the ways of the Jedi and also show her why the Order needed to
end.[17]

#### Revelations

    " _He would bring destruction, pain, death, and the end of everything I love because of what he will become. And for the briefest moment of pure instinct, I thought I could stop it. It passed like a fleeting shadow. And I was left with shame and with consequence. And the last thing I saw were the eyes of a frightened boy whose master had failed him._ "
    ―Luke Skywalker, about Ben Solo, to Rey[17]

An enraged Rey proceeded to battle Skywalker with her staff, only to be
swiftly disarmed[17] after stumbling over a stone,[243] leading to Rey
threatening him with his father's lightsaber. She revealed that, according to
Kylo, Skywalker had tried to murder him while he was asleep and defenseless
simply because he was afraid of his strength in the Force, sparking a duel
between Uncle and Nephew. Skywalker clarified that when he had arrived at the
hut, he sensed the power and darkness within his nephew and, for a brief
instant of absolute pure instinct, he did intend to kill him and activated his
lightsaber.. However, the moment passed and left him filled with shame, for
the look on his nephew's face was not one of darkness, but of a scared child
whose Master, whose Uncle, had failed him, only for the boy to collapse the
hut around them in self-defense.[17]

The spirit of Yoda communed with Skywalker, urging him to embrace failure as
the greatest teacher.

The following night, Skywalker returned to the tree containing the Jedi texts
with the intention of burning it to the ground. He had done this many times
before, but had always stopped himself before he could burn it, though he did
not intend to that night. As he approached the tree, his thoughts were
answered by a voice,[243] and when he turned he was greeted by the spirit of
his old master Yoda,[17] whom he had not seen in
[decades](/wiki/Standard_decade "Standard decade") since he last saw him on
Dagobah and Endor.[237] Skywalker affirmed his desire to burn the tree with
the texts inside.[17] Yoda informed him that he had no intentions of stopping
him and reminded him that had never been able to prevent him from doing what
he wanted.[243] Skywalker began to hesitate when he attempted to set the tree
on fire. Yoda instead proceeded to summon a bolt of lightning, setting the
tree alight and while laughing, repelled Skywalker with the flames when he
changed his mind and tried to save the texts.[17]

As the tree burned, the two masters sat next to each other

and Endor.[237] Skywalker affirmed his desire to burn the tree with

As the tree burned, the two masters sat next to each other and Yoda reminded
Skywalker that he needed to heed his final instructions to him before Yoda's
physical death on Dagobah, namely passing down what he had learned. Skywalker
lamented over the loss of the texts, but Yoda slyly stated that although the
texts held wisdom, 'page turners, they were not', and they did not contain
anything Rey did not already have with her. Skywalker tried to explain that by
failing Ben he felt that he had failed the Jedi. Yoda admonished Skywalker for
still "constantly looking to the horizon," like he had when they met on
Dagobah. Yoda explained that 'failure is the greatest teacher' and that
failure was an essential part of what he had implored Skywalker to pass on so
many years before.[17]

for last, as any good master would tell someone to do.[244] The illusion was
tailored to have the maximum effect on Ren, as Luke portrayed himself as he
had last appeared to his nephew before they came to blows. Likewise, he
portrayed himself as wielding Anakin Skywalker's lightsaber, knowing that it
would have more effect on Ren than if he had used his green blade.[246]

binary sunset was the last thing Skywalker saw as he passed away

Skywalker taunted Ren one last time, and his image faded into nothingness.
Light-years away, Skywalker collapsed from the mental stress necessary to
sustain such a lifelike illusion, which Ren realized meant that Luke would
become one with the Force. As he sat down on the cliff where he first trained
Rey, Luke beheld the twin suns of Ahch-To in their final descent towards the
horizon.[17] He had taken all his strength to project himself to Crait, but
now that it had been done, he could at least enjoy a few last breaths from the
island that had been his home. Luke Skywalker knew that he was going to die,
but it was something he accepted; death was the way of all things, even the
stars.[237] Though unsure if it was real or just a memory, Skywalker heard the
familiar and comforting voice of Obi-Wan Kenobi, urging him to let go, and so
he did.[239] Staring at a binary sunset on the horizon much like the one he
gazed upon as a boy, Luke Skywalker--Jedi Master, ace pilot, galactic legend,
and son of the Chosen One--passed away, joining his father and old masters as
one with the Force with a feeling of peace and purpose.[17] His final thoughts
were that his life in the realm of the living had ended in the same way it
began: by the light of two suns, until he stepped into [a larger
world](/wiki/Netherworld_of_the_Force "Netherworld of the Force").[244]

The spirit of Luke Skywalker appeared to Rey, encouraging her to continue her
Jedi path.

Following his death, Leia took up Luke's mantle as Rey's Jedi mentor, and
Skywalker's spirit continued to urge his sister to become one with the Force,
sensing her declining health, but she persistently refused until Rey and the
Resistance were ready to stand on their own.[208]

One year after becoming one with the Force, Luke spoke to Leia once more,
shortly before her death, beckoning her to show her son Ben she still loved
him, reminding his sister that if Vader could become Anakin again, Kylo Ren
could be Ben Solo again.[208] Shortly afterwards, he sensed that Rey had
discovered the truth behind her lineage and had stranded herself on Ahch-To
much like he did during the final years of his life. As she threw her
lightsaber into the wreckage of her ship, Luke appeared and grabbed it out of
the air. Admitting that he was wrong in exiling himself, Luke consoled her
that her legacy would not be defined by her bloodline but by her heart and her
actions. When Rey lamented that Kylo Ren destroyed the final Sith marker that
led to where the resurrected Emperor was residing, Luke mirrored the words

### Legacy

    " _The Rebellion is reborn today. The war is just beginning. And I will not be the last Jedi._ "
    ―Skywalker to Kylo Ren on the future, shortly before his death[17]

After his death, Skywalker's belongings, including his green lightsaber, were
gathered by the Caretakers and stored with the other Jedi artifacts that they
preserved alongside the temple on the Ahch-To island.[239] The tale of
Skywalker's stand against Ren and the First Order at Crait spread across the
galaxy. One instance occurred on [Canto Bight](/wiki/Canto_Bight "Canto
Bight"), where [Oniho Zaya](/wiki/Oniho_Zaya "Oniho Zaya") shared the story
with fellow urchins [Temiri Blagg](/wiki/Temiri_Blagg "Temiri Blagg") and
[Arashell Sar](/wiki/Arashell_Sar "Arashell Sar").[17][214] As word of this
moment spread, Skywalker's sacrifice showed others that it was possible to
stand defiant against the First Order, and his legend reinvigorated a spark of
hope.[4] However, Commander [Branwayne Spiftz](/wiki/Branwayne_Spiftz
"Branwayne Spiftz"), like some others in the First Order, did not believe the
story of Skywalker Force-projecting himself, and even thought that the Force
was not real and

and
[Arashell Sar](/wiki/Arashell_Sar "Arashell Sar").[17][214] As word of this
moment spread, Skywalker's sacrifice showed others that it was possible to

that if perhaps he had remained active as a Jedi Master, wielding his
lightsaber and actively fighting against his nephew, for the years he was in
exile instead, he probably could have prevented the rise of the First Order
and the destruction of the New Republic.[212] Additionally, Skywalker's loss
represented a heavy blow to the Resistance. When [Temmin
Wexley](/wiki/Temmin_Wexley "Temmin Wexley") and [Karé

former wingmate, asking himself if the Jedi were not supposed to [live
forever](/wiki/Immortality "Immortality").[248]

One of the most influential people in the entire galaxy, Luke Skywalker's
accomplishments were remembered for decades after the Battle of Endor. Within
the annals of the Resistance, basic training would see all pilots in its
[Starfighter Corps](/wiki/Resistance_Starfighter_Corps "Resistance Starfighter
Corps") learning the [Skywalker Swoop](/wiki/Skywalker_Swoop "Skywalker
Swoop"), which was based on Luke's piloting abilities during the Galactic
Civil War.[206] Many remembered him for destroying the Death Star and killing
the Emperor,[14] and as such viewed him as a hero of mythic proportions.[17]
Resistance pilot Jessika Pava considered Skywalker to be the greatest X-wing
pilot of all time.[250] Some questioned whether or not Luke could have used
his powers for evil,[14] while others simply viewed him as a myth.[8]
Skywalker's unlikely story of going from a simple farm boy on Tatooine to a
galactic legend gave hope to restless youths on a number of worlds.[251]

Luke Skywalker was once a farm boy who longed for a more exciting life.

In his youth, Skywalker was often curious, impatient, looking ahead to the
future with little regard for his present surroundings, and even a bit
brash.[237] Like his father, he was impulsive, reckless, and often had little
regard for his own personal safety.[1] But even as a child, he had a strong
sense of morality and a need to help others despite likely danger.[28] He
believed his aunt Beru was a sweet person in every part of her being.[131]
Some time after the Battle of Yavin, he would confer with Nakari Kelen that he
regretted his behavior before then, acknowledging he complained "about

Some time after the Battle of Yavin, he would confer with Nakari Kelen that he
regretted his behavior before then, acknowledging he complained "about
everything" because of his desire to escape from Tatooine.[51] He also
acknowledged his scarce talent at lying,[51] a trait that many people could
infer.[65] He once confided in Leia that he felt Tatooine had never felt like
a home to him,[92] and did not like to be seen as just a farm boy[86] though
later took pride in where he came from and his past.[100][130] He was annoyed
by both Solo and Aphra calling him "kid."[86]

He struggled with anger and feelings of wanting revenge, especially toward
Queen Trios because she had betrayed the Alliance, despite knowing they could
be dangerous for someone who used the Force. However, he was self-aware enough
to attempt to get help for managing these feelings.[116] While working for the
Alliance, he got annoyed when he was assigned missions that he considered
menial.[100] He could be paranoid of getting caught by Imperials and did not
want to take risks when it was not needed. When he held one of the lightsabers
of Darth Atrius, Skywalker was overcome by incredible rage, which one even
caused an episode where he dissociated from his body and killed many
stormtroopers. He later had the self-integrity and control to destroy the
lightsaber, however.[55] Similarly, when controlled by an Abersyn symbiote,
Skywalker became obsessed with power and dominating others, but eventually
rejected the raw power that the Rur crystal suggested it could offer because
he would not truly be like a Jedi and have their freedom.[88] He was somewhat
traumatized by his experience with Grakkus the Hutt and became weary of those
that were very interested in the

Luke Skywalker after the Battle of Yavin

After everything they went through at the Battle of Yavin, Skywalker took
pride in his membership of Red Squadron and found kinship with them, but did
not love the attention and honor he received for being the one to take the
final shot. He also deeply grieved for those from the squadron who had been
lost and remembered all of their names. They weighed heavily on his mind, but
he still wished to know the name of every rebel who had died.[101] He
especially remembered and looked up to Jyn Erso and the rest of Rogue One,
taking to heart their belief in going rogue to do what was right, and naming
Rogue Squadron after them.[107] However, he still retained a sense of
confidence and excitement about the Alliance's chances of beating the
Empire[108] and surviving the Death Star gave him greater

shot. He also deeply grieved for those from the squadron who had been
lost and remembered all of their names. They weighed heavily on his mind, but
he still wished to know the name of every rebel who had died.[101] He
especially remembered and looked up to Jyn Erso and the rest of Rogue One,
taking to heart their belief in going rogue to do what was right, and naming
Rogue Squadron after them.[107] However, he still retained a sense of
confidence and excitement about the Alliance's chances of beating the
Empire[108] and surviving the Death Star gave him greater confidence that he
would survive other events.[109] He became determined to take down the Empire,
and determined to become a Jedi in order to do so despite the risk.[123] Upon
becoming leader of Rogue Squadron, Skywalker came to believe that it was the
best team in the galaxy.[129]

#### Trials of the self and the Force

However, in the immediate aftermath of losing his hand, Skywalker was
incredibly distraught and haunted by traumatic flashbacks of the events on
Cloud City, what he had lost, and what Vader revealed to him. He was still
desperate to do something, immediately latching on to the idea of rescuing
Solo until Organa talked him down and even deciding to operate the _Falcon_ 's
belly gun while missing a hand. During this time he was desperate for
guidance, consumed by anger and fear, and questioned if he should even be a
Jedi.[140] He initially did not even want to get a prosthetic hand, because he
felt it made him feel less like himself and more like Vader.[141]

Overall, as his skills in the Force progressed, and especially after losing a
hand to Darth Vader, Skywalker became more patient and seasoned.[199] He was
often seen as having wisdom beyond his years.[10][45] He came to decisively
accept his path as a Jedi and started to understand that having a lightsaber
did not define him as a Jedi and that being one was about using the Force to
bring light to the galaxy.[144] He held on to Yoda's teachings and repeated
them to try and focus and overcome obstacles.[145] He stayed committed to his
path as a Jedi, determined to help a suffering galaxy, even when Verla tried
to dissuade him from it by revealing what it cost her. He

to dissuade him from it by revealing what it cost her. He also was inspired by
a seeing an old Jedi outpost and was determined to fight for what was right no
matter the risk just like they did.[146] He felt the Force flow through his
being as a whole and did not localize it, meaning the loss of his hand did not
physically limit him.[187]

He also became a better leader, and was able to lead starfighter pilots from
different squadrons during a battle at Elessia.[148] He took things that were
important to him very seriously, and was irritated when Aphra attempted to
turn something important to him into a joke.[180] He started to warn against
cockiness and advocated for having a level head.[130][129] He developed more
confidence in himself and in the Force, and when he focused on it became more
capable.[124] He also once declared his love of sand when he ended up a on a
beach after nearly drowning.[145]

After discovering an ancient Jedi text, Skywalker became determined and
committed to studying it and used the rare free time he had to do so instead
of relaxing. However, he still often doubted his abilities despite others
believing in him[170] and his attempts to affirm himself in his
abilities,[173] and started to believe that without the text he would never
become a Jedi.[172] Despite this, he would still encourage his friends and
affirm their abilities[173] and valued teamwork tremendously.[130]

After losing the text, he became increasingly determined and focused on
recovering the text, to the the point of small outbursts of aggression while
fighting his way to it and ignoring any danger that might come with doing
so.[172] His self-doubt continued to evolve into feeling like he would never
truly be able to become a Jedi, leaving him wanting to take

become a Jedi.[172] Despite this, he would still encourage his friends and

was useless and would not be able to save people, and[180] wrongly[199]
worried Organa viewed him as pathetic[180] and did not want to disappoint
her.[55]

Before meeting Yoda, Skywalker was desperate for a teacher in the Force and
dreamed of being able to do all the things Kenobi had been able to.[121]
Because of this, Skywalker was quick to go along with Aphra's plan to go with
her to the Screaming Citadel because of the promise of a Jedi teacher and
learning Jedi knowledge despite his knowledge of Aphra's
untrustworthiness.[86] He eventually rejected the Rur crystal because he
recognized that it was not a Jedi in practice and belief and only in
knowledge, and came to realize that he could not take shortcuts like Aphra did
to get what he wanted and urged her to stay away.[88] He also immediately
trusted and begged for training from Werla Calip when she said she knew the
Force despite having no proof of this,[123] and started to believe that signs
Calip was not what she seemed and her beliefs were not morally sound was Calip
testing him. This naivete led to Calip stealing his lightsaber from him.[125]
When she revealed that she did not know the Force and her trainings were
empty, Skywalker believed that there was more to her than it seemed.[127]

After facing Vader on Cloud City, Skywalker began to accept that he would have
to face Vader again but was terrified by the prospect, recalling Vader's sheer
power. He hoped that he could tap into great power and defeat him, but doubted
he

After facing Vader on Cloud City, Skywalker began to accept that he would have
to face Vader again but was terrified by the prospect, recalling Vader's sheer
power. He hoped that he could tap into great power and defeat him, but doubted
he could, and was haunted by imagining himself facing Darth Vader again in his
current state and being killed by the Sith Lord. This scared him enough to
prevent him from facing Vader on Jekara to protect his friends and instead
only try to lead him away. His fear also prevented him from being able to
reach the Force consistently or speak to Kenobi, contributing to his feelings
of loneliness and sense that he was not ready.[157] Despite not wanting to
face Vader on Jekara, he remained confident that he would become a Jedi and
confront him one day.[161]

Even after training with Yoda, his loneliness grew, and he became frustrated
with Yoda for not responding to him and answering him through the Force.[183]
He enthusiastically and desperately wanted to search for old Jedi temples and
outposts to learn more about the Order.[150] He eventually decided that while
he was grateful for what Yoda taught him, he would rather just learn from his
text.[183] In the end, however, he would decide to return to Yoda to complete
his training.[10] According to Yoda, when he arrived he had developed a clear
"gaping need" for a connection to his father and to have a family.[192] While
he did demand answers as for whether Vader was his father and wanted to know
why it was "unfortunate" for him to know, he was saddened by the news that
Yoda was passing.[10] Skywalker promised Organa he could train her as Yoda
trained him.[199]

#### Growing values and beliefs

Despite all he went through, Skywalker still retained his idealistic
viewpoint, willing to think the best of anyone,[51] and believing that Vader
was redeemable.[10] Despite not thinking so immediately, Skywalker still
believed that Doctor Aphra was a good person and her friend despite her prior
service to the Empire, and went out of his way to save her life. He believed
that she would see sense when it came to her belief in the Empire and was
convinced that she could move past the bad things she had went through to be a
better person like Solo had.[89] He wanted to make a difference in the galaxy
however he could in ways both big and small[100] and believed that you could
accomplish many things with just the help of one's friends.[128] He grew to
truly believe that anything was possible.[187]

He was also unable to ignore those who needed help, sometimes to the point of
endangering missions for the sake of saving someone else's life, as his father
would throughout the Clone Wars.[12][51] He was dedicated to saving lives, and
once stood up to General Dodonna to convince him to save others even at their
own expense.[112] Even when he knew he likely could not beat Vader, he still
went to help his friends against him,[127] and was brave enough to fight him
and put himself in danger so that his friends Chewbacca and R2-D2 could escape
and live.[128] He was willing to risk important equipment to save the lives of
Kes Dameron and Shara Bey.[132] He was willing to help save Lando Calrissian
at a time when they did not know each other well even though Skywalker did not
trust him and was struggling with using the Force.[141]

Throughout his life, Skywalker had always been filled with a need to be
helpful and recognized that that need had steered him toward fighting with the
Rebel Alliance.[131] Organa even thought he could be neurotic about always
wanting to

could escape
and live.[128] He was willing to risk important equipment to save the lives of

at a time when they did not know each other well even though Skywalker did not
trust him and was struggling with using the Force.[141]

Throughout his life, Skywalker had always been filled with a need to be
helpful and recognized that that need had steered him toward fighting with the
Rebel Alliance.[131] Organa even thought he could be neurotic about always
wanting to be out in the fight and on the front lines.[110] He was incredibly
sympathetic to those in need and wanted to help them even when other's around
him did not.[86] He helped others in need immediately and without question
even if he did not know them, like he did with Werla Calip,[122] and later
tried to convince her to go on a mission and take action with him to save many
lives[123][126] which was successful.[127] His faith in her turned out to be
justified as she later helped the Alliance and saved his life.[128] He
continued to always believe in an encourage others, especially his
friends,[129] and his faith that Aphra had good in her was also somewhat
proven right when she helped hide Echo Base from the Empire.[133]

He also had a strong sense of justice, and was determined to make Ajax Sigma
answer for the people he killed,[176] but on a smaller scale repeatedly and
fiercely stood up to Urtya on the behalf of Organa and Lee-Char.[102][104] He
believed that the Partisans plan to kill millions on Shu-Torun as payback to
the Empire was not just or fair,[118] and was even willing to sacrifice his
life if it meant they would not be able to do it.[119] He was willing to go
against direct orders from a superior if he believed he was doing what was
right.[109] He was against killing, once telling Verla that he did not kill
defenseless and certainly not unconscious people, which was why he did not try
to kill her even though she tried to kill him.[146] He became frustrated with
Partisans unnecessarily taking lives,[115] and even did not want to even speak
to

to
the Empire was not just or fair,[118] and was even willing to sacrifice his

He was incredibly kind and reassuring, even to droids,[108] and especially
kind to kids, and was considerate towards one named Forvan he had just met
while in No-Space and was concerned for his well-being.[173] When the boy
started to believe that Skywalker would save him from being trapped in No-
Space, Skywalker was sure to not get his hopes up, but still assured the boy
that he would do everything he could to try to free them and help them,
demonstrating his unconditional care for others.[172] Skywalker cared deeply
for his friends, and could intuitively tell when something was bothering
Organa or she was not acting like herself.[155] Doctor Aphra believed he was
good of heart, though in her opinion he was too good.[177] He told her that he
was committed to helping protect her from Vader because it was what Jedi did.
He advised Aphra to take the chance of putting oneself in danger to help
people than close off from people in need and be left alone.[181] After the
Battle on Epikonia, he willingly stayed behind with Organa, wanting to help
the people affected by the Scourge there. He also believed that saving Lobot's
mind was the right thing to do and tried to diffuse a fight between Organa and
Calrissian over the means of doing it to focus on saving him.[185]

#### Later life

    " _I failed. Because I was Luke Skywalker. Jedi Master. A legend._ "  
" _The galaxy may need a legend._ "

    ―Luke Skywalker and Rey[17]

Leia Organa took note of Skywalker's change into a calmer man as he became a
Jedi Knight, thinking of the change in regard to the years that had past:
while he was somewhat like other rebels who had joined the fight hopeful, only
for those rebels to become jaded over the course of the war, Organa noticed a
much deeper stillness within him. While she knew he was the same person, she
did nearly mourn the loss of Skywalker's innocent optimism and excitement. All
the same, she saw how forgiving Skywalker was towards their father and
pondered how it was possible for him to not hate Vader the way she did;
Skywalker tried to tell her about Anakin Skywalker's redemption to the light,
but she refused to listen. Skywalker was incredibly happy for his sister and
Solo's marriage. He also offered to train her in the ways of the Force,
thinking they could be wonderful together as Jedi Knights, and gave her a
chance to come with him on his hunt for information about the Jedi of the
past. While he did not see it as Organa needing to chose between a life with
Solo or a life as a Jedi, Organa did and declined.[199]

Following the end of the Empire and the death of the Sith Order, Skywalker
came to have great hope for the future of the Jedi, coming to believe that if
a single Jedi could help bring back balance to the Force, then a restored Jedi
Order perhaps could maintain that achieved peace and prevent the dark side of
the Force from ever regaining its hold on [the galaxy](/wiki/The_galaxy "The
galaxy"). This belief led Luke to scour worlds for the remaining Jedi texts
and gathered a new class of apprentices under his tutelage.[212] During his
brief time as Grogu's master, Luke had to suppress his more sentimental side
and be more professional in an effort to successfully pass on the Jedi values
to the

Jedi, coming to believe that if
a single Jedi could help bring back balance to the Force, then a restored Jedi
Order perhaps could maintain that achieved peace and prevent the dark side of
the Force from ever regaining its hold on [the galaxy](/wiki/The_galaxy "The
galaxy"). This belief led Luke to scour worlds for the remaining Jedi texts
and gathered a new class of apprentices under his tutelage.[212] During his
brief time as Grogu's master, Luke had to suppress his more sentimental side
and be more professional in an effort to successfully pass on the Jedi values
to the child.[223] Skywalker became confident in his abilities as a Jedi
Master as he became perceived as a legend. He was confident that he could take
down seven Knights of Ren on his own, and expressed to them that he was
superior at using the Force than them, even slightly taunting them and
predicting that they would leave crying. This confidence was justified, as he
did successfully defeat them. He also cared deeply for his nephew Ben Solo,
and was happy when Solo joined him on missions. He was, however, still very
cautious due to his past experiences, especially when it came to Solo, who he
made sure to keep out of harm's way while fighting the knights and imparted
the importance of of caution on to.[227]

In his later years, Skywalker lived in exile as a grief-ridden and embittered
hermit.

After Ben Solo, his nephew, betrayed him and killed most of his apprentices,
Skywalker became embittered as well as grief-ridden and chose to exile himself
to the planet Ahch-To, where he would spend the rest of his life in with the
intention of dying where the Jedi began to forever end the Jedi.[17] Despite
all of this, he still comforted Chewbacca when he learned of Han Solo's death,
and became even more riddled with guilt.[238] He also became more cautious in
teaching others of immense power due to Solo's betrayal, feeling finished with
the Jedi Order,[252] as evidenced by when he initially regarded Rey as a
delusional child,[238] initially refused to train her, and when he would later
decide to abruptly end their lessons after seeing her drawn towards the dark
side.[17] Part of this was because he was deeply terrified by how much she
reminded him of himself.[241] He also now believed that there was no hope for
those who fell to the dark side, as shown when he openly expressed that he
believed there was no hope

others of immense power due to Solo's betrayal, feeling finished with
the Jedi Order,[252] as evidenced by when he initially regarded Rey as a
delusional child,[238] initially refused to train her, and when he would later
decide to abruptly end their lessons after seeing her drawn towards the dark
side.[17] Part of this was because he was deeply terrified by how much she
reminded him of himself.[241] He also now believed that there was no hope for
those who fell to the dark side, as shown when he openly expressed that he
believed there was no hope for Kylo Ren to return to the light.[17] By this
point, Skywalker had come to regard Ren as his responsibility and his greatest
failure.[212] However, Rey helped him realize that in disconnecting himself
from the Force, he had abandoned those he loved in selfish pity, which he was
determined to rectify.[242]

However, after Yoda's spirit encouraged him that Rey was the Jedi's hope,
Skywalker finally realized his wrongs and chose to help the Resistance.
Despite his lost faith in his nephew, Skywalker showed great remorse for
failing to stop his fall to the dark side, and for himself ending up being the
turning point in Solo's fall.[17] Skywalker realized that instead of blaming
himself, he blamed the Jedi for his failures. His belief of the Jedi being
romanticized deities with a legacy of failure remained, but gained realization
that if one stripped away the sacred temples, lightsabers, and even the
legends about them, they were just good people the galaxy needed.[212] In the
end, Skywalker willingly sacrificed himself for the Jedi to be revived and the
Resistance to live on. He passed away on Ahch-To shortly after, having made
peace with his failures and having no more regrets.[17]

#### Romances

Based on observing Owen and Beru Lars, Skywalker grew up believing in showing
his love to people rather than telling them. When he and Nakari Kelen fell in
love, he demonstrated his feelings for her, but he did not tell her how he
felt; he regretted that as grieved for her death alongside the then-recent
losses of his aunt, uncle, and Obi-Wan Kenobi.[51] While stranded on
[Hubin](/wiki/Hubin "Hubin"), Skywalker was instantly smitten with [Tula
Markona](/wiki/Tula_Markona "Tula Markona")[253] and they shared a kiss,[254]
but it would be a one-time event. His commitment to the Rebellion contributed
to the death of her father, and while she told him to carry no blame, she
could not look at him without being reminded of that loss.[255] When he
mentioned he previously had a brief attraction to Chelli Lona Aphra, Aphra's
ex-girlfriend, Sana Starros told him to count himself lucky that Aphra was not
interested in men.[86] Skywalker and Reyé Hollis each appreciated the other
man's smile and pleasantly-scented hair.[131]

Skywalker was an accomplished duelist who triumphed over his father, Darth
Vader.

Though he received little training, Luke Skywalker had a natural talent for
lightsaber combat.[9] Luke's initial training with the weapon of the Jedi came
during a brief session with Obi-Wan Kenobi and a training remote on the way to
Alderaan,[1] where he learned the initial position and the four defensive
postures.[45] Though his level proved inadequate during his first, brief duel
against Darth Vader on Cymoon 1,[60] his combat skills had improved for their
duel on Bespin,[9] and culminated with him besting the Sith Lord in combat
during the Battle of Endor.[10]

Like most Jedi, Skywalker was adept at redirecting blaster fire,[1][51][10]
and eventually was able to do it while flipping.[124] During his
[mission](/wiki/Mission_to_Rodia_\(Luke_Skywalker\) "Mission to Rodia \(Luke
Skywalker\)") to Rodia, he tried his hand at [Jar'Kai](/wiki/Jar%27Kai
"Jar'Kai") for the first time with his and Huulik's lightsaber. Although he
killed a ghest, he admitted that it had

of Endor.[10]

Like most Jedi, Skywalker was adept at redirecting blaster fire,[1][51][10]
and eventually was able to do it while flipping.[124] During his

"Jar'Kai") for the first time with his and Huulik's lightsaber. Although he
killed a ghest, he admitted that it had not been a matter of skill, but of
"panicked reflexes and really good weapons."[51] He received further training
from the "Gamemaster," a servant of Grakkus the Hutt, who had learned the art
of lightsaber combat. Forced to fight him and the Hutt's MagnaGuards,
Skywalker improved his cursory abilities.[68] He was able to fight and defeat
Kreel of SCAR Squadron in lightsaber combat, with help from utilizing his
surroundings,[100] and could easily take down Imperial droids.[124]

After a brief time of training with Yoda, Skywalker revealed himself to be a
gifted duelist on Bespin. Skywalker engaged Vader in a fierce duel and managed
to hold his own for much of the duel, wounding Vader in the shoulder,
impressing the Dark Lord with his skill, though Vader ultimately bested his
son and cut off his hand, proving his superiority.[9] After recovering from
his loss to Vader, Luke defeated the spirit of Grand Inquisitor in a duel on
Tempes. The Inquisitor insulted his lightsaber ability and suggested that he
fought like a child, but Skywalker was still able to defeat him.[146]

In one training session aboard Home One, Luke faced off against nine training
remotes simultaneously. He easily destroyed the remotes in quick succession,
finishing the last one off while in the middle of a conversation with
C-3PO.[150] However, when he attempted to fight killdroids with his lightsaber
while in No-Space, he first believed that the droids were resistant to
lightsabers,[173] before realizing that they were not resistant, he just had
not been focused and one with the Force. After re-centering himself, Skywalker
was able

still able to defeat him.[146]

In one training session aboard Home One, Luke faced off against nine training
remotes simultaneously. He easily destroyed the remotes in quick succession,
finishing the last one off while in the middle of a conversation with
C-3PO.[150] However, when he attempted to fight killdroids with his lightsaber
while in No-Space, he first believed that the droids were resistant to
lightsabers,[173] before realizing that they were not resistant, he just had
not been focused and one with the Force. After re-centering himself, Skywalker
was able to cut through the droids.[174] He also successfully defeated the
droid Ajax Sigma using a lightsaber, though the droid escaped.[176] He also
fought many droids on Epikonia and was able to take many down with his
lightsaber by consistently focusing on staying calm and concentrating on the
Force.[185]

Skywalker showed his abilities in battle during the rescue of Han Solo, where
a skirmish ensued in which the Jedi killed many guards aboard the execution
skiff and Jabba's sail barge. Later, on board the second Death Star, Skywalker
showed his improved abilities and was finally able to duel Vader on an even
footing. However, his unwillingness to fight his own father partly held him
back; but when Vader threatened to turn Leia to the dark side, an enraged
Skywalker unleashed all of his raw ability, overwhelming and defeating the
Sith Lord.[10]

Like his father, Skywalker possessed a uniquely powerful connection to the
Force, and became one of the most powerful Force wielders in galactic history.
Indeed, Darth Sidious feared Skywalker and believed that he was strong enough
in the Force to destroy the Sith.[9] Most of Luke's understanding of the Force
came from his own research, exploration, and experience as he only had a few
days Kenobi's mentorship before his demise, Yoda's one year of mentorship
before he died of old age, and Kenobi's sporadic guidance from beyond the
Netherworld of the Force.[1][45][12][9]

After learning the basics of the Force, he quickly learned how to
[sense](/wiki/Force_sense "Force sense") through it,[1] and took the habit of
opening himself to the Force in hopes of learning more than Kenobi had told
him, and becoming aware of his surroundings.[51][12] In time, he would also
learn to sense the presence of his father, and telepathically calling his
sister.[10][9] He was capable of seeing and hearing those who had become one
with the Force.[1][9][10] By using the Force during the Battle of Yavin, he
managed to destroy the Death Star with a shot that many thought was
impossible.[1]

After obtaining Huulik's lightsaber and dismantling it to know his inner
workings, Skywalker surmised on his own that the Force could be used to
manipulate matter in the manner of telekinesis and managed to learn how to
move small objects, such as a noodle or a fork.[51] However, he struggled to
use telekinesis on command[87] but could do it in moments of great danger and
emotion.[86] He also struggled with reaching out and locating things or people
at this time.[122] While under the influence of an Abersyn symbiote, he gained
incredible psychic power that he started to use to fight the Queen of
Ktath'atn in a mindscape before rejecting the power that it and the Rur
crystal offered.[88]

By the time of the Battle of Hoth, Skywalker had the ability to pull his
lightsaber to his hands, though not without difficulty. Under Yoda's

command[87] but could do it in moments of great danger and
emotion.[86] He also struggled with reaching out and locating things or people
at this time.[122] While under the influence of an Abersyn symbiote, he gained

By the time of the Battle of Hoth, Skywalker had the ability to pull his

lost, he lashed out with the Force, hurtling a squadron of Tie Fighters into
each other. In another outburst, he accidentally cracked the window of a
starship while desperately trying and failing to contact Yoda.[140] However,
he regained his connection when he tried to reach out for his lightsaber and
had a vision of Verla and that Organa was in trouble. He then was able to
deactivate many carbonite blocks with people inside all at once with the Force
and free them.[144] He was able to use the Force to anticipate and avoid many
booby traps set by Verla in a cave. He was also able to hold back water
flooding in to a trap from the ocean with the Force long enough to convince
Verla to deactivate it.[145] Despite his connection to the Force still being
somewhat unreliable,[157] Vader sensed that Skywalker's strength and
connection in the Force had grown significantly.[160]

the [mind trick](/wiki/Mind_trick "Mind trick").[256] He could use the Force

and was able to use it to sense others' emotions and intentions.[173] He was
also proficient in being able to hurl foes away, or [damage all nearby
foes](/wiki/Force_repulse "Force repulse").[201] Luke could use the Force

reflections of the Temple's walls, which were designed to project Force

reflection.[181]

Prior to the Battle of Endor, Skywalker once attempted to purify a red kyber

unsteadiness of the Force at that time left him trapped in his vision until

night, the Force would also always be there. Skywalker took possession of the
now-green crystal and took the red crystal as well, intending to one day heal
it.[183]

galaxy quickly with Skywalker as his apprentice.[236]

When using the force to restrain an archeologist possessed by a Sith spirit on
Yoturba, Luke had to concentrate very carefully to restrain his power so that

starfighter and its pilot from being completely obliterated.[7] When facing

telekinetically disarmed and destroyed their weapons.[227]

After the fall of Ben Solo and the destruction of his Jedi Temple, Skywalker
spent years himself how to close himself off from the Force, an ability he
considered much more difficult than reaching out to it in the first
place.[238] Shortly after reopening himself to the Force, Luke detected Rey
and Ren's bond and in his anger, he Force pushed Rey's hut into pieces around
the two and broke the connection. When defending himself against Rey, Luke
pried an antenna from the roof of a hut and summoned it to himself in seconds,
then managed to keep himself suspended off the ground after being knocked down
by Rey. Whereas Ren noted that the effort of attempting Force projection would
kill Rey, Skywalker was able to use the complete version of this ability; he
gave all of himself into the Force, which allowed him to interact with
others[4] by sending a life-like image of himself across the galaxy to
distract Kylo Ren and the First Order. The projection was so powerful that
C-3PO acknowledged his presence, and Ren was tricked into believing it was the
real him. Skywalker maintained it for a prolonged period of time, although the
strain ultimately proved to be fatal and killed the Jedi Master.[17]

Skywalker was one of the few Jedi who was able to truly become one with the
Force and preserve his consciousness as a Force spirit. As a Force spirit,
Skywalker was able to physically interact with the living world, which he
demonstrated when he caught the Skywalker lightsaber after Rey threw it, and
when he lifted his X-wing from the oceans of Ahch-To and repaired it so that
she could travel to Exegol.[15]
